description:
If you're a meat lover then this is your spot!!

Food: I came here on a friday night and the line was surprisingly not too bad! We were seated right away. While waiting for foor I went to the self serve salad bar to grab some fruits and appetizers. There are sooo many options - but def save room for the actual meats. Their cheesy bread, which is also unlimited, is SO GOOD. It's really chewy but at the same time has the most amazing texture - it's like eating a mochi cheesy bread!! My favorites were the top sirloin and ribeye. I would personally stay away from the wings - pretty mediocre and not worth the price. I love how they cut everything in front of you, and they alternated pretty fast so I never had to wait around for too long for another speciality to be served. Do be strategic - sometimes they pile meat on your plate and you totally forget what you actually like. I think they might charge extra for anything that you don't finish. 

Price & Portions: Unlimited - all you can eat! BUT it is around $65 per person and even more after tax and tip. 

Service & Ambiance: Really nice place, great for date nights, group gatherings, and other special occasions! The place is very clean and well-kept. The workers are friendly and personable, I would recommend!
author: Yixuan L.

description:
I'm not quite sure why this place is still earning so many stars. I'm giving them these stars based on their nice decor and good service but the quality of the meat was so bad. The meats were either bland, overcooked, or super salty. 

What really pissed us off was their sly way of getting expensive a la carte items on your table. They walked around with trays of shrimp cocktails and was very quick to put it down with no mention that it's not included in the dinner. After about four shrimp cocktails in, I stopped the waiter to asked if it was included and he said no. However, he didn't know the cost.  It ended up being 21.00 each! This is my second time trying Fogo but I won't be back anymore.
author: Trinny T.

description:
Came here for a work dinner so thankfully I did not have to pay $64 (yikes) for the full churrasco experience. I did have quite a lot of fun but knowing that the total was more than $100/pp after wine, tip, and tax makes me not want to come back on my own dime.

PROS:
CHEESY BREAD - Probably my favorite thing about Fogo de Chao. Yes, even more than their steak. I don't care if cheesy bread is a ploy to make you full.. I'll take another basket.
VARIETY - This is perhaps the main reason to come here and why Fogo is always so much fun. Carbs, veggies, meats of all kinds.
SOMETHING FOR EVERYONE - Meatlovers rejoice. We came with a vegan who enjoyed the salad bar and sides. 
SERVICE - Service is prompt and good. The owner came by to make sure everything was coming out at a good pace. They definitely care about how they treat their diners. If you're looking for a cut of meat that hasn't come around, just ask and they'll send it over.
STRONG DRINKS - Everyone at my table said their cocktails were very strong.
EASY RESERVATIONS - Man, last minute reservations are so hard to come by in SF unless you want a 10pm dinner slot. Thankfully, Fogo normally has availability.

CONS:
PRICE - I wouldn't say $65 is worth it if you want the best quality cuts of meat - for that, I'd recommend a traditional steakhouse instead. 
TOO SALTY - The majority of dishes were oversalted. One prime sirloin in particular was the saltiest thing I've ever had at a restaurant. My speculation is that they do this to make us drink more water and get bloated so we stop eating.
DESSERTS - The flan was overly sweet in a way I couldn't even finish it (and I love flan). The creme brulee was too sweet too but bearable.
author: Sally L.

description:
Come here if you love MEAT! Because what's the point in paying $65ish a person without tax and tip for some grass (aka veggies)???

Came here on a Saturday night just because sometimes I like fancy date nights with my boo. I remember the last time I went to my first Brazilian steakhouse Espetus, I had done it all wrong! I ate cheese bread, grilled pineapple, and more cheese bread and very little meat.This time, I came armed with a killer strategy.

The plan was to have a very light breakfast, go running during the day, nap, and then have dinner. Bad idea! I nearly fainted from my run because I hadn't consumed enough sugars to sustain my energy. But it's okay I was alive to make it to my reservation and didn't have to forfeit. 

The trick is to save your plate and stomach real estate for the meat, the flesh, the prize. Don't go marinating along the salad bar or feasting on the appetizers, IT'S A TRAP! DON'T DO IT. DO NOT TOUCH.

Because you will lose precious real estate by doing so and missing out on the most delicious meat your sharp little fangs have ever sliced.

My favorites: Top Sirloin, Bottom Sirloin, and BEEF RIB! The whole time I was trying to track down the beef rib guy who went on a break so his apprentice was walking around lost. Beef ribs are so soft and delicious and they just scream cow. 

The only thing I would dock points for is their lack of grilled pineapple. I think the grilled pineapple is very much so a palate cleanser and not to mention the fruit enzymes help break down the meat.

All in all, it was a solid date night. I don't think I ate so much meat in one sitting in my life but thank goodness I was being extra strategic and wore a skirt. A skirt or fancy stretchy pants are always a good tactic for AYCE.

Stick with the sirloins and beef ribs. Avoid the chicken filler, salad bar, and tasty bread and garlic mash potato offerings, it's a TRAP.
author: Connie M.

description:
Good Brazilian BBQ at a well-known chain.

We were in the area, and my husband wanted a decent bottle of wine with dinner. Without reservations, we were able to walk into Fogo de Chao and get seated within 5 minutes (on a weeknight).

The great thing about these places is that food is either served  by the wandering waiters or at the buffet, so there's very little wait for food. Getting a server (for drink orders or the bill) is a different story, but I can live with that.

Food is good. I enjoyed the lamb and steak the most.  You do need to have a huge appetite to really get the most out of the experience.
author: michelle l.

description:
We came as a large party of 12. We had initially made RSVP @ 5pm in open table without any problems one weeks prior to our dinner. We finished the SF Giants ballgame early and called ahead to see if they could accommodate us at 4:30, which they were able to do. The place is pretty empty until after 6pm. 

The marketplace options of fruit and salad were fresh and plentiful. The servers were attentive and came around with freshly cooked meat. They did a wonderful job. The desserts were great- recommend the flan & chocolate lava cake. The cheese bread& plantain  were fresh and flavorful. I really like the garlic steak and their fresh salad and fruit bar. 

We were there to celebrate my father in-law's bday and the blonde hostess with a heavy accent had insulted us on three separate occasions to a point that it was ruining everyone's meal and our celebration. I asked to speak to the manager & Mylee listened to my concerns and apologized profusely. She even came to our table a few minutes later to speak to my family & wish my FIL as happy birthday. It was a nice touch and greatly appreciated. Mylee saved our evening & Fogo's did a great job having her as the manager. I have never in my life, had such poor service (from the hostess), someone who was just being completely outright rude from a high end restaurant.
author: Andrea K.

description:
Been to fogo in LA a couple times so decided to try the one in SF. Pretty disappointed.

I'll get straight to the point since fogo is more or less the same everywhere. 

Service/management is awful 1/5 stars:
-waiters/waitresses had no coordination would do redundant things such as give us a check or ask if there was anyone celebrating something multiple times. 

-waiters/waitresses have varying knowledge of fogo policies. The first waiter told us that corkage would be waived if we bought a bottle (so we ended up doing that) but the waitress at the end gave us a check that included both bottle and corkage fee. Although we later had it fixed. 

-again lack of coordination/memory. The first waitress said we would get a complimentary dessert as we were celebrating today but they never gave us anything in the end. 

The food quality was just decent - we asked for medium filet mignon and it came out pretty rare.. given the price, there are better options around for Brazilian bbq.
author: Bryan C.

description:
What a great experience at this location. We were greeted right at the door, we had reservations for a birthday and they sat us right away. Our waiter was Miles and he went over everything. Some people feel the whole experience which is all meat and salad bar is too expensive or just too much for a small appetite. Miles went over everything and even mentioned the August special which was the salad bar and most the meat but not all for about $39. I went for that lol and they gave us pretty much all the meat, the garlic sirloin was to die for. 

The salad bar has everything you can imagine from vegetables, to meats, to fruits and rice and beans. There is no way you won't get full over here and everything is so delicious. Once done John David came over to our table and asked us how everything was.. He mentioned for the dessert to try the Brazilian flan. Let me say this is the best flan I have ever had in my life. It was really thick and the taste was just amazing. This is definitely a location to try out.
author: Alexandra A.

description:
Pros:
- Lots of meat, and it comes fast. When you flip your card over to green, the servers bombard you with tons of different cuts of meat. The best was the bacon-wrapped filet mignon. The different sirloin cuts, the garlic sirloin, and the ribeye were good too. Didn't try the other meats but they also had bacon wrapped chicken, chicken legs, Parmesan crusted pork, pork chops, and lamb sirloin. I did not see any chicken hearts or ribs. 
- the market table has a pretty decent selection. I liked the smoked salmon and the fresh watermelon and pineapple. It was refilled often and quickly.
- The cheesy bread is to die for. I could eat that all day.

Cons:
- Pricey, at $62 per person for weekday dinner before tax and tip.
- The sides were not that good. The fries were cold and hard. 
- Service was terrible after we were finished eating. No one came to clear our plates or check in on us for forever. It took a long time to get the check.
- No acknowledgement that we were celebrating a birthday (even though I clearly wrote it in the Open Table reservation), no happy birthday wishes, dessert, or anything. I'm pretty disappointed by this since every other high end restaurant does this, and does it well. 
- No validated parking in a busy area, and valet is $20.

Verdict: it's pretty good, but for the price I would rather eat at the Capital Grille, where I feel like the service is better.
author: Amy C.

description:
I have never been a big fan of Brazilian BBQ. The price to quantity ratio doesn't work out for those who can't eat that much. But what is good about this type of food is that no ordering is necessary and there's something available for everyone.

For that reason, the bf decided to host a group dinner at Fogo de Chao, where he invited 20 of his closest friends from our MBA program to show his appreciation. It was easy to make the reservation for a big group. We were provided the wine list in advance and were able to research and select wine for the table. The only thing is that the actual wine list turned out to be about 5-10% more expensive than the version we were given originally.

Service was good and the servers took video and photos of our group. As expected, there was tons of meat. The restaurant also comped a few desserts at the end, which was really nice. It was the perfect place for the occasion we were celebrating. But as you can imagine, dinner for 20+ and quite a few bottles of wine did not come out cheap.
author: Yi Z.

description:
SO MUCH MEAT. But you already knew that. Came here with a large group to celebrate a birthday and when we finally settled down to receive meat, I was SO overwhelmed. We didn't receive a MENU to explain the meats, so we just had multiple people at our table all at once asking us if we want some part of some animal. One came right after the other, before I could even ask questions or try the piece of meat I just received 5 seconds earlier.. I was overwhelmed to say the least. I couldn't remember which piece I liked because there was a huge pile of meat on my plate after 5 minutes. 

They need to slow down, or have multiple people come with the SAME meat so everyone can try everything. 

Regardless to say, not every piece was good and you just have to try and hope that you remembered which one that was. 

Oh!! BEWARE!!! They will try to upsell you water. They asked us if we wanted still or sparkling, we asked for still.. they came back with $10 bottles of WATER that we didn't know were $10 each until the bill came. $40 for WATER!!!!!!!!! They did NOT offer tap and we assumed still meant tap. It does not. ASK for tap!
author: Athena L.

description:
This is a really fun place to celebrate a special occasion with a group of friends and we did just that on a Saturday night. The evening starts with a trip to a well stocked market table that includes fruits, vegetables, pork products (they have bacon and prosciutto), smoked salmon, cheeses and a bunch of grains.  

After that, servers bring meat dishes (lamb, pork, chicken and beef) on skewers.  You have to order certain items (e.g., the beef ribs or chicken hearts) separately.  The beef ribs are my favorite though all of the meats are really tasty.  The desserts we ordered were also surprisingly good (key lime pie and chocolate mousse cake).  

For food quality, this restaurant is a solid 4.  The market table has good items (get the bacon and the quinoa, skip the prosciutto).  The cheese popovers were great starters too. The meats were excellent. One other thing is that they make a mean pitcher of Sangria.

Ambiance is also a solid 4 and can't beat the convenient location across from the W hotel.  The one area for improvement is the service (a 3 at best).  This place gets really busy and there are points in the relatively long meal where you will be left looking for a non-skewer bearing server.  Prices are also on the high side (expect to pay about $100 including tax and tip).  Overall, this is a 3.5 rating but I'm rounding up on the strength of the desserts.  If you are in the area, it's definitely a solid option.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Ever since Bridesmaids came out, I've wanted to try a Brazilian steakhouse. LOL. Thankfully, my friends and I did not suffer from food poisoning. We had a pleasant experience that left our bellies satisfied.

The restaurant itself is really elegant. If you want to really impress somebody, bring them here! It was $45 for the ayce, which included the salad bar. One of the meat cutters suggested that we do not fill up on the salad bar and focus on trying all of the different meats. He also told us to not feel obligated to finish any of the meats that we did not like. YESSIR! 

My favorite were all of the sirloins, hands down. The other meats did not stand out to me. Most of the meats I tried were dry and bland (ribeye, lamb, and beef rib); but the linguica was good, and my fiancé really liked the garlic steak. One of the other standouts was the cheese bread. It took every ounce in me to not eat hella bread and save my stomach for meat. The salad bar was pretty extensive. There was a variety of cheese, cured meats, fruits, and veggies.  I made sure to be very picky since I wanted to get my money's worth in meat. If I had to do it all over again, I'd only eat sirloin, cheese bread, and a salad. 

Service was okay. Our waitress would appear randomly from time to time to refill our waters, but other than that, our interaction with any employee was minimal. 

This was a nice experience overall. I would come back in the future, but only for special occasions, since this meal will put a nice little dent in your wallet.
author: Liana B.

description:
Stars: 3.5

I made reservations for two at 7:30pm on Valentine's Day, so you can imagine how hectic it was. We had to wait over an hour before we got seated.

It was both our first times at a Brazilian Steakhouse. I made the rookie mistake of getting too much food from the market table. My boyfriend was like, "You can always go back... you're missing all the meat!" So I sat down and then all the chefs started coming to carve meat for us.

I enjoyed the house special sirloin, filet mignon, and parmesan pork. The pork ribs were extremely dry. The chicken was slightly overcooked. And all the other meats were waaay too salty. I was chugging my water from the end of my meal up until bedtime. I'm surprised I didn't wake up in the middle of the night to pee!  

I'm actually not the hugest steak eater/lover, so the sides were what kept me happy. Omg the cheese bread is amazing!!! It had a glutinous feel to it that reminded me of mochi. The garlic mashed potatoes, polenta fries, and plantains were divine! They were so good that I got pretty upset when one of the busboys took our plates away before I got to finish the last few bites. He didn't ask if we were still working on them :( I knew I could've ordered more, but I also knew that my stomach couldn't handle it... but then I also tried their squash soup. I really enjoyed this. The flavor was light, but it was a nice change from all the salty food. 

At the end of our meal, I was in pain, haha. Overall, it was a cool experience. However, I think they should cap reservations at a certain number. I didn't get to bed until 1am on a weeknight! But shout out to all the hostesses, servers, chefs, busboys, and bartenders for the good service on a crazy busy night.

Also, it'd be nice to get some free dessert with our "full experience" meal :P
author: Lincy H.

description:
Came here for Friday lunch. There was only 10 other parties here at the same time. The servers were very attentive. 

Favorites from the salad bar:
Butter lettuce: So fresh! I wrapped some of my meats with this!
Marinated Mushrooms: Well flavored!
Asparagus: Crunchy, fresh.

Best cuts:
Filet Mignon: So red and bloody. YUM.
Prime Rib: So soft.
Chicken Heart: Juicy! 
Garlic Beef: A little bit of fat with very flavorful bite.

Other notes:
Love their cheesy bread and fried polenta! 
The bathroom is immaculate. Their paper towels were divine.

Pro-Tip: Eat at lunch if you can. Its ~$20 cheaper than dinner and you still get the best beef cuts. 

Pro-Tip: Join their eClub for $25 off on Weekdays.
author: Cynthia M.

description: Wow.   That is really all we can say.  Amazing food.  Carolina the bartender was incredible.  Super nice, super sweet, no matter how busy she was she always seem to be there when we needed her. She was super pretty too.  I think my wife had a crush on her.  That being said, everything was amazing.
author: Douglas S.

description:
Definitely the place to go if you're on that high protein diet, lol! Went here on a weeknight with some friends. You should make reservations as this place gets super packed. As far as ambiance goes, it's super nice! Definitely the most aesthetically pleasing Brazilian steakhouse I've been to. As far as service goes, it was top notch. Our waiters made sure we were getting our meat fill, lol. 

On to the food! The meat kept coming and coming, lol. My favorites were the ribeye and lamb (I was actually so consumed with the meat that I forgot to take lots of pics, lol). As far as sides, I enjoyed everything I sampled from the bar, and the garlic mashed potatoes were amazing. The fried bananas for dessert were key as well. The only reason I didn't give this place a 5 is because I feel like the meat quality and flavor was just a tiny notch below another local Brazilian steakhouse I've been to. But by all means, this place was awesome and I'd definitely come back again in the future.
author: Dennis R.

description:
I took my daughter there to celebrate her promotion at work and also early birthday dinner. 

I have not eaten at this Fogo but have eaten at the Chicago Resturant which was very good.  I really like the salad bar!  Very fresh and kept up .  Excellent place for those on a Low Carb Diet!  Meat and Veges cannot beat the combination.


Meats were mostly good but lamb sirloin was a bit raw for my taste so did not finish.  Chicken Breast was over done and dry.  Spice was heavy for my taste.  It would have been much better lightly salted over the fire.  That being said the top sirloin and the bacon wrapped fillet were both excellent!  

Am absolutely stuffing and delectable experience!
author: Marc I.

description:
I loved the whole experience eating here!  Food was good, staff very attentive, ambiance had a kind of high end Las Vegas restaurant feel. My favorite cuts of meat were the sirloin (bottom especially),ribeye, and lamb chops.  Avoid the chicken as was so dry; even the bacon couldn't save it.  Though definitely go for the candied bacon from the Market Table.  I loved these cute little beak peppers which gave a nice refreshing pop of sweetness to cut through all the fatty meats.  Gherkins and other pickled veggies also helped balance out all that fat. 

A great place to celebrate a friend's birthday!
author: Helen H.

description: Excellent service- excellent food - LOVE THIS PLACE!! We make sure we get here every year when we visit SF!
author: Missy B.

description:
Good for big groups -- they were able to accommodate a large group for work offsite

very attentive staff members. experience is like other brazilian steakhouses with a bunch of dudes in their pantaloons coming by laden with meats smoked and marinated in various flavors.

chicken especially was nice and tender.  beef flavors start to meld into each other after the third version comes out.  i preferred the beef ribs as it was more tender and flavorful. cheese bread was chewy

they also seemed to have a good selection for vegetarians, in case you have folks in your group who have that need

nice salad spread with assorted cheeses/salads

the peruvian punch drink was refreshing - strawberry and mint taste

i've also been here for happy hour before and also enjoyed that there wasn't too much of a wait and the staff again was attentive
author: Marshall Y.

description: Great set up, friendly service and delicious salad bar and meat selections. The meat (steak, pork, lamb and chicken) are definitely better marinated than Espetus however I think Espetus has better meat selections. Espetus have seafood and pineapple selections where Fogo de Chão only has seafood options as ala Carte. The server came in too late to present it therefore I didn't have the chance to taste the entree. I was disappointed about that. Also the Pao de quejo was too doughy but it was still tasty. Overall 4 out of 5 and I would recommend for experience.
author: Kay D.

description:
Loved the ambiance in this place! The host explains the whole process if you're a first timer. You get a card on your table with a green and a red side. Green= keep the meet coming!
Red= stop! 
Guys and girls with huge meat skewers will come to your table to carve the meat right onto your plate.
There's also a market table where you can grab all sort of charcuterie, fruits, sauces, and soups.
My fav part was the pao de queijo, soooo soft! 
The meats, which came in all sorts (sausage, chicken, lamb) were good, but many of them did not stand out. Overall, it was an enjoyable experience. The servers were very attentive and made sure you left stuffed! My only other complaint would be the price of the sodas... $3.75 for 1 diet coke seems a little too much in my opinion
author: Sui N.

description:
So many people know this about me but I love Brazilian steak houses!  I have literally driven an hour away sometimes just to go to one.  One that I frequent at least twice a year is Fogo De Chao.  I usually take friends to Fogo as I rant and rave about it.  Tonight Fogo really let me down in every single part of the night.  

First let's start with getting seated.  I made a reservation for 7:30 for just a table of 1.  I know I could have ate at the bar, but I sometimes enjoy just siting at a table.  I arrived about 10 minutes early, gave my name and they said they would seat me soon.  I waited over 20 minutes to be seated.  What bothered me is when they walked me to my table was that there were plenty of open 2 seater tables.  I just think they wanted to seat the big groups before just me.  I was not going to let this bother me.

I sit down and the waitress comes over and introduces herself.  She tells me she is in training and pretty new.  I let her know I had been here before and she did not really need to go over everything.  When I went to order a Brazilian lemonade she gave me a blank stare and started to ask if I wanted about 10 other drinks.  

The salad bar is nice but poorly labeled.  I usually get very little from the salad bar.  But compared to Fogo's in Chicago, Orlando, ATL or other cities it was for sure lacking.  

The meat selection was strange here.  Usually you are bombarded with meats but here they pace it out.  Sometimes it was about 5 minutes before another came.  One thing they do here is give you large chunks of meat.  The meats were a little cold and not hot like others.  It was really strange.  Also some of the meats only came around once in the hour I was there.  

So usually I do not complain about drinks but tonight they told me they ran out of lemonade and it would be a few minutes cause they needed to make more.  A few minutes turned into over 10 minutes.  Then they bring it out without a straw.  Also the girl training asks if I want more brea,I said yes, no bread for 15 minutes, it's not till I remind her and she still does not go get she asks someone to do it.  Final thing I asked if I could just get a side of mashed potatoes twice and never once during the meal did I get them... 

I usually do not complain this much but it was a really bad experience.  I understand you are training, but whomever is tearing you is doing it wrong.  This is by far the worst Fogo experience I have had and it's pretty sad.
author: Matthew L.

description: This 1-Star review is for the service. We received an email for restaurant month that said the dinner was $39/person. Which is an amazing deal by all accounts! We showed our waiter the email and verbalized that we wanted to redeem the offer. We enjoyed our meal but when the bill came, we were charged the regular price. We asked our waiter about it and he gave us this really weak explanation that we were charged the regular price bc we had eaten the meats that weren't included in the restaurant month offer. HOW WERE WE SUPPOSED TO KNOW THIS?! And how is it out responsibility to decline the types of meats that aren't included in the offer. This exchange really ruined our experience. We felt very misled.
author: Rie U.

description:
My first time at a churrascaria though not my first encounter with Brazilian food. I wasn't sure what to expect. First of all getting here can be a pain. You can take the Bart or you can pay for parking. We found a garage nearby that was relatively cheap ($2/hr?)

The host at the front was very kind. I had to modify our reservations and apparently when I did that I also switched the dates on accident. We came on a Saturday around 4pm and luckily the place was 80% empty so the host accommodated us. This place has a ton of offerings outside the bbq. There's a feijoada bar, a soup of the day (asparagus & split pea), a sauce bar, and a salad bar that had everything from pickles to smoked salmon to various cheeses. They also provide you with starchy items to fill you up. Now this is where my problem lies. I wanted to save my stomach for meat to get my money's worth but in all honesty the tastiest items were their side dishes.

The #1 thing at this restaurant was definitely their pao de queijo. It is a gummy, cheesy, buttery piece of heavenly carboliciousness and I probably ate 8 and that's with "self control". I've had pao de queijo before and maybe it's cause these are constantly being pumped out so they're warm but I would almost come back just for this.

Other side dishes worth getting were the Spanish chorizo, smoked salmon, and cheeses. None of them were the highest quality but they were tasty enough if you needed a meat break. Their various salads were also good especially the ones dressed in vinegar which really helps cut through the saltiness of the meat. They also brought out some mashed potatoes, fried plantains, and polenta fries. The polenta fries were stale and a hard pass. The fried plantains offered some sweetness which was nice between meats. The mashed potatoes were straightforward but quite creamy and delicious. We tried a bit of the soup which was very flavorful though we passed on the feijoada bar because I knew it would fill me up too much.

As for the meat, well I'm hoping we just came on a bad day. One of the biggest issues was that since the restaurant was so empty we were constantly getting repeat items and or the first cut of a new stick which meant a lot of our pieces were too salty or too well done (I'm a medium rare/rare kinda girl). Some of the items we tried included the prime sirloin, bottom sirloin, bacon wrapped bottom sirloin, ribeye, leg of lamb, and a second batch of prime sirloin. The plain bottom sirloin was just straight up bad. Chewy, flavorless, and a disrespectful tribute to the cow. The bacon wrapped one on the other hand did help. Personally my favorite was the ribeye and the leg of lamb which was a bit salty but still delicious.

My group including myself tapped out fairly early before hitting our money's worth. We weren't super full versus the amount of salt from eating the exterior portions of the meat were really getting to us.

One of the positives of this restaurant that will keep my coming back once I undergo the surgery myself is that they do seem to have a discount for bariatric patients if you bring proof of the surgery which is nice. Overall, I did enjoy my experience here. I don't know if it's quite worth the weekend pricing but it was nice to have the variety. Honestly my favorite thing here was the cheese bread and I will most certainly be back for more of it.

---The Re-return item: Pao de Queijo---
author: Vivian C.

description:
I tried Fogo de Chao when I was in Texas and I was surprised they had one in SF. I wanted to save this place for a special occasion, so me and my bf decided to come here for our 3 year anniversary. I was anxious because my boyfriend can't eat pork or beef. While I was being offered lots of red meat, my bf had to wait for chicken or lamb. I thought he wouldn't enjoy it because there was little that he could eat, but he said that he would return again, surprisingly! 

I read online that there would be seafood, but I guess it's not the type you expect that would be cooked. I believe they are located at the Market Table. I didn't see them probably because they were camouflaged in with the veggies lol. 

There is unlimited cheese rolls, which is my faveeeee! They bring out a small dish of mashed potatoes, plantains, and polenta. You can always request more if you run out.

The service was impeccable! We were asked many times if there was anything we needed and how our night was going. When I asked if I could get well done/medium on my meats, they kindly reassured me that they would come back when one was available, which they did! I was surprised they remembered to come back because even I forgot I had requested it. One of the waitresses? offered us a free dessert because it was our anniversary. She was really cool and mentioned that there was a sweepstakes going on. When I got home and entered, I received $100 off of dining experience the next time I come in! 

For the price of $62 a person, unlimited meats and appetizers, I would definitely come back! I even recommended this place to my parents, who love steak! Thanks for a wonderful anniversary dinner!
author: cristina p.

description:
I've heard a lot of good things about this place and have been wanting to go for years.  I decided to go this time because it was only a couple blocks away from where I had my Swedish massage. 

The meats were delicious. Some tasted better than others. It was hard to keep them all straight but I think the beefs were far better than any of the pork or chicken I had. The best of the beefs, and the best meat I had in general, was the picanha.  It was SOO good. The only problem is that it comes out so slowly.  Each piece is seasoned, roasted on one side and cut thinly.  The weight has 4-5 big pieces of meat on his skewer that each have 2 sides that are seasoned and roasted. The waiter cuts off one thin slice and that is all the waiter can cut from that side before he has to go back into the kitchen to have the entire skewer re-seasoned and roasted.  This means the waiter only has about 8-10 slices each time he comes out.  I spent a lot of time saying no to everything else while waiting from this one waiter to come back over and over again. 

The buffet area was okay.  The array of lettuce and salads could have been chopped more finely.  I had a huge salad made of a couple pieces of kale, lettuce and some arugula. The other items were okay. I wouldn't waste my time over there tbh. 

The complimentary things they give you include cheesy bread which I thought tasted like cheese-its, fried plantains which were okay, these cooked bananas which I enjoyed and mashed potatoes which were also good.  

For dessert we had the molten chocolate cake which comes with a scoop of ice cream.  It was more like a bundt cake that was light and airy that had some warm chocolate ganache in the center.  It was good but I was hoping for a dense thick chocolate cake like at mulvaney's in Sacramento. 

The service was as expected.  I had reservations but still had to wait like 15 minutes to be seated. That was upsetting. The place is dim. Some people were dressed up. One lady had a black dress with wings on.  I'm not even kidding.  She had black feathery wings on that looked like a super high collar.  

TL/DR: great restaurant. Food is delicious. The picanha is definitely the best.  Some meats I would avoid. I'd definitely come back and recommend this place.
author: Jon P.

description:
I must say that I either picked the wrong day to have dinner here (4/20) cuz a few were high or my waiter and some service staff just didn't give a flip about us. I give 4.5 stars for the food, and 2.5 for service. Lame! 

We made reservations by phone for last Friday. When we arrived we were taken to the farthest table in the restaurant. Our waiter showed up after 5-10 minutes and brought water & bread. 

We carried on and visited the salad bar, which was superb. And the meats started arriving, the steak, chicken, lamb, skewered taste great. Some were a wee bit salty, never the less, all these guys did a great job!

20 mins later, out waiter finally showed up and I ordered a glass of wine. We had to remind him to bring the sides to our table. He came back after 15 and forgot the wine and I reminded him again.. smh.

We asked one lady 3 times to bring us one type of meat and she never did. She actually came back twice and we REMINDED her and it never arrived. Wtf? 

Finally I went to find our waiter since he never came back. We wanted to get the check and he was nowhere, shocking right? I had to go to the bar and speak with the bartender & he helped me out.

I'll have to think twice before coming back.
author: Nawar F.

description:
First time here. It was my son's birthday and it was kind of late already when we came. It was around past 8 pm and we were a big party. About 16-18 people. The area were just half-filled and the staff looked tired already and not pleasant at all. They don't look happy serving us and you can tell by the way they interact with us. The food was okay but they're missing a few of my favorite items like the grilled pineapple and grilled chicken hearts. Not sure if they said they were out or they don't serve it. I had my daughter ask them but I got confused the way they answered, since they all look tired and seem to be  "not in the mood"' to work and serve?.... Espetus in SF and San Mateo is far better. Been there multiple times. Thats for me. I really would like to "like" this place but I would have to come back here one more time to see the difference. 
Overall, Im just giving 3 on everything:

Food
Parking
Staff
Service
Price
author: Theresa M.

description:
I'm actually really surprised at the bad reviews for service that I had to re-check the location to make sure I was on the right Fogo De Chão page. We had the absolute best service. I can't remember our servers name but if you're reading this sir, it's your bffs from Modesto.  

We made reservations for 6:30 on a Thursday, when we arrived it was pretty empty. However, when we were leaving around 8 pm, the line was almost out the door. 

This was my first churrascoria (not sure if I spelt that right) experience and honestly was a bit overwhelmed at first. Two meat guys came out and another server came out with sides and another with drinks, literally all at the same time, I thought I was going to have a mental breakdown. But thankfully they all slowed the pace down a bit. 

Again, first time here and made the mistake of filling up at the market place. Do not do this! Get your moneys worth of meat. Now on to the meat....*wipes drool off phone screen* Absolutely amazing. There were definitely some cuts that I didn't care too much for and some were just amazing. Favorite was the picanha and ribs, which you have to ask for. For the most part, the meat is more on the medium/rare side, but my sister has to have well done. She told one of the meat guys (I'm sorry idk what they're called) that she prefers well done and I'm pretty sure he told the rest of the meat guys that she only eats well done. Because next thing we know, they're coming to her with "would you like a well done piece?" and "you only eat well done right?" It was a small gesture, but very appreciated and attentive. 

Towards the end of our meal, the manager (I'm assuming he was the manager or owner) came out and talked to us and made sure we enjoyed our meal. Everyone was just awesome and made the experience that much better. 

Definitely not a cheap place to grab a quick bite and bring the kids, but most definitely an experience worth trying.
author: Zarry S.

description:
Since Fogo is a chain, you kind of know what to expect if you've visited other locations. This particular one is a good $10 more for dinner than our local Fogo, and they seemed to have less meat options, which was surprising.

We got here here for dinner around 6:30pm and meat came out very slowly. Apparently, this is their transition time and they're still grilling. Anyway, speed quickly ramped up and soon enough, we were inundated with meat. The salad bar had all the usual suspects, and we loved that they had a separate condiment bar with different sauces. Favorites were the ribeye and the picanha with the crispy ends. So good.

The downside to our meal was being seated next to a family with a small child who was throwing food EVERYWHERE and screaming. Like, come on. Control your kid or don't go out. It was super unappetizing to say the least. 

We really wanted papaya cream for dessert, but it's still off the menu due to e.coli concerns, so we went with the strawberry cream, which isn't nearly as good. Around this time, boyfriend started feeling extremely sick, so we darted out of here pretty quick. Not sure what did him in, but just FYI if you're dining here.
author: Jonelle T.

description:
I am ashamed to say that I have never been to a Brazilian Steakhouse before my visit this past Sunday to Fogo de Chao and I cannot believe I have been missing out on this for 24 years. I was hesitant as I really cannot eat THAT much meat but after a 12 mile run, this sounded like a great brunch to refuel. I made a reservation for A and I for 12PM on Sunday and am glad we did. Fogo de Chao's brunch is cheaper ($44.95) than dinner, has a lot of meat coming around and some special brunch dishes like hashes. Plus, it is so much easier to have a huge meal as your first meal of the day and have time to digest than to have it late at night and go to sleep.

We arrived on time for our reservation and were sat within 5 minutes. The first thing I noticed was how LARGE this restaurant is by San Francisco standards. They clearly are going after businesses/the convention crowd at nearby Moscone. This outpost of Fogo is fairly new (~1 year I think) and it is absolutely beautiful on the inside and feels upscale without being uptight. On the way to our table, the host explained all about Fogo and the "concept" with the market table and the gauchos coming around the goods. We took a look at the drink menu, decided to just stick with water and headed to the market table.

Now, A has been to Fogo before in Chicago and gave me a pep talk before we went in on not filling up at the salad bar/on sides because he knows me too well. Before seeing the market table, i just thought it was going to be some sad lettuce and dole fruit but oh my god it was the place of veggie dreams! They have both salad ingredients and composed salads as well as nice fruit (think berries, kiwi, watermelon), cheese, meats and a ton of other things. Really, I would not begrudge ANYONE for doing just the market table option as I think you could make a super nice meal on just this. Anyways, priming myself for the meat fest about to happen, I just took some veggies, some cheese and some of the brunch hash and went back to the table only to find that we suddenly had sides! 

The sides at Fogo during brunch are the Pao de Quejo, fried plantains, yucca fries and mashed potatoes. I literally could not stop eating the plantains. I love plantains and these were phenomenal. The Pao de Quejo were delicious as well and you know I love myself some yucca fries. The mashed potatoes were good but since I had to save stomach real estate, I decided to leave these.

All of this would have been a feast in and of itself but then they started coming around with the MEAT. Oh my god so much meat. I don't remember everything we tried (they give you small cuts which is good) but some key delicious items: the chicken breast, lamb chops, filet mignon and short ribs. My one complaint is that the variety during the first ~30 minutes we were there was not high and the gauchos kept coming around with the same 5 things. It was only after a bit that we started to see some more variety. I understand this has to do with how the kitchen can prepare the large quantities so I guess it is par for the course. Another minor note is that I found some of the meat, especially the steak, to be a bit salty. I am pretty sensitive to salty foods so I just happened to notice but I assume the average person would not care that much.

A younger version of us would have eaten to excess and felt terrible. Luckily, A and I are out of our gorging phase so we were able to get the check when we were comfortably full. I do think we ate quite a bit of different foods so I feel like the price was worth it. I really enjoyed the experience and had a lot of fun. I would love to come back but would probably need a reason or occasion as its a bit expensive for a random meal. Seriously, don't let the fact that this is a chain turn you off. It actually is really good.
author: Carrie W.

description:
Food is always so tasty, but service just wasn't great. I would give food a 4 stars and service a 2 stars. 

Why I was here // My bf and I decided to try this place out for Sunday brunch and we made reservations for an early 11am because we wanted to check out SF MOMA afterwards for our afternoon date in the city. 

Service // Service started out welcoming. Our server was great for the beginning since there were literally only 2 other tables eating with us till around 11:30am. My only issue is half way through our meal, we noticed our server disappeared and no one came to check on us....After we finished our meal, we wanted to get a photo and to also order coffee to finish our meal. We asked one of the waiters to take our photo...he reluctantly did so (didn't seem to friendly about it) then we asked if we could order coffee and he turned his back to us and told us to wait. 
Waiting was no issue, but he never got someone to take our coffee order. After about 15 minutes of trying to flag another person down, we decided to ask for the check and to leave.

By the way: the meat service is excellent. When your green card is turned up, the meat just keeps coming and it's great!  

It's a shame that the service has been going downhill because my bf and I go to fogo de chao a few times a year and I think after this time, we'll pass and go for a different restaurant. Good service really sets the mood and this was just not great for us. Felt like we were inconveniencing some of the servers by asking to order...

Food // brunch price - about $45
-we ordered a glass of red wine
-market table // lots of cheeses, fruits, salamis, salads 
-sides // polenta sticks, Brazilian cheese bread (my fave!), mashed potatoes
-Meats // so much variety, but they offer ribeye, lamb, pork chop, chicken, etc.... Be sure to state that you want your meat (however you like it- eg: medium rare) or they will just give you the salty overdone outside. 

Overall // Food is wonderful, the men who come to give the meat are amazing, the other service...just ok.
author: Emily T.

description:
I have always loved Brazilian bbq and this place is awesome!! Love the all you can eat part. What I like about this place is that they serve lamb chops! Amazing! I literally ate like 10 lamb chops! They Lao serve lamb shoulder meat. And they are well cooked and nicely seasoned. 

All the other meats are great as well, I usually eat lots of beef. Flank steak, garlic steak, filet mignon all medium well done! Seasoning is great in these! 

I tried the pork chop as well, the flavoring if that was great too! I can really taste the pork flavor, and the balance is just right. (Of course I had to drink lots of water) haha
author: Kevin L.

description:
Yes, I know Fogo is a chain. Yes, I've been to Fogo before in another city. Yes, I still love this place! 

To be honest, Fogo never lets me down. I LOVE the cold bar and all the options they have. It's always stocked, replenished, and filled with all sorts of veggies, prosciutto, and cheese. Plus, what's not to love about the amazing dinner rolls they bring out and the fact that they keep coming to your table with MORE meat!?!?

Depending on how busy it is, sometimes the staff is bogged down and take a bit to come back around to you to fill your water or get you another drink. Regardless, the quality of the food is fantastic, and it's better to take your time with this meal anyway. 

While this place is definitely a chain, it's always worth it to me to go.
author: Sally Y.

description:
Isabelle, our waitress, was spectacular! She was attentive, sweet, and made the entire dinner very enjoyable! 
My family and I were a family of 10 and came there for my dad's birthday. All the cuts were delicious but my favorite was the Picanha. Thank you for a memorable experience!!
author: Samantha D.

description: Ok so I've been here a few times now. On some days its 4 stars on other days it's been 3 stars. The food and drinks are delicious. The dessert menu is not that great. The dessert tasted a bit old. I don't recommend coming here during major holidays because the servers tend to rush you out. Overall a bit over priced here but the experience was amazing
author: Chelo G.

description:
Worst Fogo de chão we've ever been too. 

Meat was dry and salty, service was poor, ambiance was lacking. It was not on par with any other fogo de chão we've ever been to, nor any other brazilian bbq in the city. You are much better off at any other restaurant. Even when we asked for the bill, we had to remind them repeatedly to bring it. They kept forgetting to even bring us the bill - the restaurant wasn't even busy. Everything was just disappointing. We brought family expecting to have them to rave about their first Brazilian bbq experience, but that didn't happen. 

Truly deserving of its relatively low rating. We figured there would be some expectation of good service for any fogo de chão, but evidently that is not the case for this location.  Showazzza
author: Tyler S.

description:
This was my first experience at a Brazilian steakhouse. Overall, it was really fun and I have never eaten so much meat in one sitting! Salad bar had a great selection (love the pickled onions and salmon!). There was a good variety of sauces as well for dipping the meats into. The complimentary fried polentas, caramelizad bananas, Brazilian bread (basically cheese puffs), and mashed potatoes were delicious! 

The meats overall were quite good, but some were just way too salty. The top sirloin was especially salty-- I couldn't eat it anymore after taking a bite. The chicken legs were too salty too, unfortunately. The Parmesan pork was so dry that I had to dip it into a bunch fo sauce-- I wouldn't recommend getting that at all. 

I have to admit, it was overwhelming when a bunch of servers came with the skewers in the beginning. It slowed down a lot after about 10 minutes, and it became difficult to get any more meat after that. Some of my friends clearly still had their cards on "green", and wanted more meat, but nobody came around. They had to explicitly ask for more, but they were able to tell them specifically how they would like them cooked, which was nice (it took a long time for them to receive them though). I also noticed that sometimes the servers only came to one side of the table (we had a party of 10, sitting at a long table), even though there were many of us who had our cards on "green" on the other side of the table. 

In addition, it took a long time to receive drinks. Other than the minor setbacks, my friends and I really enjoyed our experience.
author: Christina W.

description:
Poor service and subpar meat. Had to practically bet them to bring meat to our table of 12 and we were there relatively early before it got crowded.  Once we got a manager it improved but still slower than any other churrascaria I've been to. Meat was fairly plain and lacked flavor.  

Much prefer Espetus.
author: Dan N.

description: We were there for a birthday celebration. Reservations were for 7:30. We were seated 45 mins. later after inquiring a few times. The last inquiry the hostess looked surprised and we were immediately escorted to a table that obviously had been ready.Our drinks did not arrive until after our meal. We were told they just came off the bar, noticing the ice was melted and the glass was thoroughly moist, you knew it was sitting for a while. Our water glasses were never refilled, the bread was not replenished.  In other words, we were seated and then forgotten. The service was so lacking. The food on the other hand was excellent. The servers were constantly arriving with the variety of meats, sausage and chicken. Will not go back to the San Francisco Fogo de Chao. For the price, one would expect better service.
author: Mary C.

description: Good place to split the bill evenly at $60pp. AYCE steaks chicken and gizzards. Salad bar has variety. Parking structure right next door or Valet parking. Glass of Moemi red wine is $20. Overall the steak is okay but the ambiance makes for a nice evening out.
author: Emma G.

description: We had this and the meat is less tender and juicy as compared to Espetus. Definitely go there instead. Nothing much else to say. The salad bar was pretty good though.
author: Thomas C.

description:
This place is a meat lover's paradise!  The decor is simple but elegant.  The staff is friendly and very attentive.  The cold item section has a good selection of veggies, fruits, and salads.  The team came with unlimited services of their delicious popover type breads, fried yucca, and sweet plantains.

But the stars of the meal were the large selection of meats.  Our group's favorites were the garlic ribeye, top sirloin, and sausage.  For the adventurous, there were the chicken hearts.  One nicety that I had not found at other churrascarias was their offering of different sauces for the meats.  We stumbled up on them near the roast pork.  They ranged from the mild to the spicy, along with a delicious chimichurri sauce.  The servers should mention the sauces when you are settling into your spot!

The dessert offerings were plentiful and tasty as well.  All in all, we enjoyed ourselves to the point of getting the meat sweats!  Hmmm, I hope my gout doesn't come back anytime soon!

Pricing was on par with the other churrascarias in the area:  $42 for lunch, $63 for dinner and holidays!  Pricey?  Yes, but worth taking the plunge every now and then!
author: Gene D.

description:
Came here on a Monday for lunch and was disappointed with both the food and service.

Had a reservation at 12 and was seated shortly after arriving. The place looked empty initially but seemed to fill up within the next 30min or so. It seemed they were serving meat that has been cooking too long or perhaps meat that was leftover from the day before. The meat initially was near welldone and a bit chewy; even their filet mignon. 

Once the place started filling up, there was almost an immediate change in their food quality. Suddenly, the meats were properly cooked and no longer dry and chewy. Also more variety of meats (e.g. ribs, drumsticks, and even picanha) started to come out vs when we first arrived. 

We were eventually asked about 3 separate times if we had any special request from the kitchen. Each time they asked, we did mention something we'd like from the kitchen but they failed to bring out anything we requested all 3 times. 

Towards the end of our meal, we already marked out tables red (no more meat)  and have been waiting about 15min for our check. It took me about 4 times to flag down our server to which on the 4th time, I literally had to say "Excuse me!" with my hand waving to catch his attention. I felt rude having to do that but the typical raising my hand while he was in eyesight wasn't working. He eventually blamed it being a holiday (MLK Day) to why he was so busy. I don't think he noticed I saw him chatting with his coworkers. 

Overall, I had better experiences at another location (LA) and was hugely disappointed by this specific establishment. To those readers thinking it's not that bad and I probably just came at a wrong time: dining at a place like this shouldn't require to catch them at a "good time". Their service and food quality should be consistent despite on a slow day or a "busy holiday" like MLK Day.
author: Robbie P.

description: Two words: salad bar. One more word: yum! A nice night out, helpful staff and, for the open plan, actually the noise wasn't so bad. I'm sure the copious amount of meat they have there is fantastic, but I kept to the salad bar and that was good and plenty.
author: Stacy T.

description:
Had reservations at 7pm but didn't really get seated until 7:45pm. It was Valentines Day, so the long line to check in was reasonable. I saw people getting pissed because they had reservations and still had to wait a long time. Luckily for me, my patience has been improving.

Similar to other Brazilian steakhouses, you can make your card green or red depending if you want the meat to come or not. Your table also gets fried plantain, fries, and mashed potato which was all delicious. Plus there is a salad bar where you can load up on greens, cheese, salami, ham, etc. The only downside is that there wasn't as much variety of fruits as I would've liked (since I'm not a big protein eater).

My favorite meats were probably the filet mignon and grilled skirt steak. Skip the chicken leg. It was way too salty.

Service was good. The hostess apologized about the long wait and the server was friendly. The meat cutters were also very polite and made the experience more enjoyable.

Overall, my experience was pleasant and would recommend this place to everyone else. Just make sure you have plenty of spare time to wait in case you end up waiting a long time for a table.
author: Julian Y.

description:
3.5* but rounding up for the nice atmosphere. Had a reservation at 7PM on a Sunday during SF Restaurant week. Came in, checked in, and the reception said that tables would be ready soon. We still didn't get updates at around 7:15, so I checked again, and this time, I got a buzzer. We were then seated within 5 minutes, and one of our servers greeted us and the fun started!

The salad bar had a bunch of options. I really enjoyed the watermelon and candied bacon. I got quite a bit of smoked salmon but found it too salty. 

Right after coming back from the salad bar, the meats came nonstop! I think I tried all of the steaks and enjoyed every single one of them, my favorite being the filet mignon. The seasoning was simple, yet just perfectly lightly salted and spiced. One complaint was that they really "front-loaded" us with food. Everything came within 10-15 minutes, and since they all looked delicious and I was afraid that that type of meat wouldn't come back again in time, I couldn't say no. Not sure if it just happened to be where we were sitting, but because of that, I was stuffed within 20 minutes. Different meats, such as pork chops and bacon wrapped chicken came around, but I was too full to try that.

I had a bit of room for other appetizers that they brought out and really enjoyed the special bread, caramelized bananas, and polenta.

I was slightly confused about whether or not dessert was provided, since for restaurant week, they advertised $65/person including dessert, but when I asked about it, the server told me that dessert would cost additional. It ended up being $62/person without dessert pre-tax and tip. Very very pricey! I'm not sure if it's worth the price, but if you want a tasty meal in a nice atmosphere and don't mind dropping $70+ on a meal, this is a good option.
author: Erica T.

description:
Went for bday HH yesterday and was served RAW chicken sliders... not slightly undercooked.., RAW.

Then my friend asked the bartender what Caipirinha was and why there were so many drinks with it? Instead of explaining it's Brazil's national cocktail he was irritated when she asked and said "what's your deal, if you don't like it order another one".. I grew up in SF and boy has service gone down.... this place won't be here for long.
author: Miriam B.

description:
Had a great lunch a month earlier then Weds happened... maybe because it was mid-week they were not expecting to actually wait on people or make enpough food. 

Had a reservation for 9.

1. Hostess was missing
2. Table was not ready
3. Table was then set up in a walkway?
4. Drinks ordered were forgotten
5. One person was vegetarian and only had Salad bar but was charged for Full Meal
6. Table continued to be skipped for meat 
7. Selection limited by 9pm. (we lept ordering the same items so that we would get something at all. (go early, though a 8pm reso should of been okay for any other restaurant)
8. Couldnt finf=d waitress to pay bill
9. NOt worth the $900 we spent. Had good experiences at lunch, not dinner.
author: Andrew S.

description: I came here to have lunch with my co-worker after meeting with a client. The food was good, but be prepared to have food coma after eating here. They have a salad and cheese bar I couldn't resist. Not to mention their meat selection, it made my mouth melt. Definitely coming back here again.
author: Ricardo C.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night. Reservations were pretty full but we got a slot at 5:30 pm which is a good time because after a heavy meal full of meats like that....you kind of need time to digest before hitting the hay. 

Even though it's a chain and sometimes I'm not a fan, this place has been consistent. Lots of meats to choose from...my favs are the picanha (prime top sirloin), alcatra (top sirloin), the lamb chops (not game-y and bonus is they're super flavorful). Even though I typically do enjoy filet mignon, at Brazilian steak places, I think the other meats are better in terms of both flavor and texture. 

My favs out of the salad bar are the mozzarella balls. So glad they have these. The rest like bananas (cooked like plantains) and mashed potatoes, and cheese bread are items they bring to you and they are delicious!! The polenta fried sticks are okay. 

Prep your belly before you come here!
author: Melissa L.

description: My husband and I have been frequenting here for lunch lately; I'm vegetarian and the salad bar is one of the better ones I've been to in a Brazilian steakhouse. Husband of course gets the steak and enjoys the table side carving, meat quality, and service. The salad bar only has lots of cheese (Brie, manchego, and a few other hard cheese), lots of prepared salads, endives, olives, cold grilled squash, eggplant, papaya, pineapple, watermelon, soup of the day, and a few cold meats. Table side they also service warm cheese bread (gluten free chewy biscuits), mashed potatoes, yuca fries. The food is definitely fresh and the place has an upscale feeling, very clean. Personally as a vegetarian I'd love a few more protein options like hard boiled eggs or something, but all in all this seems quite good!
author: Debora L.

description:
I visited during the weekend for lunch and I wasn't as impressed as I hoped to be.The location is spacious, yet I did find the salad bar to be rather small for it's capacity. Their salad bar was the best part though! It had variety, including some of my favorite cheeses. 

The meat selection wasn't as plentiful as Espetus (on Market & Gough) and the service was okay. The lovely busser explained everything for us, since the waiter or host failed to do so. I'd recommend to visit for the sole purpose that you'd be able to say you've been to SF's Fogo de Chao. Returning is not in my near future.
author: Jeanette Jane G.

description: Can't go wrong with AYCE Brazilian Steakhouse! Came here for my boyfriend's birthday lunch and would highly recommend it. A great selection of meats and the salad bar was delicious. Lunch is about $20 cheaper than dinner and couldn't tell much of a difference in the meat selection.
author: Emily R.

description: Food here is out of this world, meat so tender and juicy you just can't stop ordering more. The salad bar has a great selection and their cheese balls are a must. Service is not so great, which is why I dropped them down 1 star. Also, make sure you have plenty of time to enjoy the experience; this is not a place where you can be rushed. Happy hour isn't bad either; good choices and very good prices considering the location downtown SF (where everyone else only gives you $1 off a $15 drink).
author: Julie Z.

description:
We made a reservation and got a confirmation email,but when we came,the front desk said somebody already checked in,and let us wait and watch people keep getting their seat ,but not us!
Finally got in, the food is good.
So 4 Star!
author: Elsa L.

description:
Great for dinners and now great for breakfast and lunch! Fogo Market opened to a great welcome by our building, we go all the time. They open 7am-9am and 11-1pm, Fogo Market is on the side building of the actual restaurant. $8-12 range for a good lunch to-go! Friendly staff as well!

On the weekdays Happy Hour is at 4:30! They have great caipirinhas btw!
author: Karlos G.

description:
Blah!
I took my daughter there for diner one night since it was on our way home. (Little kid)  I got some disgusting looks from some of the staff but even worse was the horrible food.  The meat was like eating Safeway meat at butchers prices.  My kid loves good Brazilian Steak but she couldn't finish one piece of the crap they were serving.
author: Ricardo O.

description: I can't afford to dine in the regular dining room, but their happy hour was just as nice and much more affordable for my tiny pocket book. Obrigada! I love their happy hour food menu, and especially their drinks - caipirinha please 1, 2 and 3!
author: Maile N.

description:
I have eaten in many Brazilian steakhouses, as my wife is Brazilian and we like to eat meat. I am writing this review because I found the quality of the meat to be better than anything I had ever had before. I have even eaten churrasco (Brazlian barecue) in Rio Grande do Sul, the state in Brazil where barbecue comes from, and I would prefer to eat at Fogo.

I recently had a going away party there for my cousin (who is moving out of the country) and the manager Mahelly Ferreira made sure that our loud (and sometimes raucous) group was very well taken care of. We had a great meal, and the Malbec that was on sale (about $30 a bottle) was quite tasty. I typically wouldn't complain about service, or even pay that much attention to it, but everyone clearly made an effort to make us feel welcome. 

I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves to eat meat and have a great time. Just remember, show up hungry and don't waste space on salad :)
author: David B.

description:
The best place to eat meat in town!!! If you want great service, great food and good drinks, that's the place!!!! 
Ask for Mahelly (manager) and/or Mariana (hostess)... best persons in place... of course, Brazilians!!!!
author: Kika R.

description: Came here for lunch and the steaks we're great. We had a reservation and were seated immediately. It took about 15 minutes for the servers to start bringing out the cuts but once they started, they didn't stop. The picanha and beef ribs in particular were my favorites. Afterwards we had the chocolate cake for dessert which was also great. Looking forward to coming back in the future.
author: Sherman C.

description: way over priced for their lunch menu and the servers that bring the meat around the table do not come around that often.   you may want to reconsider if your near the convention center as there are lots of restaurant choices.
author: J M.

description:
Love the place . In my humble opinion.  Took my love one here for his birthday.  And he is Brazilian so he regularly eats Brazilian food and he said they service was good.  Very attentive staff and while going there.  Make reservation first ,and  they have decent salad bar and unlimited protein galore.  If you are a lite eater then this is not the place for you since its not cheap. So make sure you have a good healthy appetite and then diet for 4 days 
. Then you are Good, will go back again.  Just have to persuade my man to take me back  he is the best companion. It's a nice special treat  and will bring my family members there..
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
After attending a Sunday Matinee performance of Hamilton, we were ready for an early dinner before heading home. We found Fogo de Chao on Yelp and decided to head there. We've eaten at Fogo in Las Vegas and enjoyed that experience and we wanted to see how Fogo in SF would compare to Espetus. 

We were greeted and seated as soon as we walked in. Directly behind the Host/Hostess podium is a wall and behind that is a quad seating arrangement that is four two-tops with padded bench seating. Imagine looking at a plus-sign from above and put seating along each side. 

A server came by, took our drink order and explained the dining concept to us. We went and got food and returned to our table. Then another couple was seated opposite of us. When they sat down, our benches popped up as if we were on a teeter-totter. They asked for another table and the Host showed the  Restaurant Manager the instability of the bench. We also mentioned it. She asked if we wanted to move and I said that if no one else would be seated, we were fine. She replied that no one else would be seated at our "quad".

Unfortunately, there was no host/hostess working later that evening and with different servers sharing the responsibility, the message was not passed along and the "quad" was filled up. Every time someone sat down, everyone else bounced up. 

After a bit, i got annoyed enough that I lost my desire to eat. I asked for the manager and explained that had I known that others would be seated at our quad, we would have taken her up on her offer to move us earlier on. She was pleasant, apologized and did not make excuses. Her concern was that we give the restaurant another chance. Her professionalism and attitude took this review back up to three stars from one.

The food was good. The salad bar had an extensive selection of yummies to choose from. The hot bar was not as successful as it only offered three dishes, Feijoada, White Rice and Carrot Ginger Soup. Every other Churrascaria that we've been to has had more to offer in hot dishes such as a Seafood Stew. We only tried 6 different meats that were presented: Bacon Wrapped Filet, Garlic Rib Eye, Beef Tenderloin, Brazilian Sausage, Sirloin, House Marinated Pork Ribs.  

All in all, not a bad experience and we'll return with the expectation of a better experience somewhere down the road.
author: Dexter D.

description:
Updating review. 

Fogo is back to its former glory. The service was spot on and the food fantastic as always. 

After a couple of poor experiences we gave it another shot and we're happy we did. 

The service was significantly better than any other time we've dined there, and the overall experience was excellent. 

Dropping one star due to price increase, but I'll definitely be back
author: Matthew B.

description: Love this place. Food is good, there are various choice of barbecue meat. The vibe is wonderful. Everything just perfect.
author: Lili S.

description: I mean it's good and an overall cool experience. But I don't think the quality of meats and flavors / cooked is as good as other FOGO's and especially to Espestus. So overall it's good because it's prime cut beefs and chickens, etc. but for the price and comparing it to other Brazilian Steak house, not the best!
author: JJ W.

description:
All you can eat meat.  Yes please!

The wait gets rather long on weekends so its best to make a reservation ahead of time, especially for larger parties. Make sure you arrive with plenty of time to find parking.  This location is in the heart of the downtown SOMA district.  We were staying at a hotel across the street and walked right over but our friend had a heck of a time finding parking.  They have valet for $20.  

Its upscale but still casual dining.  People were wearing anything from T-shirts and jeans to cocktail dress and heels.   

The full dinner experience was $61.95.  It was a bargain considering how much food we ate.  They walk around with skewers of meats and carve piece right onto your plate.  Everything from Filet Mignon, Top Sirloin, Prime Top Sirloin, Rib Eye, Ribs, Sausages, Chicken Hearts were floating around.  The salad bar had lots to choose from too.  Asparagus, green salad, beefsteak tomato, olives, charcuterie, soups, breads.  Little bit of everything really.  If you are a vegetarian you could probably make a decent meal from their offerings at the salad bar (if you can get past the skewers of meat walking around).
author: Candace R.

description: The food was ok. Chicken was a bit dry. Service could have been better. We waited about 15-20 minutes for them to bring out our cheesecake. I had to ask multiple times for an update on it.
author: Cecile ..

description: Service was great, place was nice, it's a fun thing to try Brazilian food.  I was a little surprised at how expensive it was, I didn't notice any prices and soon figured out it was a buffet after getting there, I had no idea going in.  You do get access to all you can eat meat so make sure you are hungry.  I really wasn't blown away by any of the meat I was served but it was a fun experience.  Not so amazing on the taste but a fun thing to do and I really liked all the servers.
author: Ryan S.

description: I have visited Fogo De chao in  7 locations around the State , starting from LA to the East coast. Last week I went to the SF location with my family. I was surprised that the variety of the salads , fruits and cheese are very small. I have asked manager to bring fruit because there wasn't in the table and only old small few pieces left. The meat service was too slow and even only half of the restaurant was full the wait time for a meat was too long not like in different locations. I was expecting to have the best experience in San Francisco but it didn't came true.
author: Zulpukar A.

description:
Fogo was my first churrascaria experience a year ago. It was tons of fun with all the meat coming around our table. Complimentary dessert for birthdays!

Met the manager last year, and she actually remembered us! Great service from all the staff. One of the hosts caught me gawking at the plate of garlic shrimp that he was delivering to another table and actually came back around to our table to introduce their seafood specials. He was very attentive throughout the rest of the night and gave us TWO complimentary desserts because Boyfriend had stepped out when he brought over the first dessert. So when Boyfriend came back, the host popped up with a different dessert with the candle and everything. Needless to say, I LOVED the service.

Also LOVED their fruity Caipirinha cocktails - the Strawberry Hibiscus and Passionate were my favorites! I like the drinks that sneak up on you and get you tipsy before you realize it. Could barely taste the alcohol behind the strawberry and passionfruit flavors. Super pricey, but not unexpected.

The salad bar was also nice. Fresh - not tons of options, but you don't really go to a churrascaria for their salad bar. And if you do, you might be doing it wrong...

I would actually give the meat maybe 3 stars though. I take my meat medium-rare. But the meat that came out was often medium to well, so we'd have to wait for the next round of the same meat. But the gauchos don't always serve the same meat on their swords so the next gaucho may not know you were waiting on medium-rare. Sometimes, our medium-rare was actually super rare - like a deep red, almost brown, color.

I REALLY wish they had grilled pineapple though. They do have Caramelized Pineapple as a dessert, but it's not the same. It's only slightly caramelized. And somehow, this last time we got the pineapple, it was an inch thick so it was hard to cut/eat. But the first time we had it, it was much thinner. The Tres Leches Cake is ALWAYS delicious though. Soft.
author: Athena C.

description: Our family of six had a wonderful experience tonight. Having read many negative reviews of unsatisfactory service I wanted to express how wonderful the service was for us. Every single staff person made us feel welcome. The food was delicious and we could pace our servings by flipping the coaster to green to serve or red to stop serving. If there was a particular meat we wanted we could request it. That's how I got my chicken hearts! The salad bar was also very outstanding - probably better than Espetus.   There was a wide array of grilled vegetables, salads, fruit, cheeses, cold meats, salmon... We enjoyed our evening so much we booked a table for 6 next weekend!
author: Linda C.

description: Delicious! Pricey but so worth it, come hungry and be choosy before piling a ton of stuff from the salad bar on your plate!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Oh Fogo... it's really been too long.

Prior to my most recent Fogo adventure, the last time I had been to Fogo de Chao was nearly five years ago at the downtown LA location. I have always had fond memories associated with my Fogo de Chao adventures, and I was not disappointed on this last visit.

For context: we had been sitting at the Palace Hotel Garden Court, contemplating what to eat, when we realized that rather than spending $40 on halibut, we'd rather spend that money (+ a little more) on all you can eat Fogo goodness.

I love it when I make good decisions.

This Fogo location does not disappoint.

The market bar is well stocked with a ton of goodies to tempt you. I always have to reign myself in and not fill up my plate, otherwise I won't have room for the meat.

And the meat. Oh the meat! My palette definitely leans a little more towards "omg yes I love salt" side, so I do not mind at all the salt rub/flavorings for the meat here. More more more! The ribeye was a personal favorite of mine, but anything wrapped in bacon is also love. 

Our service was for the most part great-- there was no lull in the meats that were brought by and when we had specific requests for meats to be brought by again, they were happy to accommodate. We did have an interesting interaction with our waiter though, who gave us a mini lecture on how we should take our time and wait for the bill to be brought to us and collected, but in the end, we kind of got a chuckle out of it?

tl;dr: Fogo is only a sometimes food for me. But it's the kind of sometimes food that you wish you could have all the time...
author: Lillian Z.

description: After having tried three of the most popular Brazilian steakhouses in the Bay Area: Fogo, Espetus, and Pampas, I can say that Fogo is hands down the best. The atmosphere and food are both better than the competition. Their meats are prepared a bit saltier than others and while I like that, not everyone will.
author: Aakash P.

description:
The meats were good and included.  Ask for chicken hearts.  Seafood cost extra.  They DON'T have grilled pineapple, bummer.

Market table has enough variety to keep you happy if you skip the meats. Soup, rice and beans available.

Service was fine, they explain the concept to new guests.  Ambience upscale.  

Happy Hour at the bar 4:30-6:30 M-F.

Restroom clean and plenty of paper towel.
author: Drew B.

description: Took my family here for the first time as a going away lunch. What can I say the food I amazing definitely the best steak I've ever had! And their salad bar! Just wow! The service was amazing everyone was so helpful and happy. The experience was the best part! The servers are constantly making sure you have enough food. Would recommend to everyone. My new favorite restaurant. Oh and I drove 2 hours just to come eat here.
author: Zac W.

description:
We went on a Monday 12:45pm.  The reception asked if we had reservation and we said no. Then she said it would take few mins.  The restaurant tables were half empty by the way.  There were 2 ladies behind the reception desk.  There were 2 other group people came in after us and one reception brought them in immediately.

I understood the other 2 group people might have reservation.  However the restaurant was half empty and it was already passed the rush time on a Monday noon.  How difficult it was to find a table for 2 people?

We waited like 15 min then decided to leave.  We told the reception since she could not find us a table so we were leaving.  She just looked at us and didn't say anything.
author: Jon W.

description:
More like 3.5 star review.
