I had extremely high expectations of this place and I have to say I was not  highly impressed but none the less was still an enjoyable lunch experience.

**PROs:  a nice display of salad bar items to add to your AYCE meat experience.  Top and bottom sirloin, bacon wrapped meat, filet mignon, etc all sliced at table side. Loved the caramelized plantains and cheese bread, and mashed potatoes that came table side as well and were replenished.

**CONs:   I preferred the beef over the pork, pork was really tough and lacked some taste. Some of the slices were really small or really rare.  I liked more of the medium well cuts.

Not too bad for a lunch in the city.
author: Mary-Ann F.

description: Great service for a birthday dinner with Angela being an excellent server. She was quite helpful and  made my wife and I feel welcomed. The beef and shrimp/lobster appetizer were fantastic. I'll certainly be going back!
author: Carl N.

description: Right across the street from MOMA and Fogo de Chao seems so inviting. Me thinks not. You will get skewered. The food is average, even less than average considering it's billed as a Brazilian steakhouse. The wait staff informs you, "don't take too much, take what you can eat now," and that you'll get served as much tenderloin as you want. Don't believe it. You'll never see the tray come your way again. They push you to order the sides and specials that add even more to the bill. One person at our table had to have mashed potatoes, and clearly the $9 item was made from dry flakes you'd never serve at home. Nowhere on the menu did the restaurant state the per person charge, I swear I couldn't find it, but it's $60 a head. Keep walking, and you'll find pizza, a sandwich bar, or a really wonderful dining experience elsewhere.
author: Patricia F.

description: Love it here. My husband and I have come here for every anniversary. We've tried other Brazilian places with all you can eat dining but nothing beats the ambience, customer service and food of Fogo de Chão. They're typically pretty busy but they always manage to find a nice quiet area for us to sit and enjoy our meal. Looking forward to celebrating more anniversaries and other life events here in the future
author: Johanna K.

description: Just so-so compared to other churrascaria restaurants I've been to. Half the meats were way too salty and a few were clearly overcooked. Service was hot and cold.... We'd get great attention for a while, then our waiter would ignore us for 15 minutes at a time. There's better rodízio food elsewhere in town.
author: Bill G.

description: Amazing experience l, I came here for there happy hour and tried both red blends for there happy hour (stole some sips from my boyfriend) and had the hibiscus inspired cocktail and some crispy polenta fries it's definitely worth it for the price and the atmosphere is high class and not overwhelming I recommend it for just about every occasion, date night, taking out your parents or just friends catching up for the inexpensive happy hour
author: Michelle M.

description: Always good, although lately I feel that the other major chain, Texas de Brazil, has been a little better in terms of my tastes.
author: Todd Y.

description: Tri!!! He is an amazing waiter! My group came here on a Wednesday night for a work outing and we definitely had a great experience. Cant wait to spread the word! See you soon! :)
author: Francesca R.

description:
Don't come here. Go to Espetus. Do not be deceived by their overall 4 stars because I don't even understand how they got those. If I could give this place a 0.5 stars, I WOULD!

I made a reservation for a party of 11. We're familiar with Brazilian Steakhouses, but perhaps this one was slightly different. This is our first time at Fogo, so our waitress explains how things work. Water is given to every  member of my table, but after that is where my night goes downhill. There should never be an excuse for being unable to serve your customers with the same amount of service as other tables. This place is bias and unorganized beyond imagination. It's like everyone has their own agendas and ideas of customer service. Let's see what went wrong tonight during my service: 

1. They don't know how to automatically refill your empty water glass. My family sat there feeling like overly dried prunes after eating their overly salty meats and drinking all of our water. Even when the waiters clear your plates, they don't know how to be observant of their surroundings and immediately scurry to the kitchen with the mountain of dirty plates. We had to flag down another waitress (not OUR waitress) for water. At least she immediately returned with water refills. If you want to have salt poisoning, please come here.

2. If your waitress spends more time at the table full of tipsy, sociable males, you know you  are going to be forgotten. This unapologetic, pathetic excuse of a waitress. I see this woman talking to this table more than she provided my table service. Every time they are finished chattering, you would expect to be given some form of customer service. Don't push your luck. This waitress just walks away despite me trying to catch her attention to ask if our chicken hearts are coming soon! Lady, if you want a break, go tell your manager so you can go rest in the back instead of letting your customers watch you "servicing" the table full of males and fully ignoring the people that actually need something from you. Inattentive service killed our experience here. 

3. I waited for MORE THAN HALF AN HOUR for two special items. They have a "special menu" that requires you to order personally from a waiter. I ordered the beef ribs and chicken hearts. My family waited.... and waited... can't wait any longer! We flag down the 1st person and they said 7 minutes. Waiting.... Flag the 2nd person and they said "Oh those take 15 minutes!" Ok great we wait... Flag the 3rd person and they say "Oh it'll be right out and we will have it brought to your table!" Wonderful this place is so full of empty promises and lies that the next part ruined my entire dinner experience. When my family saw the chicken hearts, we were all excited and thinking "finally we can finish our meal!" We watched the chicken hearts go to the table of 10 males that were seated 10 minutes AFTER we were seated. This is ridiculous we ordered these hearts before their whole party even arrived. HOW DID THIS HAPPEN!!! We expressed our frustration to our "flirting" waitress and she gives me a BS excuse that they ordered it longggg before we did. Your service is so full of unjustified excuses that you can stick your pride and excuses on one of those skewer because I didn't need your "I did nothing wrong" attitude. This place is NEVER WRONG APPARENTLY because they don't know what customer service is. 

The rest of my review is in the pictures since I went over the limit. But it's worth the warning I promise.
author: Lori N.

description:
Come really really hungry.

Fogo has really great beef, chicken, and pork. I tried every single meat selection they had to offer ( may I suggest you ask them for the pork ribs...they are really delicious).

Everything was cooked to perfection. Service is pretty stellar. Ambiance is really nice. Great for a romantic date or a casual business meeting.

$65 dollars is not cheap and to make it really worth your while two suggestions: This does not include desserts nor drinks....which are rather pricey.

1) Starve yourself (or smoke a large joint before...people reeked of it)

2) Skip the salad bar. Don't get me wrong it is lovely with all kinds of veggies and cheeses...but to fill up on this stuff at an all you can eat meat orgy is just a crime.

Let me get back to my vegan soy latte with non gmo sweetner.
author: David G.

description: Very elegant environment for an all-you-can-eat place. Our team came here for lunch and it was not crowded at all. The server will bring freshly cooked meat to our table and ask if we need a piece. Unfortunately, they only have 4-5 choices of meat that comes to the table. I can't deny they were all really good! But a little more variety would be better.
author: Yanzhong L.

description:
My night started at the Franciscan and my girlfriend wanted Tres Leche from Fogo so I called to see if I can place an order and the hostess said she can't take phone orders it would have to be in person. So we rushed to finish our dinner and decided against to order dessert at the Franciscan since it's better. I asked her would it take long to package and she went to find out. IN THAT TIME SHE COULD HAVE FOUND OUT IF THEY WERE OUT! 

I make it there 10:24pm walked in and ordered. I thought she was going to the kitchen to package the order but the manager comes.

I'm told by the manager they ran out. Well why didn't your hostess mention that before I had to rush to finish our dinner and drive 15 minutes to you just so you can get your manager to tell me you're all out?!

The hostess is clueless, not only did she didn't bother to tell me on the phone they were out she didn't have the courage to tell me herself that they were out! 

The manager doesn't even try to solve the problem or offer anything for wasting my time. You could have done a simple thing like offer a gift card for my next visit or offer a free dessert the next time I come but no! Now I have to go on Yelp and give you a shit review. All of this could have been avoided if your idiot hostess would have just told me you were out instead of wasting my time and my gas.

This is unacceptable, I'll never recommend this place ever again. This is going on Google too.
author: Avery K.

description:
I will start off by saying I am not impressed with this place at all. 

My boyfriend booked reservations for restaurant week, we had dinner reservations for 7:30. We were not introduced to our table until 7:50. So here we are waiting for the waiter, he came over and asked us what we wanted to drink. We ordered 2 glasses of water and a bottle of Pinot Grigio. 20 minutes passed we asked the waiter where our wine bottle was?....his response was  "we are getting the wine bottle for you"......So, after about another ten minutes we told him to cancel the order for the wine since it never even made its way to our table. 

What else is wrong with my experience? 

Secondly, the meat here is mediocre compared to Espetus. They only have about 6 meat choices. Not only that!!! The bacon wrapped chicken was hard and dry! The prime rib was pretty good but, the overall experience made me lose my appetite. The waiter also checked in on us once... so pretty much I went thirsty no water left in my cup for about half the time I spent here. 

I would think that with the location of this restaurant they would be more up to par. You can't charge people $62 a person and give a half ass job serving. It's all about customer service and making the customers happy... with that being said I'm disappointed and will not be coming back here again. Don't bother wasting your money here!
author: Cupcake 1.

description:
True Rating 3.5

This review is for restaurant week. $65 per person includes all you can eat salad bar, meats, cheese bread, yuca fries + fried banana and mash potatoes. Ending with dessert, choices of key lime cheesecake, cheesecake (caramel, strawberry, chocolate), chocolate mousse.

Came here for a friend's birthday, we had around 16+ people, service was very fast and staff were friendly. Salad bar is pretty decent, they have salads, fruits, smoked salmon, soup and other small veggie dishes/salads. However with the amount of all you can eat steak, chicken, rib eye and other meats you get, you won't be visiting the salad bar much. Meats were a hit or miss, some were kind of dry and some were decent, however I bit oversalted. You get a card that is green and red. Green means you want more meat and red means you are OK for now. Service of the meats bringing to our table was TOO fast, literally I felt every second someone was coming up to me asking if I wanted meat, I felt they could of timed it better. For dessert, I got the chocolate mousse, OMG it was HUGE. They are generous with their portions, however it was too sweet for me and too rich.

Overall I think it was a good experience. Would I purposely come back? Probably not, but for a celebration I would.
author: Natalie L.

description:
We were hoping for  a pleasant dinner celebration.  The market table was not as good as the prior visit.  The soup was a horrible tasting curried soup. The beans were dried out as well as the sausage.  We spoke to the manager walking around and he was just sorry and said, "It usually is very good"  

To top it all off, we could not find our server.  We wanted to order some dessert for the birthday girl.  After 20 minutes, we asked the hostess and several others to get us our bill.  She was MIA and no one could find her.  The servers bringing the skewers of meat were very helpful and pleasant. 

Needless to say, it was a very disappointing dinner. We would not recommend trying this restaurant again unless you need no water, drinks,  your check or service.
author: S C.

description:
I'm a BIG FAN of Fogo! Who doesn't love all the steak and bacon you can eat? (btw if you answered that question with "me" this place probably isn't for you... they do have a pretty good salad bar, though...).

I've been here many times and always have had outstanding service and great food. IMO this is the best Brazilian steakhouse around, and that isn't something I'd normally say about a chain, but I think it's better than other non-chains like Espetus and Pampas.
author: Derrick S.

description: Where else can you get this type of meal?! I always like to go here after fasting all day. I really enjoy the fact that food is brought to you. Glad the Brazilian steakhouse model is being adopted. I also think the service is great and that the food is prepared well.
author: Bob H.

description:
We should check the ratings first before we go. We are disappointed and we can't go back there anymore
 Espefus is better than this one
author: Vivian V.

description: Show up hungry!!! From experience I prefer the brunch salad bar better, it's cheaper and you get most of the meat options! I'm not sure exactly which ones are not offered at brunch, but I've had both dinner menus and there wasn't anything special that I noticed was missing. I've been to this location a couple times now and the service has always been 10/10 and meat cooked perfectly.
author: Becca L.

description:
This place is absolutely awesome. The happy hour deals are pretty good. Drinks are half cost and the food is a pretty good deal as well. The caramelized pineapple old fashioned was a delicious twist on normal old fashioneds. 

I was a little disappointed that happy hour only applies at the bar. I would've liked to order the specials at my table and 

The food was also excellent. I enjoyed the salad bar (the bacon is really good) and the sides that they bring out are SOO good. The garlic mashed potatoes are literally amazing. The crispy polenta and fried plantains are really good too. 

All of the meats were excellent. You really can't go wrong. The Brazilian style of serving the meat on skewers right off the grill is fun. 

The price also wasn't bad for what it was. $60 is a lot generally but for the quality of food and the experience it's great!
author: Nick D.

description:
I have been here three times and each occasion has been disappointing to say the least. Compared to Espetus Brazllian Steakhouse, the food is on par with their rival, but there are a few choices that fall short. Additionally Fogo de Chao doesn't have the shrimp and warm pineapple on their menu. Unfortunately its not the food that scares me, it is the training of the staff and management that worries me. 

I came here for a birthday lunch with my girlfriend and everything went well initially. Food was good and service was attentive. As we were leaving the restaurant after our meal, my girlfriend broke down crying because she had arranged for a birthday dessert with our waiter (while I was in the bathroom mid-meal), and the waitstaff had dropped the ball and forgotten all about her special request. I called the restaurant and talked with management about our incident. The female manager offered to get us back in for a complimentary meal and we scheduled a future date. 

A day before our scheduled comp meal, a male manager called me to verify our arrival for our reservation. Night of our reservation, we checked in with the hostess and were shown our table. Everything went well with the food and service. At the end of the meal, we were presented with a bill that included 2 full-price adult meals. I told our waiter that my meal was supposed to be comped but he told me there was no record of this with the staff. I had to name-drop the names of the two managers I had spoken to, and that still took 5-10 minutes to verify and clear up my bill. I thought the whole experience was embarrassing. What was supposed to be a nice romantic dinner turned out to be an ordeal afterwards. Interesting fact was that the same female manager called me two days later to set up another complimentary dinner because she thought I didn't go to my initial comp dinner. Clearly there is no evidence of communication between the managers and the wait staff. 

My third and final visit here: I brought my whole family and a few friends (group of 9) for my brother's birthday dinner. While the food was good, quality service was severely lacking. There weren't too many rounds of meats brought around and we had to ask repeatedly for special requests. Water and drinks weren't refilled often too. As we approached the end of our meal, we waited and waited for our check to arrive. Despite the last round of meat making its round 40 minutes ago, nobody brought our table the bill. Not seeing a single waiter/waitress around, we decided to get up and and settle our bill on our way out. We saw our main waiter folding napkins on our way out and he just wished us a good night. We told him that we hadn't received our bill and boyyyyyy was he shocked. Had we not been honest people, we would have gotten away with a $900 bill. 

I like Fogo de Chao and have enjoyed a number of their other locations. Sadly the attention to detail is not there for this San Francisco location. I actually like the ambiance and dining room of Fogo de Chao more than the Market Street Espetus location, but sadly everything else fails in comparison.
author: Philip M.

description:
We came here for our office holiday party just a couple weeks ago. The area was spacious with a bar and a full salad bar with cold cut meats.

I have never been to a Brazilian steakhouse before so this was a unique experience for me. I loved having cuts of meat brought to us and we are given a choice of the type of meat we want. They would cut the meat for you onto your plate.

The food was pretty good. I only had pork and chicken. But the pork ribs were amazing. If you're looking for chicken hearts, you'll have to continuously ask for it though. I even tried a little of the sea bass entree option. The sea bass was perfectly done. And I think the next time, I would go for that.

There were so many options at the salad bar. I wanted to try a little of everything. 

Overall, I would definitely come back again. It's a great experience, especially with small groups.
author: Andrea G.

description:
Saw a sign for a new "fogomarket" which is an offshoot of Fogo de Chao.  It's a bit hard to find - walk into the Starbucks from the 3rd St entrance and look to your left.  You'll see a small space set up with a salad bar and some signs.

For 
$6 or $8 (I forget which is which) you can choose from a bowl of Feijoada, or the salad bar, the latter featuring smoked salmon and quail eggs.

I opted for the feijoada and it was very good, hot sauce at the register was the perfect addition and my only request is add some farofa for those in the know.

Quick, easy, cheap lunch option.  I'll be back.  Obrigado!
author: dan s.

description:
I came here for SF Restaurant Week and was ready to eat some meat. While we were a little late for our reservation (totally my fault not blaming them), they were packed due to not opening another section. It may have been due to them not knowing how many people would come for SF Restaurant Week or not but they should have been a little bit more prepared. The hostess was great and ended up getting us seated no problem.

However, once we were seated we were pretty much ignored the entire time. Our waitress came by the first time letting us know how Fogo de Chao works and said she would be back with water. Well, we ended up getting a plate of food from the salad bar, ate it, went and had two servers bring us meat and us asking someone to bring us water before we were given any. Another server dropped by with the cheesy bread and plantains and said nothing when he dropped it off so we really had little idea of what it was as well. Once more people were seated servers were asking them how they were doing and showing much more service too. All the others were older than us but then again that should be no reason for the service we were given.

It took us 15 minutes to flag a server down to get a bill which did not happen and we had to flag another one who came and apologized for being packed which was no excuse. Both me and my boyfriend were disappointed for how much was paid and the type of environment we ended up in and I do not think I will come again even though it may have been a fluke in the service that day.

The food itself was not bad but the experience for this restaurant knocked down its stars.
author: Angela S.

description:
I have mixed feelings about this place.  

We were in a group of 15 people.  We all first met at the bar.  The specialty drinks were tasty, however, very expensive.  Two drinks for 33.00, I'm not sure why the drinks are so expensive.  Again they were tasty, but I'm not sure how much alcohol was actually in the drink.

We were seated at our table after hanging out at the bar.  Our waiter seemed to be preoccupied or just simply clueless.  He approached our group and asked "have you been here before?"  We all replied no!  He then disappeared and did not come back for another 10 minutes.  When he returned, he noticed that one of the other waitresses had already started to help us.  She did her best, but much of the damaged had already been done, thanks to her coworker.

Ok so, the meat guys were not on their A-game either.  I watched the same three men come to our table multiple times with the same selections of meat over and over again.  Garlic steak, bacon wrapped chicken breast, and New York strip. The pork rib guy stopped at our table one time and toward the very end of our night, the lamb chop guy showed up!  Btw- everyone's plates had already been cleared from the table.  What happened to all the other meats?

The staff certainly need to be retrained and the Dining room manager should pay closer attention to what's going on in the dining room.  Our group spent a lot of money for the evening, but none of us will probably never come back because of the lack of customer service and slow service.

The food was tasty but the Market Bar lacked luster. The great thing is that we were among great company, and we had a gracious host!
author: Kathy T.

description:
I had a vendor take us out to lunch at Fogo. This was during a non conference week so that meant the place was not packed at all. We still made reservations for a party of 5 and were seated right away in the front by the kitchen. That meant we were get first dibs at all meat that came out.

Like any Brazilian Steakhouse, there is a dial that you keep at your table. Green = keep it coming, Red = stop. While waiting for the meats to come out, there is cheesy bread, garlic mashed potatoes, and fried polenta at your table. You can also opt to try one of the many options at the salad bar. Try not to load up on too much of that and save room for the beef ribs, the star of the show. 

Two waiters came by to take our drink order (there was some confusion I guess) We did get our drinks promptly and water refilled often. Remember how I said you shouldn't load up at the salad bar? If you had to choose wisely, definitely get some of the cold cuts: prosciutto, salami, salmon, and the cheeses. Stay away from the other stuff unless you want to waste away your appetite. I asked for those beef ribs and they already had one cooking in the kitchen. By the time I came back from the salad bar, it was out and I was ready. I should have asked for seconds as this was quickly depleted and the only thing left were the bones... There's a great selection of meats but the sirloin came around way too often. Definitely get the bacon wrapped fillet (because who turns down bacon?) The ribeye was another big hit. Did I mention the beef ribs? Oh yeah you have to ask for it (nobody tells you this). The lamb meat was also really good. We skipped dessert because we ate too much.

Total time spent: 1.5 hours start to finish.
author: Tim G.

description:
Been dying to try this place and finally decided to go NYE. I've tried Espetus before. Similar concept but I have to say I like this restaurant more for almost every reason. Firstly, the ambiance and decor are spot on. Makes you feel cozy and fancy. Also, the service was great. The meat servers were so quick that my plate was filled with meat before I even got a chance to try any of it. Had to quickly flip my stop sign before another server came. The servers were so nice and really helpful in getting us the meats we want whether it be how it was cooked or which meat selection it was. Only thing I would mention that is inferior to Espetus is the market table. Less selection but no big deal since I barely ate any of it, saving room for the meat. 

My favorite meat was the filet mignon, go figure. It was so juicy and just melted in my mouth. Really seasoned well and seriously the best thing ever. The lamb was also one of my other favorites. The garlic flavoring was everything! If I were to come again, I would just pass on everything else and load up on these two. 

Another thing worth mentioning is the cheesy bread! Never had anything like it before but it was super good!
author: Annie H.

description:
We came to Fogo de Chão on Christmas Eve after making reservations on Open Table a couple weeks prior. After arriving about 30 minutes too early we were still seated quickly. Some of the seats are booths which are more private but where we were seated the tables are in close proximity to each other. The ambience and look is new and upscale. Most of the customers were dressed well unlike myself since I had just come from watching Rogue One at the Metreon. 

As far as the food the Market table has a lot to choose from. Cured meats, all different type salads, rice, and of course Feijoada. 

I'm not sure how the meats come out but there would be quite a few minutes where the meats weren't coming out but then a meat avalanche would happen with one cut after another brought to us. It was overwhelming at times at the fast and furious pace the meat was coming out but then it would slow to a halt so I could eat what I put on my plate. Overall the meat was decent. The best cuts are the ribeye which was tender and delicious, the bottom sirloin was extremely good, and the picanha. Feel free to ask for the certain cuts you are interested in, the guachos were very accommodating. The meat comes rare and medium for the most part which is the way to eat it anyway.

The service was excellent. Overall a really good place for meat overindulgence.
author: Michael L.

description:
SERVICE
- - - - - -
Although we made reservations it took 40 mins to seat us. And when they did it took another 15mins to get a waiter at our table. Once we ordered our drinks, they got my drink order wrong.

FOOD
- - - -
The cuts of meat were pretty good, I just wish I would've gotten to eat some of it. The attendants were more interested in going around the bigger parties and mostly forgot about us.

PRICE
- - - -
For 2 people it was $180 dollars. That included a salad bar, 2 drinks, and some cuts of meat. But the cuts of meat were so far and few in between that I think in the two hours we were there we got maybe 4 pieces. 

GO BACK?
- - - - - - -
Never. Worst money I've ever spent.
author: Jhon P.

description: One of my favorite salad bar place to dine dine I m not a meat eater. I also get very addicted to eating Brazilian cheese bread. Yummy... the best location to dine is in The City and Santana Row.
author: Josephine P.

description: Wow!!!!!!!!! I went to Fogo de Chao tonight with some of my close friends. We all had a wonderful and delicious experience and all of the staff was very friendly and delightful. When I first walked in I was greeted by a very cheerful young lady named Mahelly. She was very pleasant, and treated us all so Wonderful. Our server name was Joe  and  was very knowledgeable and explained  the whole experience  to me and my friends. The whole dining experience of the food and the cold bar was absolutely amazing. I look forward to coming here again.
author: Calise G.

description: Went to eat with 10 friends for a birthday party. Restaurant was very accommodating and they sat us in a semi private seating area. The food was delicious and the service was amazing, especially Tri. He made sure we were all taken care of and made great suggestions for what to eat. He's a big part of why I'd come back.
author: Trevor C.

description:
To start off: the day after this meal, I wanted to eat nothing but veggies. SO MUCH MEAT. 

Once we flipped to green, the meat came nonstop. We started off with the pork ribs and Parmesan pork - both delicious! I was mostly anticipating the cuts of beef, and those did NOT disappoint. Almost every cut of beef was seasoned perfectly and super juicy and tender. My only serving that I wasn't too crazy about was the bacon wrapped sirloin...but really, if bacon wrapped meat was my biggest problem at Fogo, do I have much to complain about my meal? 

The salad bar is pretty solid as well, offering everything from smoke salmon, salads, and fruit, to MORE MEAT. 

Pro tip: eating fruit and some greens in between will save you. 

We came for a friend's birthday dinner and they were great about bringing out the cake, plates, and utensils for the party. Overall, a great dining experience!
author: Winnie T.

description:
My boyfriend and I had the BEST experience here. From the moment we walked in we had amazing service, the food was to die for, the manager came over to our table and explained every cut of meat and even had our chef prepare special cuts not on the menu when he heard it was our first visit. When the chef found out it was our anniversary he even sent over a free dessert! 

I wish I could remember the Chefs name so I could give him props but I know he is from Brazil, and his dad was the one who taught him how cool and you could tell it was his passion. If his managers see this and you know who I'm referring to please treat him well, he is amazing!!
author: Darbie C.

description:
I am always hesitant about these Brazilian places as sometimes the meats can be salt bombs and dry. There were at times salt bombs but overall not too bad. Went for lunch and there were about 9 meat choices. I felt like I spent more time looking for the meat to come. Maybe it was because we were in the middle rather than the outer edges but we got passed up quite a few times. It was the 3 same meats coming to out tables. We got there at 11:30 and the meats didn't really start coming to us until after1 when we were full. 
Wished they had a system to make sure all tables had a chance rather than hoping they would come to us. 

The goods:
Cheese bread
Polento fries and plantains
Decent salad bar ( to pretend you are healthy)
Lamb chops
Garlic beef

The others:
If you can get a cut not too dry or salty they are decent.

Not sure i would return, and not for the price.
author: Daniel L.

description: Wonderful service! The food is amazing and the service was amazing. I celebrated my 32nd  wedding anniversary here recently. My meal was amazing and I had a wonderful time. I suggest this place to everyone.
author: Barbara D.

description:
I have been to Fogo before, and overall I really enjoy it. Food's delicious, but on my third outing, here's something I've come to learn.

The Brazilian steakhouse experience is pretty fun, but when the novelty wore off, I found it to be a little tiresome. They give you an 'on/off' button to indicate whether you want a server to come to you; leave the button on green, and servers will come serving you a variety of choice meats, turn it off and they don't. Pretty smart and simple.

My only issue with this is that, like a lot of people, I ordinarily get myself a full plate of food, enjoy it at my own leisure, and then get more food when I finish. With the system at Fogo, I get spammed with servers providing one slice of meat at a time, so I have to keep my button on green until I get enough food to my liking, and throughout this whole process, I can't have a conversation because servers keep coming up to you with whom you have to address. If they just did it in a way that I wouldn't have to refocus my attention on them, then this would not be an issue, but each server has a different meat selection so you must tell them if you want that choice meat or not.

I went as a party of two, I imagine this scenario would be less tiresome with a larger company. Anytime a server would come, the whole conversation pauses.
author: Patrick L.

description:
I am giving a fair rating. It was good and still a fun experience. Naturally, those who dine here should expect that it will be a bit expensive. 

It was great to go up to the food bar to pick the side items you wanted to eat as the meat carriers came around asking if you wanted a slice. All the meats that came our way was extremely delicious, savory and mouth-watering. 

My issue was more so with our server who just always seemed to miss the mark when it came to my requests. As a result, I had to take out one star because I started to get irritated and flustered asking for anything. I asked for the Limeade (which by the way is delicious! Tangy and not overly sweet). I had to ask 3 times before they finally brought it out. Then I asked for the polenta fries and plantains... they said it was coming out AND it never did. I had to ask someone else who wasn't even our waiter for a plate and he brought it out! When our actual server came back again, I literally said to myself, "Oh God. Do I even attempt to ask for dessert?"  Sure enough, I indicated I wanted the Brazilian Flan which he acknowledged but the only desserts that came out was everyone else's but mine. I had to ask another server to bring me it and they did. 

So all-in-all, it was a good place and I do look forward to coming here in the future. But I do hope the service improves and any of the staff ensures they have stronger organizational and customer-service skills.
author: Rj M.

description:
One of our most favorite restaurants however the service we received for our birthday and anniversary dinner was disappointing.  They were accommodating up until we were seated. We were so disturbed by the poor lack of Service that we shortened Our date and asked for the check. We were then held hostage by staff, waiting, while they attempted to remedy the situation with a very late celebratory happy birthday cheesecake.  Overall it was a bad experience.  We we're half way through with our meal before receiving our hot plates.  SMH!

Perhaps we weren't looking the part since we were dressed very relaxed for a return flight home to conclude our date.  I've never felt so undervalued as a customer.
author: Keese A.

description: I have never had a bad experience! I have been there for Veterans Day for the past couple years and for my birthday, they have treated me so well. The service is outstanding and the food is delicious. If you're from out of town I definitely recommend checking it out. So worth it.
author: Antonio R.

description:
3.5*s

I'm a fan of Fogo. The first time was a 5* experience... servers kept coming around so often that I actually had to flip over the button to red so they wouldn't keep serving all the delicious meat. My friend and I also scoffed at my friend who was "wasting room" on the cheesy brazilian bread (I wound up eating 4 pieces of it and we asked for two extra baskets.)

The second time was a 4* experience. A little less variety of meat, but still pretty attentive and lots of options. My parents who had never been to a Brazilian Steakhouse enjoyed it and spoke well of it.

The third (and most recent) time, it was a 3* experience. I had family visiting over the holidays and for our table of 13, it felt like we had no service! Our server kept talking to other people and averting his gaze whenever he came near us. It kinda seemed like he was drunk actually. The meat options were the smallest variety I had seen (where's the chicken, and all the different beef options? I know that chicken isn't really what one's going for but their chicken was soooo gooood that I was bummed it wasn't offered). The redeeming qualities were the cheesy  Brazilian bread and a server who wasn't our main server, but someone who was attentive and helpful... taking photos, bringing horseradish, etc. 

It's great for groups (easy to book) and would visit again, but the last visit left a bit of a sour taste in my mouth because it was the largest group and we spent the most money that time... only to have the worst experience. 

Still fun, but just not as good as the first two times
author: Sam W.

description: It's okay! I had really high expectations after visiting the one in Vegas last year which had way taster meat and these amazing bacon wrapped jalapeños! With that said the location is very nice, buffet is good and they staff is extremely nice, plus attentive!
author: Elizabeth A.

description:
This place is an amazing carnivore's feast for the heart, and belly too.  Nicely decorated and designed restaurant, comfortable and actually decent for conversation without having to yell.  Came with a group of friends and really enjoyed the entire experience.

First off, the service is very efficient, friendly, and professional.  You can tell they have been trained well and do whatever necessary to accommodate a request.  With so many 'goucho' meat servers running about it is quite well orchestrated.  If you have your card up to signal 'green' some type of meat will instantaneously appear.  The servers are careful to cater to the diner's particular taste and level of how done the meat is cooked. I had a difficult time following all the varieties but really ventured to try several.  All were delciious and succulent cuts, except for the sausage that I found a bit bland, dry and with a tough hard skin.  Some cuts were a bit fatty at the edges but that was good too.
It is quite the show to watch the gouchos running about serving tables.

What impressed me was how courteous the servers were when confronted with a patron heading somewhere in their driect path of travel.  They always step aside and let the diner pass, with a gracious attitude about it.  Nice.  Here they are holding a metal plate with an enormous skewer of meat and yet do not get in the way of putting the patron first.

The 'Market Table' where you start your meal is an adventure in itself.  So many different choices of salads, veggies, cheese, marinated this and that and on and on.  Yes, even quail eggs.  It was fun to just explore and try a variety or things.  There is also a feijoada on a side table where you can scoop rice and the bean and meat stew combo, with some touches on the side (including a firey red sauce).  My impression is that it's good but no where near the quality and taste of what you get in Brazil.  
Also as others have commented they do run low or out of dishes that unfortunately sit baren; but still enough variety to satisfy.

The wine list was good and several Malbecs, as one would expect, and go well with the food.

Overall I enjoyed the experience, and I must say it 's probably best with a group.
author: Tom B.

description:
The service here is excellent, and the food is great. Come here when you're really hungry because you will end up overeating. It's unavoidable. 

Their garlic mashed potatoes are wonderfully creamy, and don't miss trying the soup, because the curry carrot soup is really yummy.

TIP: Come before happy hour is up to take advantage of their $8 drink specials before you eat dinner.
author: Elena K.

description: I recently came to Fogo for the first time this weekend and absolutely loved it. The selection from the salad bar to the meat was overwhelming, many cuts of meats cooked to the preferred temperature. The staff was very friendly and informative. Miley was very kind and seated us right away as we were greeted by Miles right after. Miles recommended a seafood option for our first time (which was my favorite) and a number of drink options. Solid team and solid food.  I found my new favorite restaurant in San Francisco!
author: Mason R.

description:
"Please sir, I don't want any more of your meat"

For those unfamiliar with Brazilian steakhouses, it's basically you vs meat in an all out war with your only weapon being a marker that you can flip between green "I can take it" to red "**** this I'm out".

The salad bar and fruit/cheese selection is aiiight but the meat is where it's at. There's a decent selection and it just keeps coming. From New York steak, to ribs, chicken and lamb you'll get your fill. And you can choose your cut, so if you don't like the meat then be a man get a nice rare cut.

Dessert was more than I could handle. The portions are ginormous and I couldn't even finish mine. But whatevs because meat is my normal dessert anyway and I got what I came for.

I weighed myself the next morning and I gained 5 pounds. Protip: don't weigh yourself the next morning.
author: Joel L.

description:
This was an interesting experience.

Fogo was recommended to me by a good friend and my lady was craving a steak, so we stepped into this place.

I was liking the little buffet area; I've never seen a buffet with fine cheeses. It was when I settled down at my table and saw the wine list that I realized I wasn't going to get a decent wine because everything was from Argentina, Spain, Chile, and maybe a few other places that seem to make wine just as a cute hobby. Fortunately, the sommelier stepped in and helped me choose something, but unfortunately, the wine was terrible and we didn't even finish the first glasses poured for us. The bottle just sat there.

This is a fine establishment, though. Seeing our bottle sitting idly, a man I believe may have been the maitre d' approached us with an apology and two vouchers for $20 off our next visit. I'm not sure, but they might've taken the bottle off our bill. I just don't remember. The service was some of the best I've ever experienced.

As soon as you flip a little placard on your table, you get bum-rushed by a platoon of sharply-dressed men dangling meat in your face. I had to flip my placard back over like I had just opened a door and a river came roaring through. It was luxurious, but I find I can't consume that much animal protein in one sitting. To be honest, I would've been much happier with a little slab of filet mignon and a glass of Bordeaux. 

When it comes to steakhouses, I guess Brazil has some things to learn.
author: Alex B.

description:
Espetus is much much much better than Fogo.

We had big expectations based on the recommendations. However, the quality of the food is nothimg compared to Espetus.

Meats were just ok, only lamb was good. 
Wines are over priced.
Market buffet is good.
Garlic steak was discusting, we could not even eat.

$62 per person! We tried but never ever again. Sorry!
author: Tugce E.

description:
My first Brazilian churrasco steakhouse experience was at Fogo de Chao in Washington, DC. about ten years ago and was impressed with the meal and the overall experience. Since then, I've tried several churrascos in the Bay Area but they did not remind me of the Fogo experience.

Then I was excited to hear that Fogo had opened a restaurant in San Francisco at 3rd and Howard in the former Chevy's location.  Fogo has a higher-end ambiance than their counterparts and this location has two dining sections and a bar separating the two. With the Churrasco meal, you get to enjoy their impressive Market Table, which is full of fresh and flavorful ingredients and recipes that are traditional & natural staples of Southern Brazilian cuisine including salads, smoke salmon, charcuterie of cured meats and cheeses, antipasti, fruits and vegetables. There's also Fogo Feijoada, a traditional black bean stew with sausage that you serve over white rice.  But remember the highlight of the meal is the churrasco, so don't overindulge from the Market Table.

The churrasco features 6 cuts of beef: Prime part of the top sirloin, tenderloin, top sirloin, bottom sirloin, rib eye and beef ribs; a bacon-wrapped steak, leg of lamb, rack of lamb, pork fillets, pork ribs, pork chops, sausage and a bacon-wrapped chicken.  The gauchos come around with a skewer of one of the meat items and will stop at your table if you have your disc on the Green "Yes, Please" side. The gaucho will slice a piece of beef cooked to your liking and you will grab it with your tongs. Turn the disc to Red "No, Thanks" to pause the visits from the gauchos. My favorites were the rib eye, prime top sirloin and the beef ribs. There are sauces for your meats such as   homemade hot sauce, Chimichurri, Horseradish sauce, and mint jelly.  With your churrasco meal, you also get a basket of Farofa cheese biscuits, polenta, garlic mashed potatoes, and caramelized bananas.  Ask your server for the listing of the meats served for the churrasco as a reference.  If you are waiting for a certain meat and the gaucho hasn't come by, ask the server and they will let the gaucho know and they will make sure they will stop by your table.  They do offer a Mango Chilean Sea Bass entrée for those non-meat eaters.  

The Churrasco dinner is $61.95, but sign up on Fogo's eClub and you will get $25 coupons to apply to the cost of your meal.  A good deal! On your birthday, they offer a complementary dessert of your choice. 

Fogo is still as good and memorable as my first experience ten years ago.  A delicious churrasco meal in a nice ambiance with friendly service.  Fogo will be my favorite churrasco restaurant.
author: Al L.

description:
FOGO DE CHAO. or must I say FOOL GO CHOW DOWN!!! That phrase worked better in my head, but seriously, when you're here, you seriously chow down and eat to your heart's pleasure. Yea, theres a lot of Brazilian places such as Espetus or Cleos that offers more meat options and slsad bar choices, but Fogo de Chao is great at offering just the right amount of tasty meat/sides without overbearing you!! 

To start, for about $57+ per person, you really need to make sure you have an appetite (12 options of meat, a hot sides bar, and a salad bar). To be honest, a good amount of the meat is salty, so I highly suggest having a good amount of salad, rice, and an alcoholic drink to help you rinse it all down. The chicken hearts, garlic sirlion, bacon wrapped chicken, and the filet mignon are a must have. Not all meats will be passed around, but feel free to ask your servers for anything particular! Pair em meats with the complimentary mashed potatoes and yuca and you are set! 

Overall, the service and overall ambiance of Fogo de Chao makes it the top notch place it is. I wouldn't say it is the most amazing Brazilian Steakhouse, but this is a great place for special occasions or a TREAT YOSELF kind of day. Their wine selection is also very amazing, but they also have a $35 corkage so feel free to BYOW (Bring Your Own Wine!). Thanks again Fogo for a wonderful experience!!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
Great overall experience. Came here last night to celebrate a birthday and we were seated very timely for our reservation. The service was overall very attentive and friendly. The market bar is well stocked and tidied. Bathrooms are clean as well. DRINKS ARE STIFF. Meat selection is great and the meat is well seasoned.

Only downside was hearing one of the supervisors or someone higher up sort of berate a server. That's really unprofessional in front of guests.
author: Rebecca T.

description:
Fogo de Chão is definitely one of the most unique places I've visited. What I mean by that is - it is not like any other place. It is professional, but yet they make you get your own plate and appetizers just like in a buffet. Then when you are seated, you flip a coaster if you would like some meet. Then, they do rounds when they go around tables checking flipped coasters, after which, they serve you a piece or two.

And it keeps going until you decide you are done. I really enjoyed the place, but thing that I'm not giving it 5 stars is because we have made a reservation weeks before, but ended up getting an outside sitting area. Well, not a biggie. But, our first table had a stability issue, so we had to ask to be switched elsewhere. It is their job to check on tables at least. 

Then drinks were a little slow. While I understand it was during a busy night; I would still expect higher and faster service, because it is not my fault whatsoever.

Other than that, definitely a great place to check out!
author: Ata B.

description:
It's clear from the other reviews that my experience at this restaurant was not unique to me. 

The service was questionable. It took 20 minutes after finishing eating to flag down the waiter - whom we had not seen since the start of the meal. That was at 4:30p on a Monday, so clearly not an issue of being too busy. 

The meat came out rapid fire, though there were only a few options that I didn't find too salty and unpleasant. The good ones were GOOD, but good luck seeing those come around when you want them. 
The market bar and rice and beans were all delicious. 

To make the price worth it, make sure you haven't eaten anything all day and give yourself a couple hours at least.
author: Matthew C.

description:
FOOD COMA!!! 

I can't give it anything less than 4 stars, as service was top-notch and all the beef (Where's the beef?), especially New York steak and sirloin were succulent.  Somehow, they need to work on their pork recipes and bacon-wrapped meats, those were a little dry and salty.  The cheese bread though, I love that I can't taste the cheese and reminds me of a teeny tiny popover.  The mashed potatoes, plantains, and polenta fries were all tasty, don't make the rookie mistake of filling up on the sides or the beautiful salad bar!

Shout out to our servers Alfredo & Amanda; however, the server extraordinaire of the evening was fabulously Southern Stuart, who was upselling shrimp cocktail to Cognac.  I was expecting cigars next...good LAWD!  If you've missed him the first time, he'll be sure to come around.  Don't be tempted, there's no pressure.  Over the years, I've only dined at Espetus (both SF & San Mateo locations).  They don't have an upsell guy/gal coming around, and their desserts are more satisfying.  Fogo's desserts are way too sweet - got milk?  

I wouldn't dine here often, only for special occasions.  I'm definitely coming back for the happy hour.  Sign up for their EClub to receive coupons.  Valet parking is $20, plenty of street parking after 6pm and nearby lots.  There's a coat check and space for luggage; I saw numerous people come in with their rolling suitcases.  Green means go, red means "no mas".  At times, the little card must be flipped to red; otherwise, you can't keep up!  

Make a reservation, highly recommended for my fellow carnivores ~ SALUD!!!
author: Christine R.

description: I think I am done eating at Fogo de Chao. It is expensive anx they can't cook the meats right. The san Francisco Fogo service was awful.  I would have card turned to green and the gouchos would look right at it and pass me by. One lady ignored me all night.  Horrible service.
author: James H.

description:
I stumbled upon Fogo one day with a friend and I was SHOCKED upon entering- the atmosphere was lovely and the food was even better. I was shocked how quickly we were seated even though the restaurant was crowded and even more amazed how quickly we were served copious amounts of delicious meat! Stuart was our server and he was attentive, funny, and so charming! Stuart alone is enough to bring me back! 

I have since taken pretty much every person I know to Fogo and they were all amazed too!
author: Jillian S.

description: Came here for an anniversary meal with my husband after a day of sightseeing in town. We were promptly seated and served, the meats came around fairly quickly. The market buffet was delish but we had to drag a worker over to request refills for our iced tea. I didn't mind the restaurant, the only issue I had was the manager seemed to rush people out when they were taking a break from eating to enjoy the experience. I felt like he wanted people to go as soon as possible. Given the price you pay ($60+ per person, not including drinks), I felt this was very unprofessional and even rude and classless.
author: Lauren M.

description: Slow service and unimpressive meat. This place needs more staff and a bit more flavor on their meat selection. The only positive part was the Gauchos asking what our preference for meat is, granted it was as we were getting ready to leave. Ooops.
author: Lil T.

description:
love it. went there on Saturday. made reservation for 3 at 1pm. There were not a bunch of people.  the service is pretty good. Waitress explained to me about how this works. 
Food is awesome!! but kind of expensive.
author: Tina H.

description:
Finally tried Fogo de Chao for the first time on my friend's birthday. 
When we got there the place wasn't that busy, maybe cause it was Halloween night and it was also a tuesday night. The ambiance of the restaurant is very clean and had a classy feel to it. The self serve food bar is well stocked and has many different options. They had a wide selection of food such as fruits, various cheeses, prosciutto, salads, marinated mushrooms, marinated artichokes, and baby pickles and more. 
I think my favorite item of the night was their cheese bread, it was so soft and tastety. I can eat those all day everyday. The meat that I had that night were just ok, I didnt find it spectacular or worthwhile. One of my acquaintance and I wanted another round of the garlic seasoned meat and for some reason we were brought a regular one that I assumed was garlic seasoned but noticed it wasnt when I tasted it and then we were told the garlic seasoned one would take a few more minutes. After a few minutes, we finally got the garlic seasoned one but it was overcooked and dry but I still give them props for trying to accommodate what we wanted. 

Since it was both my friend's birthday on Halloween they let the birthday people pick one item off their dessert menu and the size of their dessert is huge. We shared two desserts among a group of five and we barely finished.

Service was extremely attentive. When we sat down we ordered wine and the server was very informative and gave me a great recommendation. All their employees were great and welcoming which made the dining experience better.
author: David Y.

description:
Fogo de Chao is great!
We only ever go when they aren't busy though. (Otherwise you can be there for hours just waiting to try the different cuts of meat.)
Drinks are great. Desserts are good. Try everything from the salad bar.
I like my meat well-done and they are very accommodating (I know, all the meat connoisseurs are cringing...) Just be prepared to wait a little longer for your cuts (obviously.)

Absolutely worth the price at lunch time!
author: Matta D.

description:
Fogo De Chao will blow you away. The salad/food bar and the HEAVY amounts of exceptional ALL YOU CAN EAT meat will make you think you passed away 5 minutes and went to heaven, no joke! Fogo De Chao  is in a league of their own, you MUST experience this restaurant because you will smile with amazement at your date/significant other/friends/coworker or imaginary friend across the table because Fogo De Chao is a astonishing place to eat with so much GOODNESS!
#greencardsup
author: Daniel S.

description: Decadent amounts of meat! Great all you can eat food bar. I would go back for the food bar anytime! Great service, special occasion place!
author: Teresa B.

description: Service was horrible. The gauchos are not attentive at all. One person just basically went by us without even asking us if we wanted the picanha that he was holding when in fact we've specifically asked for that cut of meat. He went back to the kitchen without even offering us with a meat. I asked for cheese bread multiple times but none came. The manager kept asking us what choice of meat we want but it took them almost forever to come in and even with that they only came once and did not come anymore. We had 14 in our table and not everyone was able to taste the cut of neat we requested. There's more but I'll just end this review and state that you'd be better off going to espetus or galpao
author: Edgar T.

description:
Having recently watched Pelé: Birth of a Legend, a movie about Brazil's iconic soccer star, and with the Rio Olympics going on in Brazil, I was reminded of a superstar-marathon-of-a-lunchtime-feast at Fogo de Chao the wife and I had. Not sure why it took so long for Fogo de Chão to open up a location in San Francisco, but I am glad that they did since now I can get my carne-carnival fix on without having to go to Man Jose.  

Sure there are other churrascarias in town, but I have always felt Fogo de Chão was the best, making me forego the chow at their rivals. If you have never been to a churrascaria, it is an AYCE experience where olé, olé, olé gauchos literally carry around skewers of barbecued meat around to your table and you have the option of saying yes (sim) or no (não). 

In terms of value, I would recommend coming during their weekday lunch where you get the most bang for your buck at $36.95. This includes the salad bar and pretty much all of their cuts of meat. More importantly, Fogo de Chão serves picanha and rack of lamb for lunch. The sheer amount of lamb ribs that I end up devouring easily covers the cost of lunch. 

The trick to Fogo de Chão and most churrascarias is to not be afraid to say no, even when the occasional annoyed gaucho tries to make you take a cut of meat you don't feel like eating. 

Just say no to parmesan pork.
Just say no to anything chicken. 
And just say no when the beef is not cooked to your liking. 

Seriously, you are in control here. Tell your gaucho if you want your picanha a little more cooked. Or tell a gaucho if you want a specific cut of meat. If a friendly gaucho that has a perm and kind of looks like Alexandre Pato is working, definitely request meat from him. The ginga is strong with him. 

Also, my additional hacks of Fogo de Chão that will make your experience better is to ask your server for the following complimentary extras:

* Mint jelly to compliment the rack of lamb;
* Chimichurri sauce to pair with the picanha or sirloin steak and;
* Lime wedges to just squeeze onto the beef for a party in your mouth. 

For some reason, like In-N-Out's not-so-secret menu, you need to ask for these things. Also, do get some salsa from the salad bar and my favorite side, hearts of palm (literally baby palm trees). By this point I must sound like a baby killer... baby sheep aka lamb and baby palm trees. 

Moreover, if you are fortunate enough to be served by Mahelly, your experience will definitely be 5-star. Not only does she look like a Brazilian model, she went above and beyond to make our experience fantastic to the point that I wanted to do some capoeira spinning kicks like Eddy Gordo from Tekken. Sadly, after gorging at Fogo de Chão, my fat ass was barely able to make it out onto Howard Street. 

For the weekday lunch value and the great service, our experience was five stars. 

* Don't overload on cheeseyballs. 

* I would recommend parking at the Fifth and Mission Garage (https://www.yelp.com/biz/fifth-and-mission-parking-garage-san-francisco-2) and walking over so that you can digest your meal on the walk back.
author: Richard K.

description:
Come prepared with an empty stomach, because meat sure fills you up quickly!  If you're going for the churrasco experience (endless tableside service of Brazilian BBQ), I would recommend going easy on the side dishes (though the cheese bread is to die for!), the market table items (salads, fruits, cured meats, etc.), and the feijoada bar (stew, soup and rice) so you can save room for all the delicious meats they bring around :) 

Each person gets a small round placard that you can flip to the green "Yes, please" side to let the servers know you'd like more BBQ. The servers come around periodically with giant skewers of BBQ and cut you a slice/piece when you request it. Use the small tongs to hold onto the meat as they cut it for you. Its AYCE, so make sure to try a bit of each of there plentiful variety of cuts and different meats - lots of options! Do note that some dishes are a la carte and not included in the churrasco price, so just be aware of that (e.g the seafood dishes are not included), though they're pretty good about letting you know.

Overall, amazing meal and most of the meats were really really good (feel free to let them know which ones you'd like if they don't bring it around for you). Servers were very attentive and came around often with different cuts of meat, so there was not shortage of variety. Also, I loved the cheese bread! 

Fogo de Chão is definitely worth the visit at least once, but the churrasco is definitely a huge meal that you should walk into hungry and be prepared to gorge a bit on.  Be prepared for a food coma and/or food babies afterwards. I think I walked out with food triplets ;)
author: Jennifer W.

description:
This place had the most expensive meal for one person at $4600- 

On July 12th,  I was served chicken that was very well charred around the edges.  As I chewed the chicken, I felt something strange, my right upper tooth broke. The General Manager at Fog De Chao asked me to send them the invoice from my dentist to repair my tooth. He was very empathetic and understanding, gave me corporate's number.  The representative tuned it over to their insurance company.  Leeta Perez with Zurich asked me to send my dental image before the incident. Leeta sent me and email and stated, they didn't see negligence and would not offer to repair my tooth. She said she would speak with Fog De Chao's corporate if they would offer to pay in good faith.  She responded a week later through an aggressive email that they would not. 

I wouldn't recommend this restaurant, they are not good at keeping their word or taking accountability for any incidents while dining, even when their GM takes accountability.
author: Danielle C.

description: The meat were good, til maybe the fourth slice. The hostess asked us what to drink and consciously brought over bottled water each charging 7 dollars in response of "water". Dirty. The waiters seemed to have a reverse understand of the word "little", every time I said just a little bit, they gave me the thickest cut they could. Obviously this is an all-you-can-eat place, but I don't appreciate this way of feeding up your customers. Won't go again.
author: Jong-Kai Y.

description: Went with my co workers to celebrate hitting our goals for the quarter and we had a fun time. Very nice Brazilian steakhouse, a little more upscale than ones I have seen in the past. Excellent selection of meat, you name it they probably have it. Rib eye, lamb, top sirloin, chicken wrapped in bacon, pork, sausage... all piping hot, tender and ready for you to devour. An excellent salad bar for those that want to waste stomach space and fill it up with that. Also a great selection of sides. Friendly people, nice location, overall fun experience.
author: LeVar H.

description: Lovely atmosphere. The service was outstanding. Victoria was one of the best servers we have ever had the pleasure of having. The food is outstanding, seasoned and cooked perfectly. We will definitely be back when we travel back to CA.
author: Michelle S.

description:
First time coming here and I loved it! 

In my opinion, it was way better than Espetus and I would definitely come back again. The only reason I was going to Espetus is because it was closer and parking was friendlier but I ended up doing valet parking and it made life so much easier. 

Stuart was my server and being my first time here, he was very polite and friendly. 

The cheese bread that they give you in the beginning is amazing and my favorite steak were the Piranha and the Top Sirloin. I liked how the meat servers came by my table a lot throughout my dinner and didn't have to ask servers to keep coming to my table unlike Espetus-where they usually just go to the big tables first and give what's left to the others. 

Their wine list is huge as well and I ended up getting the Gran Malbec Reserve from Argentina.  

In all, the food and the staff was great and I would recommend everyone to come here!!
author: Alan S.

description:
One word, AMAZING. To be honest I'm pretty impressed with their selections of wine and most importantly meat. DELICIOUS . Our servers were excellent and very attentive. 

Definitely visit again!
author: Jenny O.

description:
I'm a very big fan of Brazilian steak houses, however I was very unimpressed this past week when I came here for my brothers birthday. I was expecting the experience to be top notch, but it ended up being very disappointing. Not only was the service on the low side, but the meats were just not what I was expecting. I felt like everything was overly salted, which is an automatic NO for me. I also felt like the different meats were lacking flavor. During the time that they were bringing around the meats, there were about 1-2 batches of meat that tasted somewhat decent. As I was trying the meats, everything ended up going onto another plate that I wasn't planning on eating. This was very upsetting to me because I truly was expecting something more. 

I was utterly disappointed with the service. I had ordered two glasses of ice, which took 25 minutes to bring to me. In addition, my brother had ordered an alcoholic beverage from the bar and it took about 30 minutes for them to get that over to him. I had to get the supervisor/ manager to come over to our table before these things were taken care off. 

In terms of the salad bar, this was basically what saved dinner for our table. Most of our group was pleased with the salad bar options and it's what made the experience slightly better. I was definitely not expecting the experience to turn out the way it did. If I had to choose between Espetus Churrascaria and Fogo De Chào, I'd go with the first one.

I'm willing to give this restaurant another try, because it could've been an off day, but at this point, I wouldn't recommend it for a big party like we had. Hope the things I mentioned can be looked into and changed by management.
author: Julia K.

description: Foga de Chao is a great restaurant. I frequent the location in San Diego when I can. During my visit to SF and it being Lent, I opted to just get the buffet w all the salad fixings I wanted. It hit the spot!! Foga serves up the these special polenta fries that I've only had here. Best I've had! Fantastic @ Foga!
author: L J.

description:
This is a meat lover's paradise! Servers parade around with various grilled meats, from lamb to filet mignon, and you can have as much or as little as your heart and stomach desire. Be sure to pace yourself - turn your card over to red in between meats. Don't feel like you have to have all the meats at once. There is more than plenty to go around. The meat quality is excellent, and well seasoned. I am fond of the garlic sirloin!

The Market Bar is fabulous - beautiful selection of fresh veggies, fruit, salads, cheese, charcuterie, soup, smoked salmon, etc. You can easily fill yourself up on the Market Bat alone, so be careful not to overload your plate before you begin indulging in meat. You can always opt to just have the Market Bar if you would rather not splurge on the full experience, or do not want meat.

If you do opt for the full experience, just be aware that once you start eating meat, they will also bring you family style servings of mashed potatoes, polenta fries, and caramelized plantains. So, again, pace yourself with Market Bar goodies.

If you are a vegetarian, or would prefer not to have unlimited amounts of meat carved at your table, there are other meal options, including fish. But honestly, I can't imagine why anyone would come here and not participate in the meat experience. Also, some vegetarians might find grilled meat being carried around the restaurant upsetting, so it might not be the best place to take vegetarian and vegan friends...just sayin'!

Very good service, nice modern steakhouse vibe, excellent cocktails, and a fun experience!
author: Melissa M.

description: You ever have meat waved in your face for a couple hours? If not, then try this place. Some of the meats you'll like, some not. Overall it a pretty dope experience. They bring you all types of different meats on a stick and you tell them what you want to try. They have a buffet table with other things you can eat as well.
author: Chad J.

description: I've been to Fogo de Chão in Beverly Hills and there is no comparison! The lack of service here in S.F. was ridiculous!!! I would definitely recommend going elsewhere if you're planning on spending more than $50/person and expecting great service for doing so... Disappointed doesn't even begin to describe how I'm feeling right now!
author: Jason E.

description:
Out of all the churrascarias in the Bay, Fogo is my favorite so far.  The selection is a little more varied with more flavorful meats. The salad bar is a bit more extensive. The atmosphere is more lively and the wait staff incredibly personable and attentive. 

First, the meat. Great selection but can be hit or miss. Garlic steak, beef ribs, and lemon chicken were fantastic! New york strip and lamb were both good but not mind blowing. Sirloin came around too often, was too chewy, and a bit bland. Can't remember what else we had. I was a bit disappointed that my friends raved about the filet but that never came around. 

The servers were friendly and attentive, really seemed proactive instead of reactive.
author: Judy C.

description: Great food. Great service. Have been the taurinus in San Jose espirtus in sf and flame in fire in Roseville and this place takes the win
author: Rob H.

description:
Came here for a lunchtime buffet and opted for the salad bar because all that meat just wasn't appealing for noon on a workday but I was definitely jealous of everyone's plates. 

However, the salad bar itself was awesome and filling. Every kind of salad you could want or salad toppings you'd need. Plus some meats like prosciutto, salmon, salami, and chicken salad. 

Their buttery (cheesy?) rolls are to die for. I considered sneaking a purseful out.
author: Kelly G.

description:
The only reason I don't give 5 stars its because of parking.  

Excellent food, fresh, plenty and delicious!!!  We had a reservation and we immediately got greeted and seated. The restaurant is modern and peaceful!!!  We got out table and immediately the server brought us waters, mashed potatoes and polenta sticks.  Immediately after that we went to the salad bar which was full of fresh and delicious veggies, cheeses, fruits, etc. Etc. Etc!!!  And of course, immediately the meats started coming!!!   DE-LI-CIO-SO!!!   I can't say enough of the excelent service the Gauchos (meat guys) gave us!!!  SO PROFESSIONAL, CORTEOUS AND PROMPT!!!  This is definetely our new favorite Brazilian Churrasco Steak House!!!
author: Karime C.

description: Amazing service by our Tri.  Outstanding hospitality by the entire restaurant! Definitely coming back again!
author: Micah K.

description: Amazing service!! Sat at the bar for bites and drinks and I must say, this is the best customer service I've ever had in SF!! Truly kind and caring wait staff, makes me want to come back!! Food was also awesome!! Beef ribs!! Pork ribs!! Sliders!! Will definitely return. Awesome happy hour specials too! Everyone was so sweet. I felt very welcomed.
author: Holly M.

description: This was an incredible experience. So much delicious food and the service was like being waited on by 50 people at once. I can't wait till my next visit.
author: Santiago G.

description:
This place is very tasty 
Come hungry they just keep bringing the most delicious cuts of meat 
Be careful you will probably over eat
author: Joe O.

description: First and probably last time here. Service was mediocre. Was ignored most of the night by the waiter. The food was so-so. For the price you would think that they would bring out all meats and not have to "special" request items. Wife wanted Chilean Sea Bass and the waiter never even bothered to ask if we wanted any seafood. I recommend espetus, Cleo or Pikanhas.
author: Willy V.

description:
I think this is a really nice restaurant for a date, but I think it was too expensive for the food quality. If you want to have a nice night out then I think the ambiance of this restaurant and luxury of ayce is worth it, but just as a meal I'd want more quality for the price. I feel like Espetus was more worth it as they had a way better salad bar and better tasting meats. 

Service: hard to say because I went here as a large party event (70+ people). I found the service VERY slow though. Not sure if it was a stalling technique or they were overwhelmed. Took an hour just to let everyone go to the salad bar, constantly were calling out to the carvers, and they didn't deliver dessert as was promised in the group package (was served sharing style vs individual... and again suuuper slow) 2/5

Food: salad bar just ok 2.5/5 and meats cooked ok but not much flavor. I could grill better meats myself. Also I feel like there wasn't much variety compared to espetus - only a 4 different types were offered to us (again this may be poor service or stalling technique) 3/5
author: Anna N.

description:
I'm a big fan of Brazilian steakhouses, and been to Pampas and Espetus multiple times. I had been waiting to try Fogo for a while, and decided to do so this week since they were offering $25 off per person (up to 2 person per table). 

I enjoyed the ambience of this SF outlet - great interior design, lovely music, polite staff. They got to do something about the front door though - it shuts very loudly on its own, especially when it's windy, and it's usually windy in SF - so yea, it's really loud every time someone goes in or out.

Really impressed by the Market Table (their version of a salad bar), with smoked salmon, fruits, vegetable, cheese, salad, soup. rice, etc. The setting of the Market Table is exquisite. 
The meat from the barbecue selection is of a higher quality than other Brazilian steakhouses I have tried. Filet mignon, lamb rack, beef rib, sirloin - everything was top grade. 

I find their BBQ seasoning to be on the stronger side. It's best to pair the meat with sides from the Market Table so that your taste buds are not overwhelmed by the meat seasoning.

 It was a fabulous meal. Only disappointment was the lack of seafood (shrimp) or grilled pineapple in the barbecue offering - both Espetus and Pampus offer those.
author: Jasmine H.

description:
I went here for my birthday and it was glorious! 

First, make sure to have a reservation. This place was packed at 7pm on a Saturday. Upon arriving, we didn't have to wait at all for our table, which was awesome. 

As we sat down, the server asked us if we were celebrating something so we said it's for a birthday. She then said to leave room for complimentary dessert. 

Before coming here, I recalled my experience at their San Diego location and promised myself not to stuff my face with their tasty cheesy bread balls. I think I only had three but couldn't resist the temptation of their well presented Market Table, which had veggies and fruits. 

There is a coaster with green color on one side and red color on the other. Green means keep the meat coming and red means stop. I enjoyed so many types of meat and I was surprised by how juicy the citrus marinated pork was. The meal also comes with a bunch of side dishes! Mmmm...love!

Then of course I had my birthday dessert of Strawberry Cream, which was basically strawberry ice cream. It was very refreshing after a meal with so much meat. 

All in all, I would definitely come back here for more tasty meats! You can also count on me to be here in a pair stretchy pants instead of a dress!
author: Alice L.

description:
What a nice experience being able to find a great Brazilian Churasccaria in the Bay Area finally. I take this way over Espetus for sure. We went here on New Years and the decor and location was very nice. 

About the food, a full dinner includes unlimited salad bar and of course delicious cuts of different meats that they cook in their rotisserie style grill. The salad had some of my personal favorite salads, vegetables, and other condiments. From there, everything was fresh as it should be. Onto the more important topic of the night was their selection of meats. Medium-rare is what I liked and their Top Sirloin, Ribeye, and Filet Mignon were among my favorites of the night. The combination of marination and salt was excellent. Although, the Filet with bacon was too salty for my liking and I wish the bacon were more crispy. But food experience was great. Our waiter as well was very welcoming and informative on the options we had in our first visit.

One faulty part of the entire experience is the frequency of the gauchos coming around to our table. Our table was actually hidden behind a pillar and it seemed that we were hard to spot. We had to ask a couple waiters to holler at the gauchos to come around to our table. 

But in the end, we were still satisfied according to our stomachs since we are to our hearts desire!
author: Roy H.

description:
This sure isn't Chevy's anymore. It's an all-you-can-eat meat house granted a high-end one, but there's no getting around the concept of having servers come every three minutes with different skewers of mostly succulent meats. Those eternally carnivorous diners who have already been to Espetus Churrascaria know what they're in for here, and it's a much nicer place than the one portrayed in the bridal shower lunch scene in "Bridesmaids" before they, well...you know. Anyway, I made an Open Table reservation for Jamie W. and me, and we were surprised how bustling business was even around 6PM.

Once we told the server we were here for the $59.95 Full Churrasco Experience, we were handed the circular cards - green on one side, red on the other - which indicates to the men with the meat if they should stop by and start carving.
