We politely asked for the check and left after paying the bill.  I will not return.  Service 0.5 to 1 Star.
author: John T.

description: What a disappointment.  I've been to many of their locations across the country and this one is by far the worst I have experienced.  The salad bar was depleted of a lot of items by 7:00.   Hardly any salad or salad dressings no Brie and no smoked salmon. We had to ask several times over a 20 minute timeframe when was it going to be refilled. The Feijoada bar which needs rice to actually be Feijoada had an empty rice container.  We had to ask for that to be refilled. We were promised beef ribs as part of the meat offerings but they never came.  We asked three times for the ribs and each time the server said oh they're coming.  Well they never came.  Totally unacceptable service for $62.95 per person. We will not be back. A completely unsatisfactory and aggravating dining experience which should have been great.
author: Matt S.

description: I had a great time here. The food was delicious and our servers were attentive. I look forward to going back. Their coffee is one of best I've had
author: Rich S.

description: I made dinner reservations for Thursday evening, last minute reservations I should mention and I was happy to see it made no difference in treatment.  The valet parking was convenient, especially in that part of town and the service was top notch from meet and greet to departure. I don't do many yelp reviews but I felt compelled to give a five star, not just because the food and restaurant was amazing but because of Mahelly Ferreira the General Manager.  I don't know when she works but your in for a treat if she is there that night.  She does a great job of getting around to all the tables to check in on your experience and she totally made the night.  Mahelly is a Brazilian native and she totally brought Brazil to us by telling us stories of her child hood and her traveling back and forth, she really seemed genuine and wanted to connect with the customers.  She told us to practice our Portuguese while we were away and we definitely plan to come back soon. Such a great time!
author: Phillipe E.

description:
Four of us, who have been friends for over 20 years, went to dinner last night to celebrate all of our birthdays. I mentioned this in a note when I made my reservation (via OpenTable) but it was never acknowledged during our visit. 

First off, our server was absolutely wonderful; professional, friendly, patient, always smiling and very helpful answering our questions. I wish I could say the same about the rest of the staff. A handful of them had bad attitudes and made snide remarks to us during our dinner. 

At one point I had to excuse myself from the table to take a phone call. I walked outside to take my call and when I came back in I approached the host stand to ask where the bathroom is. My exact words were, "Could you please show me where the bathroom is?" Just as one of the hosts was about to answer my question, there other one cut her off to say, "Yes, we have bathrooms. Isn't that neat?" That would have been unnecessary to say even if I had asked if they have bathrooms. The fact that I asked where the bathroom was and received this response made it even worse. It made me feel bad to be spoken to like that and took away from what should have been a great experience. 

As for the food, I enjoyed it but many dishes were overly salted.

This is not my first time eating at Fogo de Chao but it is likely my last. When spending the kinds of money they charge (our bill for four people was ~$450) I expect a higher level of service. In a food centric city like San Francisco, better food and service are easy to find.
author: Mike R.

description:
I went for a lunch on a weekday just to see what this place was like if you are not in the mood for the meat sweats during a heavy dinner.  I grabbed at seat at the bar which was maybe a third full.  The rest of the place was maybe half full and had the normal salad bar set-up.  It appeared that the meat was still flowing just like in the evenings.  

I had the braised beef rib sliders and was really happy with them.  Three well topped sliders was a good portion for a light lunch and they also brought me some yuca flour cheese bread that was delicious.  I wonder if they could use that bread for the sliders?  It was $12, decent value for the flavor.  I got a side of Chimichurri too which was a nice condiment for the sliders and good in it's own right.

Better than overall expected for lunch.
author: Scott M.

description:
Customer service is terrible.... it was not even busy during the time we arrived. There were about 12 tables seated in the far inner section. The waitress couldn't handle a big table or didn't want to ..  she ordered drinks with her but when she decided to come back after 20 minutes she asked if we wanted to drink anything else besides water ....additional meat came  for about 30 minutes.. When we asked the waitress if the gentlemen could come to our table with meat she gave us attitude and then more attitude when we asked for more cheese bread ... like sooo sorry we trouble you, Angela 

Also it seemed as if the meat servers did not want to come to our big table. The menu boasts 18 kinds of meats, our table got to taste about 5. After those 5 meats came to our table, no 
Theres also one meat server I want to point out. He is a little older about late 50's with salt and pepper hair. He would literally scowl and mug us every time he came to our table. He was frustrated that not everyone wanted some dry pork chop the first time  .... and then every time he passed by our table after that he had a sour look on his face .....

Will not be coming back here the meat was about a 3 star max while the bad service ruined this experience.
author: Michelle W.

description:
I've been to a few other Brazilian steak houses in the area... and this has to sadly be last on the list..

For what we paid, we definitely did not receive the best service which I was really disappointed by. The meat itself was okay... fun experience but the meat wasn't the best at a Brazilian steakhouse I've tasted. The sides were good. I liked the plantains and the mashed potatoes. 

The sides on the salad bar thing were mediocre. Nothing stood out or complimented our dishes that well.. way too crowded in a small space and no line forms. People just walk around as they please and cut. And where the rice and beans were are located are very inconvenient and crowded..

I really was excited to come here but I just wasn't pleased. Drinks took forever (nonalcoholic) as well as the sides. We flipped our signs to green and meat came but for 10-15 minutes we had no sides to eat it with. Had to ask someone twice. Sorry... I won't be back.
author: Daisy S.

description:
First time visiting this place. I've seen it so many times in Chicago and have always wanted to go so his was a great time to go since this new one just came to the Bay Area. I really enjoyed this place and the atmosphere is very warm and is a great option for a date night.

If you have never eaten here it's one flat fee for adults and it includes a serve yourself bar as well as all the Brazilian meats your stomach can handle. The meats include a variety of beef, chicken, pork, lamb and other delicious options. 

I only give it 4 stars because I do think the drinks are a bit pricey (I should expect it from a place like this) but the price does not lack for potency of the drinks. 

All in all if you go I do recommend to pace yourself and don't let your eyes outdo your stomach. I seriously had a meat hangover the next day. Great place!
author: William W.

description: Horrible management!!!! They made an mistake with our reservation then made it seem like it was our fault. Then when I was seated I asked to speak to a manager...... not knowing the person that was rude and I was complaining about was the manager.  Very awkward complaining to the person your complaining about. Waiters were awesome food was great but won't go back if it's the same management.
author: Tiko T.

description:
Heard that this place was expensive compared to the rest of the Brazilian steak house,  to my surprise the price was reasonable.  Maybe because we don't drink alcohol, let me tell you about the meat selection,  the appointment time and placement of seats. Had a lunch reservation,  got seated in less then 5 mins,  so I am wondering why the negative comments. 
Place we sat , hmm, it would have been better if the couple behind us,  wouldn't keep going to the salad bar. Because the gentleman behind was a large gentleman and anytime he left ,my section would go up a bit. , due to the weight.
Let's talk about the Salad bar, good selection,  had some really tasty items. I was prepared,  having learned my lesson from previous steakhouse,  not to fill my Salad plate. And stick to the steak and proteins. That is the main  reason why we chose that place , ahem..
My guy is Brazilian,  so steak houses are pretty common . So the only complain he had was no rice , no beans ,, really
The service was so awesome,  very attentive and meat selection was better then some brazilian steak houses.  They were very generous with their cuts,  and to my dismay,  I couldn't partake as much as I wanted like in the past. Maybe we are aging more and no longer are spring chicken . 
I will go back , just for the service and overall I really like the ambience ..
author: Liz S.

description:
Ok, so with so many food options in this city, we try to stay away from chain restaurants but Fogo has been great at all of the locations we have been to and that's what keeps us coming back! 

We had parents in town that had never been to a Fogo de Chao. We totally impressed them with this spot, so much so that I think they will be travelling to either Baltimore or King of Prussia to visit their nearest location... both 90 minutes away!

Don't be afraid to request the gauchos swing by with your favorite cuts! For whatever reason, we always seem to miss the lamb as it makes the rounds but we only have to ask, and then very quickly we end up with multiple lamb cuts at our table!!!
author: Sarah S.

description:
Yessssssssssssssssssssssssssssss

If Fogo de Chão does not translate to "Abundance of Delicious Mouth Watering Meat", it definitely should.

Fogo de Chão is located on the corner of the busy intersection where Chevy's used to reside. Being close to the Moscone Center, Metreon, Westfield, and the abundance of SoMa businesses, it is situated in a prime location to draw in hungry workers looking for a hearty meal.

The atmosphere here has a fancy feel to it yet still comfortable. The lighting is at a nice dim level with a nicely placed Market Table in the center of the restaurant and an open kitchen with a nice view of all the meat being prepared for the feast to come. I came here with a group of 10 on a Wednesday night and was able to be seated promptly. Before moving on to the food, I also want to say that the service is especially friendly and attentive. They only made the whole experience all the more enjoyable.

There's so much food that they provide you with here that I don't even know where to begin! For dinner, the Market Table is open for the picking whenever someone wants to get some fresh goodies. The items available include your typical salad bar items such as sun dried tomatoes, arugula, mushrooms, artichokes, and peppers as well as some other foods such as salmon with capers, prosciutto, an assortment of cheeses, bacon, and roasted garlic. There's a lot to try there with a taste of freshness and quality. 

With the dinner meal, they provide an unlimited amount of sides to the table. The mashed potatoes are somewhat typical, but other than that the sides are quite special. The polenta fries and fried banana were great to start off with to stimulate one's appetite. The Brazillian cheese bread they provide are very unique in that they don't taste starchy at all. They have a crispy consistency on the outside while having a chewy mochi-like texture on the inside. They can be quite addicting, but nice to take a bite out of between eating pieces of meat.

The main attraction at Fogo de Chão by far is the meat. Each seat has a token with one side being red and the other side green. Red indicates to the servers that you would like to take a break while green means bring it on! The servers constantly arrive at the table with meat on swords, and with a simple "yes", they will slice off a piece of that meat; but you better be prepared to grab it with your tongs while they're being cut. I was not disappointed with any piece of meat and the frequency at which they came by made it so that I always had something on my plate. The steak and lamb servings had to be my favorite, especially at the perfect medium-rare temperature. Amongst the steak and lamb, the cuts that stood out to me the most were the Picanha, Filet Mignon, and the Cordeiro Leg. In the end, the slice of lamb I received topped all else due to it's nice gamey taste.

I would recommend Fogo de Chão to anyone looking for a fun and delicious Brazilian steakhouse experience in the SoMa area. It's a great place for all celebrations alike!
author: Joshua M.

description:
I was impressed by the interior and food  I love this moments when you come to the place unexpectedly and have no expectations but receive delicious food, wonderful service and enjoy the moment.  Must come back place.
The meat was premium. I have the taste of the meat in my month till now
author: Anuta B.

description: Meh.... was excited to try Fogo for the first time. Dined during SF Restaurant Week. The place was packed and loud. Our waitress, well it was as if we didn't have one, she was that busy. A well-known restaurant to not have adequate staff during SF Restaurant Week and a food convention is not my problem. The variety of meats were very delicous. But service was incredibly slow. I'm not that impressed and this City has far better places to choose from for food, ambience and especially, service.
author: Chris E.

description:
Everything was fire  

Nothing but fine meats, all you can eat  I had the filet mignon guy coming back to my table over and over with that meat... caramelized bananas too  definitely coming back. I didn't take pics of the food because it was too good.. I dove right in.. I had no idea Valentines Dinner was going to be this great.

I even mixed the meats with my salads, and made Filet Mignon Salad. Who would've thought lol

Thank you Fogo De Chao. I shall be back to redeem my complementary lunch or dinner before April 16!
author: Keenan L.

description:
I LOVE FOGO DE CHAO IN SF!!!

I go here every chance I get (usually when they send me a $25 coupon to my email). Salad bar has a great selection but I never eat anything else beside the complementary sides and meat!!! Sides are delicious- caramelized bananas and cheese bread are heavenly and best thing of all, you can keep asking for more! Although I try not to eat too much because I want to save my tummy for their delicious meats.

I love to try all the meats at least once when I go and they are ALL worth trying. My favorite is the house special meat! I eat this one about 3 times because really, you can't order this anywhere else casually. It's so fatty and juicy, I love it. The New York steak was impressively good the last time I went and I also order that one more than once. My other favorite also has to be the top sirloin steak. Also, if you love chicken hearts like I do, they only bring it out to you by request. 

So for all my meat lovers, please try the Fogo De Chao in SF!!! And make sure you plan ahead and make reservations since I heard they don't do walk-ins on the weekends. Service is exceptional and food is perfect!
author: Amanda N.

description:
Made reservations for my husbands birthday, we came in and where immediately greeted and seated by the very cheerful host. We have already been to Fogo De Chão in San Jose, but the service here is 10x better! The waiters are completely on top of any needs! I wanted the bacon rapped filet mignon which is my all time favorite dish and was granted by the very polite waiter! They were very attentive and made our stay so much more delightful! This is a perfect place for any birthday or anniversary celebration!

Rose is good to accompany your food!
author: Leticia M.

description:
Incredible meats of all kind came here with the kids from prime rib to to New York Strip this was like Mike Tyson of chefs hitting your stomach with a sixteen millimeter Gatling gun of relentless well cured meats which promise to be paralyzingly, delicious but if you do not move you will turn into a pet rock.
Be lively hit Ghiradelli's on the bay because this is a rip roaring meat eating haven that's sure to leave you all smiling with a good time!
author: Parker R.

description:
Oh me, oh my. Where do I even begin with Fogo de Chao?? My best friend made reservations here for a belated birthday celebration for me. I've never had Brazilian BBQ before but I had seen this place on social media before and always wanted to try it. 

The concept is pretty simple. A bunch of servers walk around with cuts of meat and stop at tables to cut portions for you if you're interested in eating it. For each person, there's a card that you can use to indicate whether or not you're looking for more meat or not.

I definitely recommend getting some side bites at the salad bar! There's not only salad there but an assortment of other things, including some fruits, cold meats, cheese, roasted veggies, rice and more! The bacon there was so good too! I also had the smoked salmon, the apple and potato salad, the salami, an assortment of cheese and others. It was great to offset the constant meats that were coming our way.

As for the main attraction, the meat, there's definitely a lot of variety here. Service was quick and fast. The servers are attentive and efficient, always coming by and asking if you'd like to try what they have and cutting you a piece (rare, medium rare, medium, well done) that you'd like. Out of all the meats I tried, I liked the lamb, filet mignon, garlic sirloin, ribeye best! They had stuff like sausages, chicken and ribs too even though I passed on most of that. Beware that the cuts of the meat can be really rare so if you're not into that, make sure to ask for more well done pieces. 

On top of all this, they give you cheese rolls, fried bananas and polenta and garlic mashed potatoes. All of the food I had here was delicious and the service was on point. We ended the night with dessert (cheesecake) complete with candle and "Happy Birthday" written on the plate. It was really well done. Definitely a great place to take a friend out for their birthday or just for a special celebration!!
author: Nancy T.

description:
This place should have been 5 stars, but nooooooo....

+5 STARS: Because I love churrascarias!


::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::


-5 STARS: RESERVATIONS SUCK (Hostess1)

At around 2:30 PM, I made a 6:30 PM reservation through OpenTable. My first choice, 6 PM, was not available. Fine, 6:30 PM will work.

Walked through the doors right at 6:29 PM. Spoke with a very young female hostess at 6:31 PM. 

Me: "Hi, I have a 6:30 PM reservation...party of 3," I provide her with the details.
Hostess 1: "Okay, there will be a 20-minute wait,"
Me: "Okay, but you do see my reservation is at 6:30 PM?" It's not very busy inside. There are quite a few people waiting in the lobby.
Hostess 1: "Yes, but we always overbook our reservations. It's a 20-minute wait." --REALLY? WTF? THAT IS COMPLETELY UNPROFESSIONAL!!! YOU HAVE GOT TO BE KIDDING ME! WHY THE HELL WOULD ANYONE MAKE RESERVATIONS IF THE RESTAURANT DOES NOT HONOR RESERVATIONS?!!!

I stand back, she takes a call, and the next customer steps up to the reservation desk. A second hostess comes to the desk and her conversation with the next guest (guest 2) goes like this...

Guest 2: "Hi, Table for 3, please."
Hostess 2: "Do you have reservations?"
Guest 2: "No,"
Hostess 2: "Okay, there is a 15-20 minute wait,"
Guest 2: "That's fine."


::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::


+3 STARS: HOSTESS 2

So, I turn to Hostess 2...

Me: "Hi, I just heard you tell the customer without reservations that there is a 15-20 minute wait for a table. I have reservations for 6:30 PM, and I was just told that I have to wait 20 minutes for a table."
Hostess 2: "I will seat you right away," -- she then whispers something to Hostess 1, and takes my party to our table. Thank you, Hostess 2! 

::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::


+1 STAR: DECOR

Their interior decorator did a pretty good job.


::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::


-1 STAR: SERVICE

All of the meat was going straight to the back of the restaurant, where there were a few big parties. The tables sitting on the outskirts of that area had slim pickings. We literally had to flag people down to get some meat. I felt bad for the non-aggressive folks sitting near my table, who ate practically nothing because they kept getting passed over despite their little cardboards being flipped to green.

This is not my first time at a churrascaria. I've been to many. The way they serve customers seemed very unorganized and inefficient. They should go clockwise or counter-clockwise around the dining area to be sure they aren't neglecting 1/2 of their customers.


::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::


-1 STAR: BIRTHDAY

We did NOT receive a complimentary dessert for our guest of honor....as stated on their website.


::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::


THE BILL (for those who are curious)

3 guests and only 2 non-alcoholic beverages...plus a 20% TIP (DESPITE BEING INCREDIBLY DISAPPOINTED)...

........:::::::::::::::::::::::    $250.00  :::::::::::::::::::..........

Yeah, I am sticking to Espetus. The price isn't much different, but the overall experience is far better.
author: Ladi Da A.

description: If you're going to splurge on dinner -- this is the place. The food is delicious, the wine menu is extensive, and the wait staff are amazing! They have a good bar area with all sorts of delicacies: smoked salmon, several cheeses,  peppers, fruit, carbs, salads, smoked meats, and more. The meat is delicious and your plate is never empty! I would definitely recommend.
author: Raisa D.

description:
The ambiance is definitely in line with the sophisticated polish one would expect from the Fidi area and to think this location once used to be a Chevy's.

Dinner meat selection is good and service is prompt 

Flavor wise, most of the meats tasted of salt and little else, was expecting more flavor nuances

Buffet bar was sufficient but didn't get the grand overabundance that you hear about, most of the dishes were just fine

Drinks are definitely pricey and felt there was an underlying pressure to get another drink despite politely declining several times

Overall Thoughts

Novelty of the experience was fleeting and not one I am in a hurry to repeat
author: Eddie W.

description:
The food is excellent, the restaurant is beautiful, there's no parking but if you don't mind the $20 valet fee then go for it, it's well worth it.
Large salad bar, great cuts of meat.  Here's what our group noticed.  At the first they brought the different cysts of meat regularly but after a few times, they stopped coming towards our table, I actually had to raise my hand and ask them to come by.  Maybe they're being told to not serve too much but when you go with a bunch of teenagers, they eat. That's the one issue I had with them and the second issue is them trying to upsale me on the shrimp platter, that was interesting. So you pay $59 for the all you can eat but then these other people show up with shrimp platters and want to see if you buy it, never seen that before in a restaurant.
author: Parwez F.

description:
When we called to make our reservation, we noted that we were celebrating a birthday. When our molten chocolate cake came out, I was kind of disappointed that they didn't write happy birthday on it. I probably should've reminded them after we ordered it.....but I assumed they would've remembered. 

The overall experience and was good but I had higher expectations.
author: Erica W.

description: Food is good but poor reservation system (still long waiting time despite booking table online)
author: Nicolas S.

description: I decided to come here for my birthday and the service was amazing! All of the servers were on point and checking in with us to see if we needed anything. One of the servers did a particularly amazing job and gave excellent customer service. His name was Santos and instead of giving us cold meat he waited until the new batch was finished and served that instead. By this time we were no longer hungry and didn't want it anymore but we appreciate his effort to serve more fresh meat and for remembering our request for that particular cut. The other servers were also amazing and we really appreciated the dining experience !
author: Maurita A.

description: D and Alia are the greatest hostesses this fine earth has been blessed with. Their beautiful smiles will entice you to grab a table and enjoy the fine meats this world has offered
author: Rob R.

description: I have always enjoyed going to Fogo de Chao, but I have to add that going to this specific location has never been short of amazing. The staff really makes this experience worth your while. They are welcoming and quite courteous. Many thanks to the Manager Miley, to Stuart,  to Victoria and to Blanca for ensuring that we feasted in the most delightful atmosphere, once again.
author: Cheick D.

description: We had a decent time. One issue was we had to wait 30 mins after our reservation time to be seated. It was a holiday, so I get being busy, and the manager was apologetic. But overall the service was off.
author: Adam R.

description:
The cocktails were really good here. The salad bar was very impressive too, everything was delicious. The meat however, I found to be mostly dry. Some of the meats here were also a little overcooked. I found all the chicken, lamb, and pork were all dry-I couldn't finish it.
The only ones that were tender and juicy were the filet mignon, the beef ribs, ribeye, and NY steak. Those were enjoyable. 
The sides they bring to your table were tasty. Mashed potatoes, polenta fries, and caramelized bananas were all good.
author: Jessica H.

description:
This place is a joke. If you actually appreciate fine dining do not come here. 

Ambience: It is extremely loud and there is little privacy at your table no matter where you are seated. While the waiters are good with coming by and offering you different options, it seemed disorganized and hectic as a whole and they are not knowledgeable about food pairings or wine pairings. 

Meal: While the meat was seasoned well, many of the options were overcooked and dry. There is a salad bar in the middle of the restaurant but no waiter could tell us what items went well with the meat we were receiving. The meat was of mediocre quality but the salad bar was sub par and left me unimpressed and somewhat disgusted (it was not well kept and the options were dismal). 

Dessert: Dessert options were classic American desserts - nothing special besides tres leeches and flan. Honestly reminded me of the Cheesecake Factory and made me wish I had eaten there rather than spent $65 on dinner and an extra $11 on dessert. 

Overall this experience was extremely disappointing and did not live up to the reviews. I was not expecting much being as it was a chain but I truly think they should be more aware of the quality of each location and take a bit more care when it comes to customer experience. I will not be coming back and would not recommend it to anyone who is looking for a unique Brazilian dining experience. Save your money and go somewhere else.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Co-hosted a dinner for a group of friends while back. I phoned in for reservation a 4 days in advances for a party or 12. We got a long table in the back room by the wine displays. The servers gave us plenty of attention at the start, giving us a breakdown of how things work for the first-timers and getting us set up with all our drinks. The food bar has an assortment of quality food available. The items from the grill were coming out at a good flow. With 16 different items (if i remember correctly) from the grill, we were sure to save stomach and to try everything. Most items were juice and cooked to various level of doneness for you to choose at the table. I believe I've lasted through the entire rotation and had an extra round of the picanha. 

The servers were friendly and attentive. The person pushing around the alcohol cart was very entertaining. My party chatted and hung out for almost 3 hours and at no point were we pressured wrap up. My experience might differ a little from folks in smaller party or without reservations; the overall experience, for me, was great. I'd admit the price is on the costly side per person, but I'm happy enough with the experience that I'd come here again.
author: Alan L.

description:
Went there yesterday night with colleagues, about 15 people. The place was busy. We waited about 15-mns for our...drinks/cocktails. We also ordered some wine bottles for the table. The wine bottles came before our drinks. I had ordered Riesling rather than a cocktail and gave up expecting it to show up so I just had some Chardonnay from the table. A server then told me "oh I cancelled your Riesling because I saw you drink white wine". I told him that he perhaps should have checked with me first?

The salad/bar side dishes are "ok". Quite blend. Then the meat, and the way they serve it, was alright. It's a steakhouse, the meat should be better than alright?

Then 2 monstrosities came to the table: some thawing sea food crammed inside a weird metal dish. Cold mussels (..?!) completely tasteless crab and shrimps.Yum.

The wine list is a blend of overrated cheap corporate wines  (Chateau St Michelle Riesling) sold at huge mark-up or completely overrated overpriced wannabe fancy corporate wines (Grgich Hills Zin). I went for the Luigi Bosca Malbec with little hope. It didn't go well. 

Considering the quality and diversity of restaurants in San Francisco, this place is laughable.

Awful service, ridiculous wine list, average food. Avoid.
author: Guillaume D.

description:
We went here for my parents 41 year wedding anniversary and it was a great experience. The food is amazing and the staff is very friendly. The food is amazing and I like the all you can eat meat. For all the meat you get, the price is reasonable. The steak was juicy and tender. I think my favorite was the bacon wrapped chicken breast and the filet migon. Yummy!!!!!

Oh and the dessert menu was awesome. We had the key lime pie, chocolate molten cake and the chocolate mousse cake. All of them were amazing. I cant wait to go back.
author: Cherrish H.

description:
First off: BEWARE - they added extra tip on my bill. I signed for about a 16% tip,and they rounded that up to a 20% tip... 
(I am disputing this with my credit card)

The service wasn't even that good, I had to hunt them down to bring meat to the table.. and in the course of the night, barely half of them stopped by. I don't even know if we had a waiter assigned to our table.. as nobody came by EVER to check up on us. I was never offered the drink menu either... (they did offer us the dessert menu later.. but no extra points for that).

The meat was OK (not exceptional) but generally over-salted.

My advice? Stay away from this place.. not worth the money even at half the price.

If you're really craving the Brazilian stakehouse experience, there's plenty of better places.

For the record, I went to the Beverly Hills Fogo de Chao location just a few weeks ago, and it was a stellar experience. Even though we sat in the corner, the waiter made sure all the meats came by.. and personally tracked down anything we wanted.
author: Gigio S.

description:
Simply amazing! Meat, meat, and more MEAT!!! I don't consume red meat on a regular basis, so when I do eat meat I savor each and every bite. This was also my first experience at a Brazilian BBQ buffet, so the anticipation was only building up for 15 years. 

The environment has the feel of an upscale hotel restaurant. Dark walls but nicely lit to feel comfortable for a nice dinner date, or a celebration. The elegant touches of wood, metal, and stone touches makes for a nice ambiance for treatung yourself to a hearty meal with a touch of class.

To start you're given a basket of cheese rolls/balls (pao de queijo), fried polenta fries, caramelized bananas (not plantains) and garlic mashed potatoes. I can seriously have been happy with the cheese rolls and polenta fries, as long as I don't get stiffed with the $60/head price! The cheese balls have a sharp cheddar flavor, with a soft and chewy texture like mochi bread. So amazingly good, but I'm really paying for the meat and atmosphere so I do my best to not fill up on these sides. My date and I had two baskets. 

The eager and (many) friendly workers give the whole dining experience a very pleasant memory for me. Once we were asked if we wanted a slice of steak, but since our stomachs were reaching capacity we were getting more picky. My girlfriend turned down the offer of steak and commented that we were waiting for the chicken leg. Not too many minutes later, another person came by and said "you were looking for chicken?" with a smile. How cool? I love the customer service here. With eyes bigger than my stomach, I left wanting to eat more but since my stomach can only take so much, I left with a few dark chocolate squares for the road. 

Now to compare to Espetus.
author: David K.

description: When I visited Fogo de Chao all I could think about was that it wasn't Chima in Tyson's Corner, VA. Same price and much better!
author: Jacqueline K.

description:
I'm giving this place 4 stars because they are consistent with the Fogo De Chao Menu pretty much the same as the menu and quality of food in Los Angeles. 

Good meats good eats. Make sure to ask for the Ribeye and the Garlic Pichana! 

Their condiments/appetizers and sides table though wasn't that impressive compared to Espetus. 

But I don't think they can really make any changes. It's my understanding that their menu is fixed. 

Still worth the try especially if you have never been. Totally worth it for the dining experience! Bon Appetito!
author: Miguel Y.

description: I had to rate this 5 stars because, all the nice steak dinners I have eaten in San Francisco, and San Diego (except for Butcher shop, which also great service and the best steaks). It was, hands down, the best service I have experienced! I've eaten the one in San Diego (where I'm originally from), so I was hesitant to eat at this one, though my family and I were extremely hungry for steaks and this happened to be the closes, but fortunately it was a better experience. The wait staff regardless of whether it was ours or the others, were the most attentive I have ever experience. They notice that my cousin and I were waiting for a certain steak (Filet mignon), and one of the guys with prime rib came up and said "which one would you like to see me bring out?" And within 2 minutes he brought filet mignon wrapped in BACON! All the steaks we tasted were EXCELLENT and juicy. The waters were constantly filled. I highly recommend this place if you are craving steak and your in San Francisco city.
author: Jonathan K.

description: We enjoyed a wonderful lunch here. We were seated as soon as we arrived, the staff were pleasant and the food was delicious.  Hint: the food is pretty much the same whether you go at lunch or dinner, but dinner is much more expensive.  We will go back for sure.
author: Liz P.

description:
It was a wonderful experience, amazing food that comes non stop, we could hardly get up from the sit after eating so much 

We will definitely come back there again, but it is expensive.
author: Hadar B.

description:
********************* 1521 ********************* 

  I finally got to take my parents here for their first time. I've been to the one in Santana Row many times as well as Beverly Hills and Florida location. I know what to expect, but my parents were surely in for a real treat.

   Fogo de Chao San Francisco location took over the former Chevy's spot, conveniently right across from the W hotel and across from the Moscone Center, what's an ideal location for a steakhouse.

   The restaurant showcases a beautiful dining room with seating for about 200 plus guests, the bar area with a TV to watch sport games, several private and semi-private dining areas, and an outdoor seating with heat lamps. The interior of the restaurant reflects a mixture of Northern California and Brazilian modern design.

  My dad went crazy for the Salad Bar as usual. The Heart of Palm, this Brazilian imported delicacy is crisp, organic and sustainable. The artichoke, beet, green beans, corn, and the ready to serve Caesars Salad were all fresh and tasty. The Imported Cheese - fresh mozzarella, aged manchego and two-year aged Parmesan pair nicely with imported cured meats and tangy sun-dried tomatoes.

   My mom loves the FOGO PREMIUM CAIPIRINHA Muddled with Fogo Premium Aged Cachaça, fresh limes and cane sugar as well as their new Mango and Basil cocktail. She enjoyed it very much. I opted for the Fogo de Chao Malbec signature they have, quite nice.

  For a carnivore, this is heavenly on earth. My mom loves beef, so she went crazy. She literally tried at least 10 type of meats. A few that my parents and I enjoy very much:

- PICANHA Prime Part of the Top Sirloin - picanha represents the art and science of churrasco cooking. Lightly seasoned with rock salt and sliced thin, it is tender with a robust flavor. 

- FILET MIGNON Beef Tenderloin - Our gaucho chefs expertly grill the tenderloin on skewers and skillfully carve the perfect bite every time. Also served wrapped in a tender strip of bacon.

- BEEF ANCHO Rib Eye - Arguably one of the most popular cuts in the world, this was cooked to medium rare as we requested. 

- FRALDINHA Bottom Sirloin - Fraldinha is one of the most distinctive and flavorful cuts of meat from Southern Brazil due to its strong marbling characteristics. 

- CORDEIRO Lamb - this was 1 of my favorite. 

- The Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail - gigantic with the cocktail sauce

  For side dish, the Polenta, Fried Banana, and Mashed Potato were awesome. For desserts: The Papaya Cream - By far our most popular dessert in both Brazil and the United States, fresh papaya is blended with vanilla ice cream and topped with a black currant liqueur. And the Flan as well as the vanilla ice cream, my parents loved them all. I finished with a glass of Porto, check out their  whiskey list too! 

  Service was impeccable. The servers who cuts the meat were all smiling to take pictures with my parents. They kept on coming and offered us more meats. All our servers were very attentive, especially manager Mahelley and even the GM Ryan came to wish my mom a Happy Mother's Day, they kept checking up on our table to make sure my parents had a good time.  

  The place was overly packed on a Saturday night, but it's the Saturday Mother's Day weekend, and what do you expect. Above of all, the food was good, plenty to try, the drink was strong, and the service was wonderful. I couldn't ask for a better experience for my parents on their first visit in San Francisco location. 

  For $59.98 per person at dinner, it's surely a bargain. Fogo de Chao is a great place to get together, holiday party, business dinner or any occasion. 

  I just found a new spot for power lunch and business happy hour in SoMa, this is where I'll hang out during conference at the Moscone center and 2 blocks from my parents' favorite hotel InterContinental.
author: Manda Bear B.

description: Loved this place. Very upscale. Our server was constantly checking up on us. Meat just keeps coming. Our first time here and our waitress gave the whole 411 experience. Will be back
author: Noelia R.

description:
This is a meat lovers paradise for sure.
Nice, more 'upscale' interior than I expected. 
So, you get your table, then go over to the 'salad bar' which has more than just salad. An assortment of special veggies are there as well.
Then back to your table, and let the feasting begin.... 
The meat here is really exceptional. And, so long as your coaster (see pic) is turned to GREEN, you will be constantly approached by this never ending parade of . . . meat!!! . . . meat!!! and more meat!!!. . . gettin' the meat sweats yet??? Keep going!!!. . . It's ok to turn your coaster over to RED and take a break for a while. I can't say that Fogo is one of my favorite places for dining. But, I was with a party of 16 that took up two long tables. It was a circus for us.
Not a quiet or romantic evening. Just so you know.
author: Greg S.

description: Came here for a family lunch on Friday 12.29.17, service was good, food was good until the last item I had. It was the beef rib, I love beef ribs, like Fred Flintstone size, however. This was way way salty. The top sirloin was awesome. The lamb was awesome.
author: Brian W.

description:
Fogo de Chao. 

As a late Father's Day gift(Finally were able to coordinate our schedules) me and my little brother decided to treat him for dinner. I originally saw that they offer valet but honestly I hate driving to SF. I looked up their address on google and found out that Montgomery BART station is like 5-10 minutes away. So I figured why not save my money and sanity by just catching BART? 

Me and my brother got there around 7 o'clock for our reservation and our dad was already waiting for us drinking at the bar. We were escorted to our table and on the way I just walked in awe with how classy and slick the decor was. I watched as other waiters were walking around with large skewers of meat and all the happy faces from the guests as they bit into their food and the hype began to consume me...

The server was very professional and informative. After seating us she let us know all the kinds of meats that would be served that day and where the salad bar was. I kind of smiled and thought to myself, "Pfft salad... Give me ALL the meat and TATERS!" That's what I ate. Just about all the meat they had to offer. The prime rib, the top sirloin, the bottom sirloin, all the sirloin, sausage, lamb and even Chicken heart(It's actually pretty tastey if you can get past the rubbery texture!) No no no. I didn't eat this all in one sitting. Hahaha. It took a couple plates. See Fogo has this system where you have a two sided circular badge next to your plate. Green means keep them coming, while Red means leave me alone, PLZ. So needless to say I had to pace myself, to get the full experience. I honestly wish I could of took more pictures but the meat was sooooo tender and flavorful! I just didn't have enough patience...needed more meat :x lol

My favorites were the prime rib, top sirloin and the lamb chops. Everything was cooked medium-medium rare for the most part but I believe if you want it well done, they can make special requests. You just have to wait a little longer obviously. My little brother got the molten cake after showing him Erica's picture of it. It was amazingly rich. I might be biased since I am a sucker for chocolate though haha. I will agree with Jon though that some of the service seemed kinda off. Most of the servers were extremely friendly while one or two seemed kinda stuffy. It didn't really bother me too much because I was in meat heaven most of the time though. OH! I can't believe I forgot the taters! The Mashed potatoes were on point. Some of the better mashed potatoes I've had recently. 

When we got the bill I was a little shocked though. 59.99 a person for the meat and sides? Seems a little excessive. Now don't get me wrong. I understand that it's the city and everything is pricey. The quality of all of the food speaks for itself but can you at least include sodas along with that? I feel like 49.99 and more consistent friendly service would of sold me with the 5 stars. But nevertheless that's just me. I do think it is consistent with House of Prime Rib. HoPR is a tad cheaper and will also make sure you get full. However you have to wait for your food. With Fogo you are paying for trying out all the different kinds of meats and the meat is already ready as you sit down. This place is legit though. Despite my nitpicking, I guarantee I will be back regardless if its here in San Francisco or their other location in San Jose^^
author: Anthony W.

description: Good meats, wide variety, unique cocktails, and the atmosphere is great.
author: Elisa B.

description:
If you're looking for a tasty beef - deffintely give this place a try ! Dont do a mistake of eating all the salads ( even though their mango salad is the BOMB ) and it goes wery vell with the meat. Drinks are good too.
Try all the meat so you'll know your favorite. 
Their cheese bread is sooooo good, fluffy and light, im still looking for a receipe.
author: Victoria A.

description:
The food was awesome. Great selection of meat. The Marketplace food bar is gigantic and excellent for those that don't do meat! I must say though , I think the person who took my reservation for 18 people a week prior changed my time. The biggest reason I chose to have our dinner there was because they were able to accommodate the amount of guests and also the 8pm reservation. We were all there 8pm sharp so they could tell us it was reserved for 9pm wow!!!  Fortunately after expressing my disappointment to the manager we were fitted in at 830pm. Also I didn't get my cocktail for 20 minutes. I know they were busy but that is not my fault especially if I'm paying $15 a drink.    If it wasn't for those 2 fails I would have gave them 5 stars.
Needless to say I will be returning.
author: Juan J.

description: This place is simply amazing, It's not even fair how good this place is. If you like meat this is the place for you. I haven't been In a year or so but if you are looking for a place to dine in SF this is number one.
author: ReJeanne S.

description:
It's $60 per person for dinner. Unless you eat a lot, it's expensive for what it is. I ate a good amount but don't feel like I ate $60 worth of food. Dinner includes some sides (bread, plantains, mash potatoes, polenta fries), salad bar and the meats they bring to the table (the only meat they don't bring automatically are beef ribs, just ask for it). Drinks and desserts are extra. 

Cocktails are way overpriced at $16 bucks a pop. That's more than a share of their stock (currently at $15 a share)! Go during happy hour M-F 4:30-6:30 for half price cocktails and small bites. Even sodas don't come with refills.  

Go during lunch, it's $37 and it's the same food. Or sign up for their emails or check out their FB page for $25 off coupons.
author: Andy W.

description: Two words. Food poisoning. Don't come here unless you want your bowels to suffer. Service was fairly terrible too with the restaurant missing our orders, overcharging extra drinks.  They gave us some buy one get one free lunch cards, but that will go used after the experience we had.
author: Wilson Z.

description:
We had a great dinner that included Filet mignon, parmesan crusted chicken, garlic pepper steak, and sausage. 

The chocolate mousse cake was also very good! 

Bring your wallet. Dinner and dessert was $100 after tax and tip without any alcoholic beverages. 

We all left satisfied and will come back for more!
author: Blair W.

description:
I came here with a bunch of co-workers for a leisurely and utterly gluttonous workday lunch a couple weeks ago, and left stuffed and happy. I tried way too many things to list here, but I can say that all the lamb and steak I tried was great, particularly the house special - definitely don't pass that up. Sooo juicy and flavorful. I love how they cut the meat from a different section based on what done-ness you request (but c'mon, you're getting medium rare, right?).

I also tried a few things from the market bar, and the standout there was the creamy apple salad (I forget exactly what it was called). Great complement to all the meat!

They also load your table up with tons of carbs - which I of course also ate - including the traditional PDQ rolls (delicious), polenta "fries" (sorta weird, but not bad), and mashed potatoes (standard issue).

Somehow we managed to find room in our stomachs to throw on some desserts, so we shared about half the dessert menu (#noregrets). The flan was great, and the cheesecakes were very good - the strawberry one was the best. Chocolate lava cake was just ok.

Service was super fast with the meats, less so with the desserts. Overall, though, it was a very tasty meal!
author: Liz F.

description:
Fantastic eating experience (if you're into the continual food delivery thing).

I went last week with a friend, and was very pleased with the atmosphere, the decor, the service, and most importantly the food. The appetizer bar was a delight, and the meats (there was a pretty wide variety from steaks, to sausage, and even bacon wrapped chicken) were on point.

If you're looking for a quiet romantic dinner, this might not be the best place (it's a little loud, and there is constantly servers coming around with food, of course, so intimate discussions might not be easy here.

But if you're just looking for great food and a really good time, I highly recommend Fogo de Chao. I will certainly be going back.
author: Joel G.

description:
Yummy everything!!! All the carved meats and salad bar was nice. Sangria is very enjoyable with nice ambience. 

There were 7 of us. One infant and the other 24 months. My guest was very happy they accommodated them with with a more quiet section of the resto. It was quite pleasing to have this type of service. Will definitely come back.
author: mui d.

description:
I'll let the meat eaters describe Fogo de Chao's constant rotation of grilled meats on skewers because I didn't order churrasco; I ordered the salad bar. I started with my usual salads & chicken salad on bibb lettuce but abandoned that boring mess when I spotted their bacon -- peppered with a brown sugar glaze, this bacon is all flavor. I don't always eat bacon but when I do, I eat my weight in bacon. 

Four stars are solely for this magical bacon & Fogo's nice, stiff vodka martini because sides & the buffet items were sorely lacking in flavor. Cheese breads were bland, as was the polenta; mashed potatoes were a bit gummy; and bananas were over cooked & mushy. Their feijoada was watery & had no savory deliciousness I've come to expect from this Brazilian dish. However, their butternut squash soup was quite good. 

No complaints about service, but I will note that it seemed the staff felt overwhelmed by my party of seven. I'm sure time and the resulting experience will remedy this, but the staff should know that customers can sense their stress and intensity.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Two words - Meat Sweats

This place opened recently by my office in the old Chevy's spot in SOMA.  We went for a birthday lunch and I wasn't sure what to expect.  They have a large salad bar and of course I had to taste a little of it all.  The apple salad was my favorite. When we sat down after hitting the salad bar, our waiter explained that when we wanted meat you turn the little coaster thing by your plate on green and red when you want them to stop.  And you really need to do it or they will just keep bringing you meat and more meat and more meat.  And it is all delicious!!  I really enjoyed the bacon wrapped steak and lamb.  We definitely all wanted to take a nap when we got back to the office.  Great addition to the neighborhood and we will need to check out the happy hour soon.
author: Amanda K.

description: This was my first time trying a Brazilian steakhouse. My boyfriend and I decided to enjoy ourselves for our anniversary and chose Fogo Brazilian as we heard a lot of great reviews. Upon arrival, we were greeted by the host and seated within a few minutes. The food was wonderful and service was prompt and friendly. When my waiter heard that we were celebrating our anniversary, he gave us a written note on our dessert plate stating, "Happy Anniversary." This was really the highlight of my day. Props to my waiter and all the servers, we had a great time and enjoyed ourselves greatly. For the price they charge, it was definitely worth it. The experience and food was absolutely spot on. We'll be back, that's for sure.
author: Chloe H.

description: We are regulars at the Fogo in Atlanta and Beverly Hills. We like Fogo because it's always great... UNLESS you go to this one!! The restaurant was nearly half empty, and yet the hostess couldn't seem to seat us despite our 8pm reservation. There was a line of people crowding the front room. It was so unorganized.  When we arrived at our table, we were greeted after about 5 minutes it was rushed and bizarre. We didn't get our waters or wine for at least 15 minutes. The cheese bread didn't come out. The polenta and mashed potato's and bananas had to be requested. (Our neighbors who were first timers never even got theirs!) Our second glass of wine that we ordered halfway through the dinner NEVER came. The house special picana steak came by about a dozen times, but lamb chops, ribeye, bottom sirloin had to be requested and we only saw them once?!  Just totally inconsistent. No one really checked on us like they do at the other locations. The gauchos looked stressed and irritated. They were brisk and not friendly.  We indicated we were celebrating a special birthday, and were quite surprised that it wasn't recognized. The meat was good but the service and management was so off putting that we won't be back, and will host our business dinners elsewhere when in San Francisco.
author: Mo F.

description:
For my birthday last year, my husband and I decided to splurge and try out Fogo de Chao. We had never been to a Brazilian steakhouse before and had heard great things about this place. We made the 2 hour drive from Sac to SF for their full Churrasco experience, which includes continual service of their fire-roasted meats, along with their market table/salad bar. Once we got to Fogo, we were welcomed in and went to their large salad bar for starters. They had an assortment of salads (pear, endive, apple, chicken, mozzarella caprese), cheeses (fresh mozzarella, manchego), fresh veggies (asparagus, zucchini, baby potatoes), fruits (pineapples, watermelon), and cold smoked salmon and other meats, just to give you an idea. The spread was definitely elaborate and satisfying. We each filled our plates slightly, as to not overstuff ourselves before the main course. The salad bar items themselves were very tasty and exceeded our expectations. 

Back at the table, they had a basket of pao de queijo (warm cheesy bread, which is gluten-free!) that was to die for. The bread was soft, warm but still chewy. On a small plate there was fried polenta, garlic mashed potatoes, and carmelized bananas, all which were to die for! For my gluten-free eaters, I must tell you that everything here is gluten-free except for the bread at the salad bar. When you're ready to eat, you turn your cards over to the green side that says "yes," which means the server will continue bringing out cuts of meat for you to try. Once you're stuffed, you turn it over to the red side that says "no," and they know to give you a break while you try to recuperate.

For the main course, they brought out different cuts of steak, beef ribs, chicken, lamb, and pork. We didn't try the pork but everything else was delectable. They cut thin slices of the meat and you grab them with the tongs they give you to put on your plate. You must ask for their mint jelly on the side if you love the sweet/salty combo like I do. It's to die for and adds a different dimension of flavor to the meats.

As a complimentary dessert for my birthday, they brought out creme brûlée with fruit on the top and Happy Birthday written on the plate. It was delicious.

Dinner was $59.95 a person and was well worth it! When it was time to leave, we both agreed that we would definitely come back here in the future and make the 4 hour round trip drive just to experience it, again.

If you've never tried a Brazilian steakhouse, this is a wonderful place to start out at. If you're looking for a fancy night out, this is your place!
author: Sara B.

description:
Sadly this Fogo does NOT live up to the standards the chain has set.  I've been to the ones in Philly and Scottsdale and SF.  Although relatively new, the SF branch has to improve on a some things.  

#1 Service, It seems as if the wait staff does not care about you.  On many occasions I've had to flag them down.  Although card was flipped to green, it seemed as if I was ignored, and they did it to others as well. 

#2 Knowledge, the main reason to come is for the meat.  Unfortunately the staff that came to carve the cuts did not know how to tell medium from well done.  If they fix these 2 main issues, it will be able to compare to the other 2 establishments.  

Unfortunately because of this, as well as the price, spending it here did not seem like the typical Fogo Experience if that is what you're looking for.
author: Ali N.

description:
Dining Area is simple yet elegant.  

Servers:  exceptional

Food:  some of the meats are a bit salty but very tasty and tender.
author: Susan P.

description: Best service in the world. Came all the way from sacramento to eat here. Everything is completely fresh. And the meats were cooked perfectly. Definitely coming back again. And the waiters were fantastic.
author: Bilal R.

description:
Food selection- Excellent 
Service- Excellent
Experience- Excellent

A little pricey, but will definitely come back again!
author: Jason T.

description:
A solid 4.5?

Wanted a quiet but novel anniversary dinner nearby and Fogo definitely fit the bill!

This Fogo is brand new...and sort of feels like it. It was fairly empty and the staff didn't feel as confident as their Beverly Hills location- but I guess because they haven't had to pander to hordes of pretentious food snobs (yet ;) ) 

That being said, for a place that is BRAND new, where the staff probably hasn't seen a lot of restaurants like this to base service off of, I think the evening went pretty well. Also, this is SF. And since prices are similar to BH, I think it's a great deal for a nicer, meat-centric dinner in the city.  

The starters are your typical Fogo sides. Mashed potatoes (these were meh), polenta fries, candied bananas and Brazilian cheese bread. Weirdly enough I LOVED the bananas here (normally don't) and thought the cheese bread was just OKAY here (too airy on the inside and not a lot of soft chewy bread inside). 

Definitely Try:
+ Picancha- Ah.. the always foisted meat. That being said its reliably tasty and good but don't fill up on this one! It's a cheap cut : ) 

+ Bacon wrapped filet and chicken- the filet was just OK but the chicken was YUMMY. Perfectly cooked nom nom.

+ Parmesan Pork- TASTY with the caesar salad omg.

+ Ribeye- my favorite cut of the night. Moist and perfectly done.

+ Lamb- a little gamey but not offensive. I probably liked this the *least*

+ Pork Ribs- also a little gamey but also not offensive. 

+ Argentinian Merlot definitely get! Was only $13-$14 a glass and had such lovely, soft tannins. A real treat : ) 

+ Cesar salad + grilled peppers were great, very fresh!

Pass On:
+ Fresh Mozzarella, definite pass
+ Mixed drinks if you like your drink to TASTE stiff. The passionfruit caipirinha was sooo sweet even though it was less sweet ( I think this is partially because I got passionfruit..haha!)

If you've never been, I definitely recommend it. "Flipping" the red/green card to indicate if you'd like meat or not is surprisingly delightful, AND no wait time for food!  Will definitely come back when I'm feeling particularly carnivorous again : )


Only neg:
Didn't like the strong upselling- odd because I've never had them try to upsell me at their BH location. But shoutout to the bartender + hostesses who were ridiculously adorable.
author: Jackie C.

description:
Firstly, Fogo de Chao has the best salad bar I've ever seen in my life. It's more like a "side dish bar" with fresh fruits, cheeses, and vegetables. I basically stuffed my face here.

As for the rest of the food, it was all absolutely delicious and perfectly cooked. I'm not much of a meat eater, but I made an exception for Fogo de Chao, and it was totally worth it. Definitely go for any of their specialty/seasonal cuts.

The service was exceptional and friendly. Servers came around constantly to check if we wanted more meat or water, and they were all absolutely lovely.

In short, this place is expensive but 100% worth it. You won't regret treating yourself to a fancy night out here.
author: Al I.

description:
Can't rate their food . Walked in ; said it would
Be 10 minutes and to wait at the bar.  15 empty tables and 30 minutes later walked out.

2 drinks cost $35 .
IPA with one of those .

Updated review:

I was annoyed and hungry at the time of writing this review , and updated the review to review the bar only . The bartender and drink we ordered was really good and not fair to reflect that against them. The IPA i ordered was about twice the price it would cost at 21st Amendment (they carried their beer). I am more than willing to pay more for drinks , if the food service going with it is just as good. Buying just two drinks , it's hard to make it worthwhile when's there's 100 places in the area I can have a drink. The drink my gf ordered was great ,I'm not a big mixed drink person but it  was delicious and done professionally .  I upgraded this to 3 stars based on service of the bar only and I realize not fair to give 1 star for one bad experience. I also didn't ask again and just walked out. (Was annoyed at that point)



I realize I didn't have a reservation , and just walked in. We did because we saw a lot of empty tables. I was disappointed for waiting for 20-30 after being told they will see what to do. The bar area had about 10 -15 free tables that did not get seated in that time. I get reservations may have been there , but customer perception is we could have been accommodated and sometimes perception is what stays in memory. For that reason I'll probably never be back though my girlfriend and I want to try Brazilian BBQ and wanted to try something new. We were prepared to spend whatever money for a nice meal that night.  There's so much to try in the city and Bay Area in general  and just disappointed we couldn't spend money in this establishment. I work for a business that is not perfect and stuff happens.
author: Giants F.

description:
Right now I would say this is my favorite Brazilian restaurant. Just keep getting the ribeye:)
It melts in your mouth. Customer service was top notch! Everyone was extremely polite and and attentive. In the famous words of Mr. Arnold Schwarzenegger, "I'll be back"!
Shoot. I forgot about the cheese buns....I ate at least 10!!!!
author: Al T.

description:
The worst place ever. Coming as a big fan of Espetus in San Mateo I had high hopes. I made reservations for a party of 14 to celebrate a friends birthday. Camilla was our waitress and was horrible. We had to ask for water, foods, drinks multiple times as she disappeared for long periods of times. I'm sure we annoyed the other waiters trying to get them to help
Us because our assigned waitress was no where to be found. The meat barely came around and ar some point just stopped. Pretty much anything you ask for has to be requested multiple times or doesn't come. Half our party left hungry. One of the people in our party mentioned they thought she looked like the bartender. She said "I don't look like that hoe" we also heard her point and complain about our table being annoying. Talk about being unprofessional. Half our party paid for babysitters expecting a nice evening with adults and instead left hungry and with bad service. If I could I would not even give a 1 Star rating. We all will never be back.
author: Kimberly P.

description:
The Best thing, about this place for me was the Servers. 
Great food; nice Side Bar, outstanding interior design!
author: Timothy C.

description:
Where do I begin? Well, with the reservation. I had made a group reservation for this place and when we got to the restaurant, the host tells us some guy came in before us, claimed to be me, and changed our group reservation to two people. Was there a tech genius hacking into Open Table accounts and stealing reservations? They said they could no longer find the guy even though they gave him a pager. When I asked if they could page him so I could speak with him, they said "Oh that's a good idea. I'll do that right now." The guy came to the host-stand pretty immediately and it was obvious that he was just a walk-in with his girlfriend. Because they thought he had my reservation, they quoted him a reasonable wait but then had to tell him the wait would be 2 hours instead. How the guy's first interaction with the host led to MY reservation being changed is beyond me. The good part is that they worked quickly on setting up our table again and we sat within about 15 minutes.

I don't know if there were so many issues because the restaurant just opened but I know there are many Fogo locations so there should be some experience in running a place of this caliber. The lights kept going out and/or flickering in our part of the restaurant, the salad bar needed to be restocked upon request, the servers dropped quite a few dishes throughout the night, and it was freezing (both from the ventilation and from the hosts leaving the front door open in 40 degree weather). We were also told by one server that they didn't have menus when we had just seen it from another server. 

As for the food, it's not better than Pampas or Espetus. The salad bar is really subpar and does not justify even a portion of the $59.95 all-inclusive price tag. The best things were probably the squash soup and fresh mozzarella balls. There was some meat at a carving station that was included into the salad bar but once it was gone, it never came back. That meat, rice, beans, and soup were the only hot food options. 

The meat selection was smaller and a few of them were over done or lacking seasoning. The chicken drumsticks were overcooked, and messing up dark meat is just unheard of. The beef ribs are by request only (weird). Luckily one of our meat cutters liked our table and brought it over to us. Unfortunately that particular meat was so fatty, it was unenjoyable. 

Be careful when ordering extras because some of the cocktails cost up to $17. The servers are on top of giving you soda refills but those aren't free. They comp'ed our wine bottle because of the earlier mistake I THINK. I don't know actually. No employee officially said it to us but it wasn't on the bill. Conclusion? I wouldn't come back. I heard the San Jose location is better so you might want to start there if you're dying to eat here.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Very unimpressed. The service was not good....we had to keep asking for a server. Then when they came, they always had sirloin. They really push the top and bottom sirloin because it is cheap. You have to actually ask them for the Filet and Rib Eye. Why are they even serving sirloin for that price? When you pay $65 a person, you expect better meat...not sirloin. Never saw the guy with the chicken once. Never got any sausage. We had to ask for lamb twice before we got it and it took forever. The meat tasted ok, but not great.
The salad bar was very unimpressive and nothing was labelled....not even the salad dressing. They had Caesar salad but no croutons. I asked for some but he said they don't have them....what???
The men's restroom was disgusting...the urinal was literally overflowing with urine on the floor, one of the sinks was clogged and full, and there were dirty hand towels scattered everywhere. It's pretty obvious they had no one in charge of bathroom duty. 
 I was impressed the first time we went to Fogo De Chao, but that was years ago and it was in Dallas. Don't waste your time (or money) on this one....there are a ton of better places in SF.
author: Steve M.

description:
We are fans!! We have had our fair share of Brazilian steakhouses. Even have had the pleasure of going to the Fogo in Beverly Hills (I hear David Bekham is a fan)! This place is no let down. They took over the old Chevy's Fresh Mex place and wow is it a transformation! 

Now to whats important. The grub! The meat was delicious! Mouth watering. Ask for the beef ribs. They dont come out usually, you gotta ask, and get the special. The market bar is filled with yummy goodness. The Caesar salad isnt my favorite. The dressing is a tad too tangy for my taste but I can let it go! Lots of fresh mozzarella to choose from and yummy olives! 
Cheesy bread, yucca fries, and mashed potatoes on demand. Holy carb loving!! 

Service was on point. My iced tea was never empty. Warning sodas are not refillable. 

All in all great fatty experience! I rate it 4/5 fatty experience!
author: Michelle I.

description: Huge fan of Brazilian Steakhouse's and Fogo de Chao has not let me down.  Great appetizers.  I must warn you if you are not a Meat Eater don't waste your time.  Great location, service and environment is good.  Expect to tray at least 12 different cuts and types of meats.  Meats range from chicken, beef, lamb served all kind of ways.  Price is worth it, looking forward to me next visit.
author: Nic C.

description:
Came here for the MEAT!! was able to try this new place in the city after seeing a few post, the ambiance alone are $$$$ huge fire place concealed in glass and modern dark hardwood, dark hardwood floors they used allot of money to make this place look this good

On to the meat, I was able to come here for lunch with some co-workers I want to say their selection of meats was good, like most brazilian buffets this one had it's definite yes's and some not so greats, chicken wrapped in bacon was good on first bite but when getting to the middle of the chicken it was dry, their ribeye, flank, filet minon were all juicy and tender, chicken hearts are a must for me sadly they were not salted enough to my palate, sausage was better then most of the Brazilian spots I have tried not dry in the middle well spiced and delicious, I was told this is a chain which was to be expected since it is in the city and cause it's so dam fancy in there. 

the botched banana's were standard sweet and chewy, the cheese rolls were oddly hard like most places it is served piping hot and usually melt when biting into it, here it was hard and gapped with air pockets, 

In comparison to Espetus and here I wanna say it is somewhat of a tie, some of the meats were better prepped some not better others not as good, Only thing is I know during the dinner menu at Espetus they do have more meats one specifically the does not come out on a skewer but on a cutting board, one of the best cuts of meat the offer hands down, I am not sure they offer this a Fogo but I guess I will have to come back and try there dinner menu.

There salad bar had a fairly large selection, no deviled eggs that I saw on the table, I also did not see the roasted pineapple that most of the other places offer. this location is very spacious allot to look at, huge curtains run from the middle of the room and of course by the sides of the windows tied off, also did not see any premiere types of cognac on the shelf, maybe I wasn't looking hard enough.

If you like meat, definitely a place you would like to visit, more then enough meat to go around, you will not leave unsatisfied more like in a coma, and to meat sweats to follow later in an hour of consuming all that meat

food ****
price $$$
service **** responsive, friendly, helpful
ambiance ***** Jesus so fancy
author: Clarence A.

description: What's not to love about meat and a lot of it? I think lunch at Fogo is the way to go. The food is the same but it's 50% cheaper, essentially. I highly recommend the picanha and pretty much that's the one you should go with all the time. The garlic sirloin is pretty good too. What I've learned from two experiences at Fogo is to get a center slice instead of an outside slice. That way you always get medium rare, which is the best temperature for beef, IMO.
author: Sherry L.

description: Service was amazing. Everyone we interacted with was great, professional, and hard working. I would highly recommend for the services alone. Now the steaks, while good, nothing really stood out as amazing. For the price, one might be better served at a comparable steakhouse that isn't all you can eat. Way nicer than Espetos, and the staff, doesn't even come close. For all you can eat, this is the place!
author: Phillip J F.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend on Memorial Day for dinner.  I had originally made a reservation for Santana Row, since I didn't realize the location in SF opened.  I changed my reservation to SF instead since it's easier for me to get to from Oakland. This place is more expensive than the one in Philly or San Jose. 

I've been to the one in Philly multiple times and compared to the one in Philly, I was slightly disappointed at the quality of food.  The marketplace options was nothing special. I looked at the menu online and I didn't see many of the things listed. Mostly cured meats, different vegetables, variety of salads. I've been to Galeto in Oakland and I much prefer their bar (Baked salmon with sauce, deviled eggs, some other things)

As for the meats itself, I really liked the House Special. It was extremely flavored and not chewy. The top sirloin is generally my favorite cut at the Philly location and the top sirloin at the SF location was meh at best. My piece of bacon wrap filet mignon was overcooked. I was expecting medium rare.  My boyfriend thoroughly enjoyed the chicken, I personally did not have any. He said the chicken (both the bacon wrapped and thigh) was flavorful.  The meat fell right off the bone for the thigh. 

As for the service, we had a rotation of different servers coming to our table asking about our experience.  As for the meat service, some of the meat servers did not come around even though we had our green cards up and we had to specifically ask for them because we thought they were coming to us but ended up disappearing. 

Overall, it was okay. Fairly overpriced for $60 a head.  I came here because I miss the one in Philly and I wanted Rodizio. I think next time I will probably go to Galeto instead, cheaper, same quality of food, better bar.
author: Judy H.

description: The food was amazing from start to finish. Our complaint was with the waiter who came to our table once and that was it. No refill on our waters or wine.
author: Ashley W.

description: By far the best Brazilian BBQ in the west coast. The salad bar is second to none, the side dishes are endless. The meats are cooked to perfection, the pacanhia was perfect. The Manager Mahelly took Greta care of us. The restaurant was packed and she went out of her way to make us feel special. Will definitely come back again.
author: Rich R.

description:
I was curious when this place took over the old Chevy's- would it make it? Would SF accept it into the fold? Sure it's another chain but is it actually any good! What the heck does one do at a Brazilian steak house anyway? Would I look like a n00b? 

In anticipation of this dinner I ate very lightly during the day, and I suggest you do the same. Bring on the meat parade! The best way I can describe this to my Bay Area homies is that it's like steak dim sum. Green card means "offer me your meat," and red means "I need a time out."  Servers come around with different cuts of meat and you get to say yay or nay depending on what you're into.There's also a market bar in the middle which hosts all the vegetables and salads, and I reluctantly got some greens to balance out my meat sweats. 

So, without further adieu, here's the list of aaalllll the meats I had, starting with my favorites: garlic steak, NY strip, top sirloin, lamb shank, pork sausage, flank steak, bottom sirloin, filet, parmesan pork, and filet wrapped in bacon. My main strategy was to try a little of everything so you can definitely ask for smaller cuts. We also got mashed potatoes and polenta fries for the table, and both were good, but cold. 

Service was very attentive, there's plenty of staff swarming around. We were a little wanton for coffee refills after we paid our check, but eventually we got to someone. We didn't have room for dessert but they looked enormous so I'd suggest splitting it with your table.

So with my glass of wine, the "full experience," and a tip, it came out to $98. Not your every day meal, but definitely satisfying.
author: Alyssa J.

description:
Saying that I'm a fan for Fogo would be an understatement. Over the last several years we've ben fortunate to have either lived near or visited near one of their locations. All this changed when we moved to NorCal, not really any close locations until now. 

Last week (12/23) we were thrilled to hear that their newest location finally opened in San Francisco, yes! Having been to many of their other locations (Scottsdale, Vegas, Miami) Id have to say that this location is perhaps the most chic, relaxed and inviting. From the sleek tile entry to the walls of slat wood paneling the atmosphere is chic, dark and romantic. We were sat in the small booth and proceeded to enjoy the comfort of the bootie friendly banquettes (seriously, it's so nice that this new restaurant has soft comfortable seating as apposed to the other new places, that insist you sit on a hard "reclaimed" wood bench seating and expect you to be comfortable). 

If you're familiar with the Brazilian Steakhouse concept, nothing is different here. Huge slabs of meat salted and wood roasted are carved table side by hunky guys. Beef, pork, lamb, sausages, and chicken arrive in waves all controlled with a paper coaster. The coasted is colored coded, red for stop and green for "bring me all that thick tasty meat" errr, Im mean go. There is also a large fresh food bar filled with cheeses, cured meats, and salad makings if you wish to have those with your dinner. But be careful, you don't want to get full on this stuff, save room for their incredible meats. All of this comes at the price of $59.95 plus drinks, tax and tip.

Fogo also has a pretty decent wine last which is well priced and accessible. Our server tried steering us towards Argentinian Melbecs but we ended up with a Sonoma Cab. Anyways, trust your gut and go with what you like. I don't think you can pick a bad wine form their list. 

Service was friendly and attentive but be warned, they will try to up sell a few items form their menu including a plate full of colossal shrimp. We were hungry so we didn't resist her description and went with it. For $19 I'd say the appetizer was well worth it. Plump juicy shrimp, what's not to love.
