They also have a few specials in their menu including a fish option for those who aren't into AYCE meat, why? 

Be warned, there is very little on street parking around Fogo but there are several garages close by. Now get your meat on!
author: Alexander C.

description:
I had a great time on Valentine's with the team at Fogo De Chao! The salad bar was amazing. Potato salad, garlic green beans and a whole bunch of different cheeses to choose from. 

Their customer service was amazing. The hostess was a little off putting- and made me and my date feel a little uncomfortable. I wouldn't recommend having someone like that be the first impression of the restaurant! That would be my only complaint. 

Other than that, amazing. 

Dress to impress!
author: Maryam B.

description:
Came here for my birthday dinner. It was ok, I think I liked the salad bar better than the actual meat! It was so rare and chewy & some had no flavor. The manager was very nice and came Around to each table , we told him we wanted ours medium well- well done, so when the guy came back with the meat we expected for it to be at that temp ,but it wasn't. It was still really bloody! Also disappointed because the same 3 meats came by, a Brazilian steak, lamb, and some sausage. I really wanted to try the ribs and chicken but none came around & I expected more especially when our server said they have 12 diff meats but we only tried 3.  
Service was ok she was slow and hard to be found at times. My fav thing was the crema brûlée which I got for free for my birthday! Would I go again ehhh prolly not. And where's the fried cheese , plantains that we're on other people's pictures. We just received a Brazilian cheese bread which I didn't like... oh well bummer
author: Melissa G.

description: I went to their branch in Boston and it was 5 star also, I think this is the best Brazilian steakhouse in bayarea.
author: Mason C.

description: I need to update my review. We came back randomly yesterday night and the food was still yummy! But what stood out was Stewart! He came around selling shrimp and cocktails and you know what his southern charm worked! Who could say no to that accent and kindness. We would go back just to see him again! Great service goes a long way!
author: Karen T.

description:
My bf and I came for lunch spontaneously when the restaurant first opened. It was our first time trying Brazilian bbq and we were so impressed! I love the concept of trying different cuts of meat, especially since I'm a picky eater. 

For ~$40 per person, you get unlimited access to the salad bar. They had some really fresh salads, fruit, and hot food. It was fantastic! Very well prepared and a lot of options to choose from.

The meat was definitely the highlight of the meal. We were offered different options of beef, pork, and lamb. It was all very mouthwatering to watch as they come by to slice the meat. Most cuts were also very well cooked and our favorite was definitely the garlic steak! 

Overall, we were very happy and hope to return soon.
author: Sophia H.

description: Meat-eaters heaven! Great customer service, amazing variety at the salad bar (I barely have room for the meat afterwards), and every meat option you can think of. When you come here, prepare to stay a while so that you can get your money worth, as it is an all you can eat Churrascaria. And definitely try and make enough room for the turtle cheesecake! I'm addicted!
author: Imani O.

description:
I came here for a soft opening event, and was blown away by the experience. 

The food was top notch. Everything on the market table was fresh and abundant. All the meats were perfectly cooked not lacking in portions and variety. 

I was super impressed with the impeccable service. For a brand new restaurant, the staff did not miss a beat. 

Apparently they bring seasoned staff from various locations to help train the new staff.

The price is comparable to most steakhouse but you get so much more in terms of the overall experience.
author: Mimi T.

description:
I had my wedding lunch reception here and they really made my event amazing.

PROS:

- Dustin, the event coordinator, was very helpful, prompt, and flexible. 
-The private room was spacious, well decorated, and fit 30 people comfortably.They also was a mic and screen set up for our use. 
-Service was great, my guests were well fed and well served.
-Price. You cannot go wrong with all you can eat, at about $45/person for lunch it was well worth the price.
-Good wine selection. 
-Food. Two Words: Top Sirloin. NOMS. 

CONS:
-Parking. Although there is a parking garage right next door on 3rd (Moscone Center) It gets extremely packed $13 for two hours.The restaurant does not validate. The W Hotel down the street does valet parking for $19.
-Location. Extremely congested. They were doing construction across the street, lots of cars going in and out.
author: Mya M.

description: Met up with friends at the W Hotel then decided on this venue for an early dinner. Blown away! The excellent food coupled with excellent service was truly above the line! I can also say that Mahelly went out of our way to make this one of the best dinner experiences that we have had! From the molten chocolate cake and ice cream to the Brazilian Cachaca, thank you!
author: Josh B.

description: This is a great place to take the kids on a night in the city.  Straight forward good food.  Salad bar is fresh and plentiful.  Great hearts of palm and caesar salad.  You have to be disciplined with the meats.  Only eat the best (basically anything wrapped in bacon!). Don't fill up on the bread and mashed potatoes.  The house malbec (highest end wine by the glass) is well worth the $16!  Great service too.
author: Hutch C.

description:
Are you trying to have a nice dinner in San Francisco? Are you trying to have a nice steak? Then definitely don't choose this place! I mean, for one, why would you come to a major chain when you could go to any of the local steakhouses for the same price, and get far better food and service?

Some of the meats were good, but most are just that. Overall the meat is mediocre. The salad bar is uninspired and none of the sides that accomoany the meal were good (mashed potatoes, polenta, caramelized bananas). My caipirinha was wayyy too sweet but they did have a solid wine selection.  

Servers were friendly but clearly feeling as though they were part of some silly gimmick with the "gaucho" thing. Major power peeve though: no toilet paper in the bathroom. 

Overall, take your business somewhere else if you want a memorable experience. This is just an overpriced Outback steakhouse with swords.
author: Rachael H.

description:
We had an absolutely wonderful lunch at Fogo de Chao today.  The buffet was stellar and the service was even better.  Each server was so attentive and delightful and the manager, Mahelly Ferreira couldn't have been more helpful.  The food was delicious, plentiful and the variety was astounding.  We opted for the Market table, and the array of items and fabulous food made for a great lunch.  The presentation was so attractive, each item was clearly labeled, and garlic mashed potatoes, yucca and fried bananas were brought to the table in addition to the buffet items.

It's 1/2 block from MOMA and a great place to dine when at the museum.
author: Barbara T.

description: Everything was better than could have been expected. The service was above and beyond and nearly all the cuts of meat were amazing. The pace of the food's circulation is perfect - not overwhelming. Very good, I'd recommend it to any meat lover. Be sure you can pack away a lot of food, cause it's a lot.
author: Jeremy M.

description: Plenty of good food but very pricey.  Be prepared to pay.  It's a must if you're in San Francisco.  Al
author: Al K.

description: Superb steaks, perfect service, clean environment and convenient free parking with validation. A favorite of our family! Love the chicken hearts good selection of wines as well. They offer lots of promos and discounts if you register on their website.
author: Dolores C.

description:
Love love love it!

The plantains, meat, & cheese bread were the highlight of my meal!

I couldnt get enough of everything..it was just so delicious! All the meats were fresh & hot when served to us & definitely made sure that we had enough meat on our table. 

Customer service was beyond excellent! All the staff were very friendly and made sure we were content w/our food. 

I love the Brazilian style food but omg is it expensive but totally freakin worth it!
author: Joanne P.

description: Came here for Valentine's Day & it was amazing. The meat is super tender and delicious and they come so fast when they see your card is greens. My least favorite was the chicken to be honest .. it looked good but it was horrible so I would skip out on that one. The service there is wonderful and everyone has a genuine smile on their face. They're market place is all you can eat but it's not that many options there. My boyfriend loved the bread but I didn't like it at all even though it looked really good. Next time we will try a dessert. Parking is less than a block away so you're not scrambling to find something. I would give this place five stars if they had more hot sides oppose to just having salads and stuff ..
author: Treeana W.

description: I have been to many Fogo de Chaos and this is by far the worst location. First, it took them 25 min to bring the cocktails... they kept apologizing. The place was not even busy. They also kept bringing the same meat... I had to complain. I counted 5 different meats... what a rip off. The salad bar is not as good as other locations. At the end we asked for two glasses of wine and asked the waiter to bring the check. He brings the check, we give him the credit card... we actually did not review the check. He comes back after he had taken the credit card to ask what wine we were drinking (the name of it) I assumed he was asking to bring more wine as a way to apologize for the horrible dinner... so we said we were fine no need for more. He responds that he had forgotten to add the wine to the check so needed to get our credit card back and adjusted. Never ever... the dinner is not cheap and I could not believe they are ripping people off like that. I guess, I will be going to Spetous despite the location... 10k time better!
author: Alejandra M.

description:
Fogo was delicious as usual and they sent me home with a box of cheese bread. Buffet bar had top notch offerings. All the meat was perfect medium rare. They had lamb chops and sizzling crispy pork ribs. The pork loin dusted with a snow of parmesan was juicy and delectable. Melt in your mouth filet mignon was charred on the outside, rare on the inside. One demerit for bottom round cubes seriously as tough as tires, but the other fabulous offerings neutralize the demerit. Odd that they would serve bottom round which I spit out - heimlich maneuver meat. 

Every piece of meat was a perfect medium rare. Not a dry, leathery bit to be seen anywhere. To avoid dry meat, always book a busy night and some time between 6ish/7ish when they are bringing out freshly grilled and sizzling fare for the evening crowds. Busy nights mean more turn over of the meat as they slap more on the grill for the hungry masses. That is the key to always getting the best experience. I have gone weekdays to these establishments and that's when you see them passing around the same tired, forlorn, desiccated roast and fewer variety. When you are paying nearly 60 smackaroos, go when it's busy otherwise don't come crying on Yelp.

I noticed that the meat did not have as much salt. These places marinate the meat in rock salt before grilling, but this place was more light handed with it so I found myself occasionally salting my meat. They provided 3 sauces at the table - chimichurri, horseradish and a hot pepper sauce. They brought a basket-full of fresh crunchy cheese bread muffinettes, creamy mashed potatoes, grilled banana and fried yucca. We were so full we forgot to ask for grilled pineapple, but then I didn't see it being passed around.

The place is really nice and not as cramped as Espetus - expansive with high ceilings - luxurious. Located in the beautiful Yerba Buena/Moscone Center area with artsy, sculpture like buildings, fountains, classy restaurants, etc.. This adds to the experience of a night out on the town.

Plunked down $175 for two - including tip, tax for the food, Perriere and a soda. Espetus upped their price to just about the same price as Fogo - nearly 60 bucks. If I had a choice, I choose Fogo because of the ambiance of the location and the interior. However, if they indeed don't serve grilled pineapple, I would choose Espetus, Pikana in Richmond and Cleos in San Bruno.

Super friendly and professional staff.
author: Billious H.

description:
Let me start by saying that I LOVE Fogo De Chao. I would normally give it 5 stars, but this location is the worst. Let me summarize...

Rude and sarcastic waiter who seated us
Cold potatoes
Food that tasted old from the fresh bar
Same waiter was rude when questioned about when the bananas would come out
Had to find someone in order to pay

The negative experience went on and on, and I was very disappointed in this location.
author: Matthew B.

description:
We had Feijoada Table and it wasn't warm. 
Beside that the service wasn't too good, it's hard to say but I had my water 20 minutes after finish my dinner..
author: Daniele N.

description: I came here for my girlfriend's 24th birthday. Really good food. Customer service was outstanding. Bryan was very polite and he always gave us what we needed without any complaints.
author: Warren M.

description: I love their food here and all servers are attentive.  The cheesy muffins is so yummy and the market bar is full of fresh choices of salad and appetizers.  This is a good place for a big group dinner as well.
author: Elsa C.

description: Service and food variety are fine. Place is spacious, it is good both for business and casual lunch. The prices are little bit high, but assuming the amount of food, quality and variety is it reasonable.
author: Max G.

description:
Well, Service is very good.  they have good variety of food
if you don't like Meats much. I thought it was expensive for
the food. This is place to go if you like MEAT.
author: Ursula L.

description:
I was prepared for this huge meal (thanks, flowy dresses) and was DEFINITELY not disappointed. I had only been to one other Brazilian steakhouse before this and had a rather mediocre experience, so I was hoping for some redemption out of this visit.

The space is huge - definitely easy to host a large group if necessary - and has a very modern, minimalistic feel to it. When you first walk into the dining space, you're greeted by a view of all of the meats being perfectly cooked and kept warm and next, their wide variety of other foods at the salad bar area. 

Let me start off by saying that the bread they give you is SO GOOD. They're pretty small rolls but you can always ask for more, and I definitely ate 5 at least... Their salad bar has a wide selection of veggies, pre-mixed salads, other meats, cheese, and fruit (all high quality and definitely much better than I experienced at the other establishment I went to) - would definitely recommend grabbing some things to accompany all the meat.

The way that the restaurant works is that you have a double-sided card that you flip to indicate whether you'd like more meat (green) or want to take a break (red). When the card is flipped green, the servers will continuously stop by your table with various types of meat and ask whether you would like a piece. Don't be afraid to ask them for a smaller or multiple pieces!! ALSO TIP: you can request a certain type of meat (multiple times.. haha my friends and I asked for the filet mignon like 5 times for sure), and they'll be sure to send them over in a timely manner!

I'd say the only downside to the place is the price, starting at $60 per person for dinner, which can be pretty pricey especially if you don't have the biggest appetite. Overall, a great experience!
author: Sophie H.

description:
Came here for lunch and was pleasantly surprised by how nice it was inside! We had a reservation so we were seated really quickly, and the process was pretty smooth. You can get the full churascao (which we did) and start at the Market Bar aka salad bar. Unlike a regular salad bar, they have a bunch of stuff like brown sugar and black pepper bacon, smoked salmon, pickled jalapenos, and multiple premade salads. The waiter also brings you little sides like fried plantains, mashed potatoes, and polenta fries.  

Once you're back at your table, just flip your little card over to the green side and the meat servers will start coming! They have some really good cuts of meat here so come hungry if you want to get your money's worth. Skip on the parmesan chicken, but you should definitely get the roasted chicken drumsticks, filet mignon wrapped in bacon, the rib eye steak, and the sirloin. All of the meats were extremely juicy and delicious and basically fell right off the server's knives!

My only complaint is that they definitely don't come around that often when the crowd is big, and service in general was just a little slow. Since we came here during lunch, and there was a convention happening that week just down the street, it was pretty busy. Our waiter came by pretty infrequently and we were hungry for more meat but had to leave once our lunch hour was over! More meat servers = happier customers.

Overall, the food was actually pretty good, but you have to go hungry. They also have a happy hour that I want to check out at some point!
author: Grace C.

description:
Fogo de Chao is possibly the most famous brand in Brazilian BBQ. The new SF location makes it obvious why - everything is top notch. 

The salad bar which they call "market table" is interesting but on our visit was lacking some more substantial Brazilian dishes like moqueca de peixe and feijoada - but lets be honest no one goes to a steak house for that.

The meat selection and service was absolutely top notch (though lamb was a bit gamy as lamb often is).  I have no idea about their sourcing which would be interesting to know about.

And finally the prices - while its worth the experience its pretty pricey.
Still as far as Brazilian bbq goes - you cant go wrong with Fogo.
author: Oleg H.

description: The servers were wonderful and the atmosphere is great but the food was no where near worth the price of the food. The salad bar had a range of cheeses and salad but very little selection. The meats brought to our table were very normal and a couple were way overly salted. Also overheard a manager talk down to a worker very rudely. Very unprofessional and not okay to do. Would not come back for the high price and eh quality food and selection.
author: Julia W.

description: Came here the night before valentine's day. The steak here is absolutely delicious. The bacon wrapped sirloin, bacon wrapped filet, and ribeye were all cooked to perfection. Would definitely come back. The service was actually great as well, prior to coming here I was skeptical of the service due to previous yelp reviews.
author: Alan H.

description:
This place it's not worth the $61 they charge. 
I have gone to multiple Brazilian stake houses and this the worse one, the meat had no flavor. When I got the garlic steak (my favorite) at the moment I bit into the meat I just tasted nothing, not even garlic. This the last time I come to this place if I come back to San Francisco.
author: Juan L.

description:
Not a good customer service, all we got offered was sirloin. I got one over cooked piece of lam after waiting for an hour.
The cocktails were not good at all, you would expect a delicious cocktail for a $18 drink.
The cheesecake was the best part which you need to order separately.
Check for 2 people including 3 drinks and a cheesecake is $250
author: Angelina W.

description:
My feelings for this restaurant is like a pendulum swinging back and forth, back and forth, tick, tock, tick, tock, TICK!  Where do I even start?  I guess on the good stuff and then the not so good.

IT'S ALL GOOD:)
:)  I was able to book reservations for 18 people with 1 day notice.  I booked the amethyst package where it comes with the full meal, beverage and dessert.
:)  The variety of salad bar was abundance and had some luxurious selections.  Fine cheeses, deli meats, fancy salads, and all kinds of other fine items to choose from.
:)  The meat kept coming and they had sea bass for our pesco-vegetarians too.  
:)  Almost everyone was super happy and grateful after the meal was over 
:)  The decor and ambiance was very upper class sophisticated - it was a beautiful restaurant
:)  The manager is very sweet and accommodating
:)  The meat on a stick was eye boggling.  You want to try everything.   
:) The wait staff was very nice but... see below for the 'but' explanation

...and then the pendulum swings!

NOT GOOD :(
:( The waitress provided instructions on how churrascaria works - that was cool!  I was right next to her and asked her to take the pesco-veg orders. I'm glad she listened to me because there were more fish orders than I thought!  Then she started announcing beverage selections that were priced outside of the amethyst package, I started freaking out because I had a budget in mind and didn't want to go over it.  BUT it was too late, many orders came through and I couldn't really stop it because I didn't want to embarrass anyone.  I quietly ask the waitress to announce the fountain/coffee/tea and dessert to the group, she said YES, then walked away without announcing it.  OH NO SHE DIDNT!  That burned my bubble and after that, my whole experience and attitude went into SHIT MODE!!  Several other people that sat around me saw what happened and had the same feeling.  I just told everyone not to worry about it and I'll talk to the manager when the bill comes out.
:(  There was a wedding reception party - blushing bride was beautiful.  The restaurant was practically booked up.  Which made long long long long lines to the salad bar.  The line was supposed to to counter clockwise and some people from the wedding reception started going clockwise and screwed up the whole queue system!  It was way too many people for such a small bar.  They might want to consider a separate bar for big ass parties!  It was definitely uncomfortable and made me mad.  
:( Since the line was long and the waitress knew that, she said half of our party should get up and go first.  She would come back for the 2nd half when it was clear.  She FAILED to let the 2nd half know when it was clear!  Guess it never cleared up because when I got there, the line was long long long!
:( Plates were DIRTY!!!!!  I skimmed through 5 plates with leftover food marks on it before I could find 4 clean plates.  I wasn't even sure if I was going to get clean plates since there was only like 12 plates left for all these people to use.  I'm 100% sure some people wandered around trying to figure out where the plates are located because it was behind the salad bar and not logically at the front/back of the salad bar.
:) This UPSET me the most out of all the UPSETS!  The 4 orders of fish was announced that it would take 15-18 minutes.  It was 30! 30 MINUTES before they got their orders.  I was very sad for them because they were waiting for their protein to come out to eat with salad.  And once it was out, they were filled with veggies already.  I looked at the sea bass and it was beautifully prepared but it was basically a seared sea bass.  Why would that take 30 minutes???  Not cool.  

...and then the pendulum swings again!

NOW THE RESOLUTION :|
I asked the waiter to please send the bill and manager to me.  I was dissatisfied with the level of service and lack of communication to the amethyst package to our table.  I didn't appreciate the waitress offering drinks outside of the package when they knew we had a set menu.  The manager listened and worked out the bill with me.  Then after we resolved the bill, I manage to keep my company on budget, which was a very big deal to me.  BUT if there was better communication from the waitress, I'm 100% sure I wouldn't had been in shit mode for my company luncheon.

NOTES:  Where are the grilled pineapple?  Some people were wondering where the chicken hearts were.  The meat selection was less than the other popular Brazilian steakhouse in the city.  Most of the meats were lacking salt and mostly dry.  My fav was the sirlon steak and pork ribs.  No seafood on a stick option (shrimp).

CAME BACK AGAIN:  I did manage to come back for a complimentary meal with my +1. The additions were lamb chops, lamb leg, chicken hearts and rib eye - I liked the rib eye steak a lot!  Came out feeling like a over sized marshmallow.  But my stomach woke me up at 3AM and was sick for 30+ min.  They win, I lose.  The End.
author: Jenny T.

description: Service very slow.  Waited a long time for meat to be served.  Most meat was too rare.  Salad bar not impressive.  I've been to much better Brazilian steak houses.
author: Brett B.

description:
We were walking to the SF MOMA, and hadn't realized how close this place was. 

So we stopped for a quick lunch (on a Saturday). 

The place was busy, but we were still seated relatively quickly, and then the food started coming. Overall this was a great place, and the food was outstanding. The garlic sirloin (if I remember right) was the biggest surprise for me, not really a garlic type of person, but it worked really well for that one. Beyond the steak, all of which was amazing, the Market Table was great too, with a huge variety of stuff to go with the main course. 

The staff was attentive, and helped make it a fun experience. 

Added benefit to this place is easy parking at the Moscone Center garage, which is something most good restaurants in the city don't have. 


PRO TIP: because they use flat red/green cards here make sure that it is visible near the corner of the table, and not obscured by a plate or cup.
author: Chris R.

description:
Meats are great of course but the salad bar area stood out the most!! There is a variety of cold meats, cheese, olives, AND there was an amazing Brazilian stew with pork and rice... 

If you've got $ to spend and a very empty stomach, make a reservation and get your butt over here.
author: Tracy L.

description: Went there last night with a party of 4. We had made a reservation for 630. We arrived 10mins late due to a poor Uber driver. They seated us within 5mins. Super busy here. Bathrooms were clean and the dining area clean. Wide variety of food in the salad bar. We asked several people 3 times for filet mignon. However we realized asking Mat Litez for any kinds of meat he would make sure we got it. As well as Tri Me. Both ended up being our servers for the night. Tri sang with us Happy Birthday to our mom. Both were supurb in customer service and were ready to help us immediately. So we started only asking them for stuff. The cuts of meat were amazing!! I've never seen so many different types all in one place like this. This was mine and my Gfs first time here but our parents had been here once before. Amazing service! Amazing food! The wine was wonderful. Mallehy (manager) was quick to fix my Gfs drink that she ended up not liking. And she was also amazing. Thank you to these 3 for helping us and making our experience wonderful, you guys rock.
author: Emily T.

description: Excellent lunch with co-workers today. Everyone enjoyed the variety of choices and the taste of everything. Finished with luscious key lime pie. Food coma for the rest of the day. Will definitely come back.
author: Denise T.

description: Went here for my birthday dinner last Friday and it was amazing! The staff was very accommodating and attentive. My friends and I literally had food coma after dinner, well what do you expect when we spent almost 4 hours at an amazing buffet!? Definitely coming back!
author: Angelica G.

description:
Went here for New Year's Eve dinner and it did not disappoint! The staff was very gracious and attentive despite it being a very busy night. There was one blonde Brazilian hostess who was particularly sweet. 

Advice to those who plan to tread here, do NOT flip that coaster to green unless you're sure you're ready for the assault of meat about to come your way. We thought we were prepared, until before we knew it our plates were piled up with about 6 different meats in a matter of about 6 minutes. But can't say I can complain. 

The only reason I give it 4 stars is because, while it was good, it wasn't mind blowing for the price. Some of the meats were sort of bland and just okay, but the experience is a fun one and the staff is great!
author: Destini M.

description:
In a city known for it's fine dining cuisine and healthy lifestyle options, sometimes you just want to eat a lot of meat.  And not terrible, cut-rate, cheap rate buffet style fare, but real high quality meat, but still at an affordable rate.  Brazilian-style steakhouses are the best way to indulge in this, and Fogo de Chao is the best.  I've been to the ones in Las Vegas and San Jose, and not San Francisco. 

Here are my tips for Brazilian steakhouse eating:

Don't go for a weekday lunch, unless you plan on skipping out on the rest of your workday from the inevitable food coma.
If you don't live or work in walking distance, don't bother driving.  You shouldn't be operating heavy machinery with the meat sweats.  BART is only a few blocks away.  If you insist on driving, they do offer valet parking.
Unless you are a champion competitive eater, don't eat too much during your previous meal.  Or, you can be like me and don't eat for the entire day before dinner!
Don't fill up too much on the market table.  Have a few small tastes of some salads, or cured meat (they even have a whole pile of cooked bacon!), maybe even some fruit.  But they will be filler for the real reason people dine here.
Control yourself when you first turn that button to green.  In the beginning, get a small portion of each type of meat, to experience the full plethora of options.  Once you've tried everything, then you can go hog wild and get seconds (thirds? fourths?) of your favorite meats.

As far as my favorites go, I love the Picanha (their signature meat), the beef ribs, the lamb chops, the aforementioned bacon and the caramelized bananas.  The meat quality and variety is the best of all the different Brazilian steakhouses I've dined in, as well as the quantity of different dishes on the market table.  Possibly in the future, I will try dessert, but i never seem to have room for it!
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Great food and good service.   The server offered not to charge my daughter who literally just ate 2 slices of watermelon and the cheese bites.  Cheese bread bites are gluten free made out of yuca flour and simply delicious!  Lots of meats and bar has everything for meat and veggie lovers alike.  Expensive but well worth the experience.
author: Mimi E.

description:
My friend and I ate here for dinner in Nov. 2016. Service and food was excellent.
The staff was the best I have ever seen in San Francisco. Very attentive and friendly. More Brazilian than American in a good way.
The food was great. The restaurant is beautifully designed and appointed creating a serene and comfortable experience.
The New York steak was to die for. The Picanha (top sirloin) steak almost as good.
I would have given them 5 stars if they had had more kinds of meat such as linguica or chicken on the buffet. Some of the things on the buffet were not labeled as well as they could have been. While I do not like Feijoada black beans, I was told that it is great.
It is an expensive dinner, so we did not have alcohol which was quite high priced.
Since it is an "all you can eat" restaurant, come here very hungry.
author: Andreas M.

description: This is the only Brazilian steakhouse I love going to in the Bay Area. I've been to other places, but nothing comes close to this place. I love the fact that all the meats are so tender and juicy. I also love there customer service and professionalism. I definitely recommend this place to anyone that loves Brazilian steakhouses!
author: PremiumShotz P.

description: All I can say is WOW! The service is outstanding! The constant barrage of meat coming at you is almost overwhelming and the people that serve you are always friendly! The meat itself is spectacular. It's always perfectly seasoned! And the salad bar is a great option for those who don't like meat.
author: Coach M.

description: We just drove close to 100 miles just to have lunch there for moms birthday. We've eaten at different locations and Brazilian is one of our favorites. The food was really good. The meats delicious but things weren't running as smoothly as we had hoped and we came during transition from lunch to dinner so the bar with all the fixn's was bare  we weren't having the experience that we had hoped to. It was very disappointing until one of the managers came to our table and asked how everything was going. I politely told him honestly how I felt and how far we had come just for this to celebrate. He immediately took care of everything he went out of his way making sure we were taking care of and that it was definitely worth the drive. Stewart was his name and I'm so grateful that he listened and made our experience memorable .
author: Natalie L.

description:
I passed by this spot everyday for almost over a year. And I only decided to go recently. The serves Henry and Leo the freaking best! They gave us great advice and recommended to us great off the menu sauces.

I was with my grandma who wears a hijab and they knew to not bring us any pork because of our religion! 

Now that's top notch service!
author: Moe E.

description: The food is fantastic, but what should have been an hour lunch turned into two and a half due to the scattered service.
author: Jordan F.

description: I hosted a party of 30 here for a work event. This was an amazing experience. Every single item of food was delicious. Nothing was mediocre, including the staff and management. I was complimented by my boss' boss on choosing this restaurant for the event we were attending. Really great place! I highly recommend!
author: Kyla B.

description: Another great meal at Fogo! We had to wait 30 minutes past our reservation time, but it WAS NYE so they were slammed. The food and service once we were seated made up for it though. So delicious- everyone enjoyed and at way too much.
author: DARIA O.

description: Lots of choices whether you're craving meat or salads. Price is obviously on the high end, so better get your money's worth. Not a good choice for those on a strict diet.  The servers can get sneaky by showing up with the least satisfying options first (chicken, pork, sausages). Skip those selections and call for the beef choices, if you prefer. This would not be a good place to take your kids to unless they eat a lot.
author: Mark V.

description:
Honestly really disappointed with this place. $60 for ayce meat and salad bar is pretty steep so I expect to be blown away, but I've definitely had better experiences elsewhere. 

First off, maybe I'm just super uptight but it definitely stressed me out to eat here. They give you cards to flip over to indicate whether you want them to stop by and offer you meat or not (green = come feed me and red = oh no please stop). I flipped my card to green immediately after hitting the salad bar because I  was eager to get started. However you get bombarded so quickly with meat that your plate starts overflowing and you not only have no room left to get more let alone even cut the pieces you already have. In addition, by the time you get to eat your meat it's already cold  maybe I'm just a noob and I got too greedy about trying all the meats. Whoops. But seriously guys all the beef cuts tasted the same. I'm pretty sure they said top sirloin for every single one. The bacon wrapped chicken was really dry and the bacon literally had not been crisped at all and was super soggy with no fat rendered out. 

The salad bar was pretty decent though ($30 for salad bar alone and no ayce meat). Some good salad options, the corn and edamame slaw was one of my favorites. There were also some charcuterie options with prosciutto, salami, and a variety of cheeses. I didn't get to try the soup since it was empty the whole time we were there, but maybe this just means it was really good. The watermelon was a nice way to end the meal but this was empty for awhile also. 

Tldr: not much variety, really expensive, and pretty slow service. But great cheesy bread so definitely get that if you decide to go
author: Sam L.

description: Mother's Day today. Two mons plus two 6 yrs old kids walked in at 3pm and wanted to get a table before the crowed. The door lady said only need a few min to get a table. After 5 groups after us got seated. We started to wonder if we get a table. Then the door lady said the wait will be 2hrs. We were sitting in front of the entry at the whole time until the groups behind us were all seated, and they didn't even tell us that the table were sold out! went to the door lady and checked with her again, she said that was the manager's decision!  Without any apologies! Really???!! very unpleasant service. They could just tell us if their table sold out and shouldn't just let us wait! How rude!
author: Carol L.

description:
I usually see these "type" of steakhouses as the "Disney" of restaurants but the location was perfect, staff was warm/inviting/courteous and the food was totally deliciousness. The rice and black beans were almost as perfect as my grandmothers.  Such a wide variety of chicken, beef, pork, lamb and the variety of how each was cooked or brought out was very great. All of the meats were delicious and perfectly cooked although they were a little salty.  The fried sweet plantains are also amazing, similar to my mothers back home, but it seems as if though they were being rationed for the war effort or something, they would bring two out at a time with 4-5 polenta sticks (these were also good). 
The cocktails and wines are a bit overpriced but it is downtown SF. 
The staff was all amazing and warm from the hostesses to our waiter. Bus boy and the Gauchos serving the meats.  Even the corporate training manager from Indianapolis came by to see how we were, and I met one of  the sous chefs at the salad bar and he was so courteous.
author: David C.

description: this was my first time here but i hear a lotta people raving about this place! we took my mom here for mother's day and even though i had reservations, we had to wait about 20-30 minutes. i felt like at such a pricier and nicer restaurant, i should never have to wait since i made a reservation a couple weeks ago. we got drinks at the bar while we waited. you get a buffet style salad bar which is nice but don't get full off of it!! the cheese bread is delicious and i wanted to eat more but i didn't wanna get full!! i counted in total about only 6-8 different types of meat. i've been to other brazilian bbq places and they have served so much more. the meat (chicken) was dry and the only thing i really ate was the prime rib meat. even then, it took forever to get meat. i thought they would be more staffed since it was mother's day. the total for the four of us was about $320 without the drinks from the bar. i thought that was a little pricey for the quality of food that we ate.
author: diane d.

description: I"m not a huge fan of Brazilian Steakhouses, but this place is the best one I've tried so far. This is the old Chevy's and inside is really nice and modern. Place is super spacious. Very expensive. Service was great and we had a party of 25 people. The waiters did their best to check on us and to make sure we always had meat coming. The only thing I loved was the bottom sirloin and the beef ribs. The beef ribs are to die for, but it came at the very end of our meal when everyone was full....bummer. Make sure you ask for their chimichurri sauce. The rest of the meat was dry to me. You also get cheese bread, mash potatoes, and fried plantain. The mash potatoes are a huge thumbs up. The salad bar is really nice also.
author: Karen H.

description: The food quality is quite fine, but the service is a bit lacking. We have been here around 4 times, and we've always had to wait 10-15 minutes at the lobby in order to get our (reserved) table ready.
author: Al C.

description: First time there and I was really excited to try this Brazilian Steakhouse. Very expensive but it doesn't match up to what you're paying for. I did the meat experience with the salad bar. The salad bar was nothing to be excited about. It's so busy on a Saturday night, that I was forgotten and I lost my appetite waiting for so long. I paid a total of $250 and left still hungry. The place was crammed and it was overwhelmingly crowded. I don't want to wait for someone to come up to my table to serve me multiple slices of meat yet they didn't even come to mine table. It's so chained like and doesn't have a cool ambiance like some mom and pops restaurants. The best thing was the pineapple sugar alcohol beverage.
author: Olivia F.

description:
It was a great last minute Valentines dinner for sure! Much Love to the hostess for squeezing us in! With no reservation too!!!! 
The food was good and the service was nice... I personally think our other Brazilian Steak House we frequent is better but maybe that is because they know us so well they take extra good care of us .... 
All in all it was cool .... They are our secondary choice though .... Compared to our regular spot ... And we can say we tried it ...
To Ruano at Espetus  ... Thank you man - we have always appreciated you and the staff ... Now we really have extra appreciation for you and your crew ...
author: Misty R.

description: Every time I go they have really good service. Servers and waiters always make us feel special. This time went for Father's Day and received complimentary meal for next time.
author: Diana N.

description: The location. The food. The service. It was ALL great!! Celebrated my son's 21st birthday with family and the overall evening could not have been better! Management team checked on us and ensured all was going well. Special shout-out to a sweet young man "Abner" who was one of the servers. He was amazing and made sure to go out of his way to speak to us in Spanish and make us feel welcomed!
author: D P.

description: This restaurant exceeded my expectations. Went there for SF Restaurant Week and the food selection was amazing. The staff was the best, very friendly and attentive, one of the best services I've received in San Francisco. You can have a great time without being rushed and just enjoy the food at your own pace. The salad bar had many options for appetizers and side dishes, my favorites were the quinoa and kale salad and the roasted zucchini. The meat selection was the best part, remember to flip your red side of the card, otherwise the meat just keeps coming in! Overall it is a fun place to have a great dinner with friends. Highly recommend!
author: Lorely G.

description: Had my wife bday there, it was good experience, very friendly staff, service was great and the food was really good, all different kind of meat they served was tasty and perfectly cooked, will come back again.
author: A N.

description: The restaurant had a very nice ambiance and the staff was very good constantly checking if we wanted more steak or needed anything at any time .
author: Maddy P.

description:
The food here has been very good (as expected here) the two times I have eaten at this new location.  Quality and choices at the market bar and the meats are plentiful and food in quality.  

The waitress and table staff were also very good when checking in on us, and making sure we had enough drinks or differing meats. 

Unfortunately the service from the gaucho chefs left a sour note to the entire experience.  This may seem old fashioned, but shouldn't a nice restaurant always ask the females at a table first, not the males?  There was one female at the table (and the closest to them) and two males.  They always asked the males if they wanted the meat before the female.  That was a little annoying, however when the female's card was green and the two male cards were red - a servers NEVER stopped at the table - they bypassed us every single time, no matter where we moved the little card.   When we tested the theory and switched a guys card green and not the female's - they stopped again!   The only way the female got any of her requests was to ask the waitress. 

The service made it questionable if we will return, which is a pity since we love the food!
author: Jon H.

description: I went there just to get a good lamb chop.  It never came until after half another wait even though I asked a few times. I was very much disappointed with taste, and its cooking. And finally this place is way more expensive than it should be.
author: Omid A.

description:
The service we received was impeccable. I forgot our waiter's name but he had a Southern accent and said he was from South Carolina. He was charming and delightful. We divided the bill in four and he truly impressed us by remembering who
each person in the party was. I like 3 out 5 meats I tasted. The salad bar was not that interesting.
author: Sophia C.

description:
This place is a carnivore's carnival and the meats are delectable. It's great for non-meat eaters too as their salad bar offers a variety of delicious dishes. The service is top notch and Leo, Stuart, Mahelly and the rest of the team are wonderful!

Thank you and obrigado to all at Fogo!
author: Foofa B.

description:
Perfect service, ultra friendly staff.
Amazing beef cuts selection prepared by master barbecuers in Brazilian style.
Colorfull and tasty salad bar.
Nicely prepared side orders including the traditional cheesebread.
All of that in a beatifully decorated environment.
Will visit again soon.
author: Hussein S.

description: For sure an excellent place! Excellent treatment to customers. Not 5 stars from me cuz there is something imma be honest. It's a Brazilian restaurant, however, the food is not really Brazilian, because it's made to satisfy everyone. If I wasn't from Brazil, it would be 5 stars. Anyways, I loved the experience I got at this place. For real.
author: Gustavo C.

description: Food was incredible and the hostess who sat us was a little stuffy. The servers were great and the waitress we had made it all perfect. She took such great care of us and her attention to making sure everything was to our satisfaction was what made the whole thing work. If you go here make sure to ask for Angela.
author: Christopher T.

description:
If you are up for a unhappy evening with tasteless steak this will be your best choice. 
Wonderful interior and horrible service, 
01) meat servers takes all the time they want to chit chat in side the grilling area. 
02) salad bar had literally nothing comparing to a steakhouse like Texas de Brazil or Chima. 
03) beans and rice was cold and after telling the server we got no response. 
04) steaks doesn't have any seasoning on it. When we asked it to be medium rear they brought out burnt meat without seasoning or salt on it. 

After telling manager about it she said that she can't do anything and treated us like we haven't been to a steakhouse before. 
*( FYI we are VIP members of Texas de Brazil and been most of the Brazilian steaks house in Houston, Orlando , Fort Lauderdale, Washington DC, Alabama, and Brazil itself)*
We didn't want the service anymore. We were so ready to leave and manager wanted to charge us for salad bar which is $29.99. I didn't agree and she made a scene and finally agreed. 
After that horrible experience we went out got some local pizza from union square to make our night better.
author: Mayura D.

description: Food and service was wonderful. My cocktail was on the house because it came towards the end of my meal, which was appreciated.
author: Delilah S.

description: What a wonderful experience in dining cuisine. A beautifully presented market bar accompanies your meal. Server personnel perfectly attired in festive Brazilian uniforms pass throughout the restaurant with freshly prepared meats and stop at your table to see if you would care for some. You can enjoy to your hearts content. Other than the excessive salt the meats are well prepared and flavorful. It's a one price concept that is well worth it.
author: Cyndi G.

description: Love the meat they hand out to you on sticks. Man that meat like chicken, beef, steak, lamb all of that is soooooo good. You could not get better meat at a restaurant than this. I also just love the buffet they have available too. I would certainly recommend  Fogo de Chao to anybody
author: Adam S.

description: If you're a meat lover you need to check out Fogo de Chao!  It's heaven.  The food is amazing, you can eat as much or as little as you want.  I'd check out the salad and bar area but no need to spend a lot of time there as the meat will be coming around to you.
author: Blake B.

description:
This is my first time going to a Brazilian steakhouse and I have to admit that it does not disappoint at all. From the prompt service to the delicious meat, everything was really good. 

After being seated, you go up to the market place table and pick out whatever you wanted ranging from fruits and salads to smoked salmon and prosciutto. 

When we was first seated, the servers came by with all sorts of meats and I didn't even have time to take a couple of bites before my plate filled up with meat. Then I realized I could turn the card over to stop it for awhile. 

There were so many different kinds of meats brought over, but my favorite was the bacon wrapped filet mignon. The meat was really tender and the bacon added more flavor to it. My second favorite was the prime sirloin, but everything there was pretty good. 

The waiters and servers were really attentive and they made sure we got everything we needed to enjoy our meal.
author: Maybo L.

description:
Like most fogos, this place does Brazilian BBQ right. My favorite cuts are the beef ribs, brisket, ribeye and filet mignon in that order. Unfortunately the beef ribs didn't come out until the very end this time around, but hey, sometimes life throws you a curve ball.

Like most places downtown, you can find parking but it's either gonna cost you or take forever to find. It's not too far of a walk if you Bart in, and I believe the 12 drops you off pretty close as well. 

It's overall a pretty nice and elegant establishment, but like most places in SF, jeans, sneakers and a polo will get you in without feeling out of place.
author: Andrew E.

description:
While I like Fogo de Chao as a chain (Chicago, LA, Beverly Hills, Dallas are notably great locations), this newly opened Fogo location in SF is terrible due to very dirty plates and silverware, rude and inattentive wait staff, and poor food quality.  

Everyone in my party of eight had to request a replacement of the plates and silverware.  It was pretty disgusting and off putting.  The plates by the salad bar were no better, which led us to believe that it's a problem with whatever dishwashing machine they use.  This was quite disgusting.

Servers had to be reminded to bring drinks to the table several times.  Wait staff serving the meat here is a mixed crowd.  Some are happy to provide you with requested meat temperature and others were quite rude about it, with unnecessary comments to customers.  The whole experience was pretty bad.

Meat quality also varied.  There was a high amount chewy meat, lots of gristle.  Sides were poorly executed when it came to mash potatoes, polenta fries, and cheese bread.  

Overall, I will not be coming back to this Fogo in San Francisco due to poor execution of service, quality, and value.
author: Jay S.

description: Disappointed.  I have eaten at Brazilian steak houses in many states, including other Fogo locations.  Despite there being over a dozen empty tables, they were making parties of 2 wait 15-20 minutes before seating (6 small groups were all waiting to be seated).  Once seated, our waiter quickly disappeared and did not pay attention to our table other than to bring 1 glass of wine sometime later.  Our water glasses were not refilled, our rolls were never refilled,  and we were never brought our sides - finally, when we were almost done I asked about them, and another waitress (not our waiter - he serviced a few other tables but kept ignoring us for some reason) and she apologized and then brought them out - she also confirmed that our waiter was supposed to have brought them out in the beginning.  Long story short, $70 per person,  $18 for one small glass of house red, and really lousy service.  I will not return to this location or tell my friends to visit.  If you're paying $158 (not including tip) for a dinner for 2, the service better be fan-freakin-tastic.  Very disappointed.
author: Joe R.

description: Excellent food, great service, salad bar is amazing with a lot of cheese choices yumm, high quality meats, not too much noise perfect spot for a date
author: Margo S.

description:
What an incredible experience. 

There's truly nothing like sitting down and having endless meat brought to you until you can't possibly eat more. 

I found the market table to be great, everything tasted fresh and was the right temperature.

As for the meat, everything I tried was delicious. One thing I didn't expect was that for certain cuts and preparations, they'd have selections for the internal temperature, which was really nice. 

The service was really great, and the atmosphere was welcoming and fun.
author: Joey S.

description:
We waited for a while before trying this place out.  Overall was very impressed and will go back.  It's an elegant contemporary room, prompt, friendly service, and excellent food.  My partner is vegetarian and they didn't bat an eye.  The "market table" is way more than just a salad bar - many interesting grain salads, pickled vegetables etc.  The meats were uniformly good and offer the full range of doneness from pink/medium rare to well done.  I only tried the various cuts of beef so can't speak to the chicken, pork, or lamb but those meats looked good. 

We were there early on a weekday evening and the crowd was heavily business people (mostly men) who were attending a conference at Moscone.  Since it's a chain, and a steak place, I assume that's always going to be true.  They have several nice looking rooms in the back that can be sectioned off with sliding walls for semi-private dining for groups.  When we mentioned that we live nearby the servers and staff were even more attentive and friendly, which is appreciated.  

Overall on the expensive side for the ambience, setting and food, but understandable when you go to an expense account restaurant.  We'll keep it in mind for groups and for our own business dinners; not so much for romantic or intimate meals.
author: Bruce M.

description:
Let me first start off by saying I came here to celebrate my boyfriends birthday last night and when making the reservations I made sure to point this fact out. Upon arrival and throughout the whole night there was no mention of the sort.  Being that's just a small fact I am only taking off a quarter of a star. However, any other place would acknowledge this fact, it's part of being hospitable and making people feel special (which they surely lack in).

We got seated in a corner by the windows and felt like we were a bit forgotten about throughout the night. The bread, polenta sticks, mashed potatoes and plantains didn't get to us until we were more than half way through our dinner (which took the full 2hrs). The reason we felt forgotten about was because when my boyfriend kept going to get veggies at the salad bar area, he would see guys with meats we hadn't seen come to our table the entire night. It wasn't until Blake came to our table with some meat that he asked if there was anything we hadn't gotten yet that we wanted to try. Now I don't know if he has telepathy or not but the fact that he even bothered asking us was a big bonus and the only real reason I am giving this place even 4 stars (2 ONLY because of him and the other 2 because the meats were tasty). I hope management finds a way to show him our appreciation because without his service to our table last night this review would have been a lot worse. Anyways, Blake sent over some of the guys who hadn't gotten to us yet and we finally got to taste a bit of everything. My favorites were the porkchop (it's like a tequila lime flavor - so juicy!) and the sirloin wrapped in bacon. The bread which is more like a cheese popover was delicious and the plantains and polenta sticks were amazing. 

All this being said, if you want a better variation of meats you probably don't want to get sat at a booth near the windows.
author: marisa n.

description:
Very disappointing. 

Same concept as Espetus Brazilian Steakhouse. Fogo de Chao is an AYCE Brazillian steakhouse, which includes AYCE various types of meat, market table, and a few sides (mashed potatoes, polenta fries, fried plantains, and cheese bread). There are a good amount of servers coming to your table offering all types of meat. There is also a sign indicator on each table indicating whether you want the servers to keep coming to your table to keep serving you the meat. If it's green, the meat will keep coming. If it's red, it means you want to take a break from eating or you just want to stop eating. 

The meats were definitely a miss in my books. Meat quality was not that great. Very chewy and fatty. The sad part is.. all the meats tasted the same. Nothing special at all.  Most of the meat were rare even when we asked for medium rare. FYI - if you're looking for the beef ribs, it's by request only. You're not really missing out though because it was also very fatty.. :(

Service was majority a miss. Our waitress rarely checked up on us. Not very attentive. We always had to flag someone down to refill our water or change our plates. I also didn't like the way the meat servers served. I felt like all the servers were in a rush trying to serve the meat. One server was so careless that whenever he finished cutting the meat, he would splash the blood/juice of the meat everywhere on the table. I was quite worried that it would get on my clothes. They need to work on the meat servers' training.
 
If you want good quality meat, please go to Espetus Brazillian Steakhouse in San Francisco or San Mateo. Service is also more professional, attentive, and friendly there.
author: Philana C.

description:
Review for happy hour only: 
- I LOVED my Brazilian Martini.  Just the right level of sweet and smoky.  I would return just for that.  The Mango Refresco and Caiprinha weren't bad but the BM was definitely my favorite.
- Food-wise, I was less impressed.  The cheese bread is delicious, as everyone says.  But the beef in our skewers and sliders were both overcooked.  I asked for medium rare and they were definitely well done.  The flavor was good but I would've liked it less done.  Charcuterie board was A+.
- We came on a Friday evening, and it wasn't overly packed.  I like not having to elbow my way in for a seat so I'll likely be back for a cocktail.
author: Melinda C.

description:
Grilled meats come out alarmingly fast. We were immediately bombarded with grilled meats.
After our first serving there was very little wait on any of the meats. Lamb chops, filet mignon, sirloin, leg of lamb, chicken legs, sausage, pork and beef ribs, and several other meats
I can't remember. 

I should have went to the market table first,
Because the meat sweats came fairly fast for me.

The market table Had a great selection of roasted and marinated vegetables, fresh fruits, various salads and a few hot items. Don't miss the sweet chili peppered bacon and the slow roasted pork shoulder in the corner.

Only wished they served feijoada instead of asparagus pea soup.
author: Robin K.

description:
What started off slightly rough for our anniversary dinner turned quickly around by the all star manager Mahelly. 
She touched our table numerous times and even decanted our wine herself. Sent over a special anniversary dessert and made the whole experience very special. 
Fogo is lucky to have such a great employee who is passionate about wine and service. Hopefully they help her obtain her Sommelier certification!!
author: Nick M.

description: Came here a day before Valentine's Day with the reservation and we're seated real fast. Service was great our main server Daniel was there from the time we we're seated to the time we left checking up on us, all the staff here where friendly and and always there when we had our card turned to green. What a nice Day before Valentine's Day dinner. The salad bar was awesome they had lots of different healthier choices to choose from I really like the marinated mushrooms and fresh vinaigrette. We tried all the meats, there where like 12 different meats out of the 12 I like the Picanha the most it was seasoned and juicy. also they have a  meat behind the salad bar think it was prime rib don't know if it was just for that night are they serve it all the time. One thing I did learn was that most of the meats here  you got to eat while it's hot. If you Bring your own bottle wine is a 35 Dollar cork fee and ain't nothing like having a bottle of Cabernet with your dinner. I will be back and Thank Fogo De Chao staff.
author: Dennis T.

description: Dry meat. Bright lights. Inexperienced servers. Given all that, it was too expensive for what we got. Too bad.
author: Alexander K.

description: Came only for lunch and compared to Espetus lunch, fogo has more options for salad bar. On the flip side Espetus has a house sirloin that melts in your mouth! but Fogo has beef ribs that is beautifully marbled with delicious fat. Espetus beef ribs does not....::insert thinking emoji::
author: Yerm I.

description: The food was good. And the services was good as well. Wait wise wasn't that bad I had dinner reservations  at 8pm and they didn't sit us until like 815ish. The buffet for the sides where good. But they need more of starchy  items. I tried there cheese bread and it was to die for OMG . It's pricey but for the amount of steaks is worth it.
author: Maria P.

description: I was here for a birthday dinner. The ambiance is nice and the staff was really friendly. I liked the salad bar, but the meat was similar to Espetus. I believe that Espetus boasts a wider selection of meats. Street parking is tough, it is better to Uber in. Overall it was a good experience
author: Dirty S.

description: We did not have a good experience at this Fogo which was surprising.  The salad bar was disappointing and some of the meat selections were tough and tasteless.  We eat at Fogo in Beverly Hills and always fantastic.  Highly disappointed.
author: Kathy W.

description:
We picked this place for our anniversary and it was a hit! The place is modern and absolutely beautiful. The service is high-level, everyone was nice and professional.
The "salad bar" has many options to offer: pickled vegetables, salads, salmon, prosciutto, soup of the day, fruits and many more. 
Meat selection is very wide, we tried different cuts of beef, lamb chops, leg of lamb, chicken wrapped in bacon, pork ribs. 
Warning: The cheese puffs are very delicious and could be addictive!
author: Max K.

description: If I could leave a zero star, I would do that. I've been to Fogo in NY, LA and Philadelphia but this was the worst experience ever. We were waiting for over twenty months mutes for the next meat to be served but no one came. I POLITELY expressed my concern to two managers but they were both rude with condescending attitudes and looks. Don't go to this place. Apparently, food was good though.
author: Inhwan O.

description:
Ok guys, I can't compare Fogo with Espetus because I've never been there. But according to my friends who have been to both... they liked Fogo more.

Now for my first Brazilian meat experience, I was just blown away by the varieties and deliciousness. The meat were all so tender and juicy and seriously...i ate enough meat for days! Their beef options were countless. From sirloin to ribeye, and from tri-tip to filet mignon. Besides beef... they had pork, sausages, and lamb. Once your card placemat is swapped to ready... the staffs will be at your table non-stop serving you meat until you flip the card back around. Very attentive and they definitely made sure you don't go hungry.

Their self-serve buffet area is really decent as well. Don't forget to check that out but don't get filled up from there. One of my highlights of the night was the cheese bread! YES.... their simple bread that they bring to your table at the very beginning. It was THAT good.

They have lots of cocktails to choose from. One of their signature drinks is the pineapple old fashioned. I thought it was just OK. I prefer the original one better. Their black cherry manhattan was strong... just the way I like it.

Maybe I should try Espetus one of these days? Or not.
author: Nancy N.

description:
When Open Table let me know I had a gift card that I could redeem at any OT restaurant, I chose Fogo because my husband LOVES Brazilian steakhouses.  The last good one we had was at Plataforma in New York, which we both liked better than Espetus in SF.

Then I saw all the subpar reviews and I was like, uhhhhh should I change our reservation?  We decided to bite the bullet and just go; perhaps we'd have a better experience.

The great:

+ Decent variety of meat circulating around.  We had our little placard switched to green most of the time.
+ Good quality meats - nothing was dry or overly salty (according to my husband).
+ The small selection of sides they brought to the table (caramelized bananas are my favorite) were good.  The polenta fries and garlic mashed potatoes were tasty too.
+ Selection of non-beef items.  I don't eat beef, and I did manage to get some pork chop and pork ribs, though I wasn't interested in the chicken.  The pork chop was good, the pork ribs were better.
+ Papaya creme dessert was better than I thought, and I don't even like papayas!
+ Good service.

The bleh:

- Market table was terrible.  The food wasn't good (especially the feijoadas - zero flavor or spice), the selection was tiny, and it was just generally not impressive.
- Tres leches cake was overly sweet to the point where I couldn't even eat a bite.  And this is typically my favorite dessert at a restaurant.

Overall it's a good dining experience.  It might have helped that the restaurant wasn't full, so we received good service and the circulation of meat was pretty quick, so perhaps an earlier reservation (we went Friday at 6 PM) might be better if you want more attentive service.
author: Tori S.

description:
We ventured on over here on a Wednesday night, with a party of six, with the hope of leaving stuffed with enough red meat to offend vegans everywhere. While we did succeed in the goal, it turned out to be a bit more of a challenge than we expected.

Upon being seated our server came over, introduced herself, and gave us the basic rundown. One member of our party immediately ordered a cocktail, while everyone else asked for a bit more time. Off she went, and returned about 10 minutes later without the ordered drink. We placed our drink order and asked for a bottle of wine. Off the server went, and returned 15 minutes later to drop off 4 glasses (for a party of 6) and the wine, as well as the ordered cocktail. (Poor guy nearly died of dehydration.) She didn't open the wine, but rather walked off yet again, without a word. She finally came back after about 5 more minutes, with the final two glasses, and then opened the wine. No apology, no explanation for how long everything took. Friendliness was not her strong suit.

We soldiered on, and after a bit of wine, and some amazing red meat, we had a great time. But the service left quite a bit to be desired.
author: Christopher H.

description:
I've been to several Fogo De Chao locations, and this location didn't hold a torch to the others. 

Went here on Easter party of 7 everything was really good, but the side were small for such a large party, and they continued to bring the same cuts to our table. We tapped out because we were all over eating the same cuts. Not sure if they don't have all the same cuts of the other locations, but if they don't...they need too.
author: Mela C.

description:
Delicious! It's very expensive, but the quality of meat is pretty high.

The cheese bread is just as crack-like as everyone says.

Do order the cocktails.
Don't order appetizers - they are super expensive and a lot of them are the same thing that you can get at the extensive salad bar!!

Do try all the meats. 
Don't forget to ask for their selection. I was almost done eating and they started bringing out meats I hadn't tried yet!
author: Kerrie S.

description: It is an excellent Brazilian meat house, the meats are all good, the sides are excellent and the market bar is stocked full of fresh greens, cold cuts, cheese and some unique items that are all worth trying. The SF location can get plenty busy so do make a reservation and I recommend everyone who likes meat should give it a try.
author: Roger D.

description: Great meat orgy! Seriously, you get drunk they serve you so much fresh, tender, prime cuts of meat. It's all really good, but it's best to make this place a "drunch" or "linner" kind of place. Bring an appetite, there will be the best cuts of beef, pork, lamb and chicken you'll ever have.
author: Mark K.

description:
Being Brazilian I have high expectations for churrasco and this Fogo has thoroughly disappointed me. The market table has some very slim choices (veggies mostly) and only feijoada as a hot dish). I'm used to an abundant market table that should include some Brazilian comfort food like bacalhau or beef stew. In Brazil it includes sushi! 

The second disappointment was the cooking of the meats. I like mine medium rare, but everything came out well done even after repeatedly asking them to undercooked for us. Waste of meat really. 

Lastly, but most important, NO CHICKEN HEARTS?!?!? Huh? This is the only Fogo that doesn't have it?

Ok, I'll take my business to Espestus where u can find chicken hearts, medium rare meat and bountiful market table. Not to mention that it is a couple of bucks cheaper.
author: Joina L.

description:
So, my fiancé and I are on a low carb diet and we're tired of home cooking & decided to go to a Brazilian steak house. 

We checked Espetus and they had no tables and I remembered that there's Fogo de Chao and booked a table. We were so excited - salads and meats... woohooo! 

The server seemed a little sad we didn't order drink, got the coke order wrong and then pretty much just left us alone. Even when we asked for attention. 

We asked 3 unique individuals that we wanted bacon wrapped chicken and sausages.... didn't get any. And there were some cuts of meats that didn't make it to our corner of the restaurant. After 3 attempts and no attention we finally gave up. Paid the bill and left. 

The food we had was decent but that food with the service we got wasn't worth the money.
author: Wildeflower M.

description:
Perfect meats and poultry! The service was top-notch and they easily accommodated 7 of us. The Market Bar has a wide assortment of salads, cheeses, and imported meats.
Should I return to San Francisco, I'll visit again!
author: Steve F.

description:
One of my favorite Brazilian steak houses! I work around their area so when I saw them building it I was real excited. So I decided to book Valentine dinner here this year. Little did I know they gave a complimentary gift card for one free dinner with them!! 

The food here is just great, atmosphere is real classy and nice! Glad I came here for Valentine's Day and in my opinion I think this one is better than the one in Santana Row. I really enjoyed their rib eye while my gf enjoyed their lamb. Another really good meat was the bacon wrapped chicken Breast and their garlic steak. 

Can't wait to come back with the complimentary gift card.
author: Herman L.

description:
Ok, so this may not be a great review of the spot, as I am just reviewing the salad bar. A few days ago, my colleague and I went to lunch here around 12:30pm. We figured we'd check the place out, as it was right down the street from work. 

I was fascinated with the beautiful/modern decor and the salad bar, so I decided I wanted the salad bar for lunch. OMG, this was such a great move on my end. The salad bar, while small did have some great quality offerings! I went back twice to stock up! The artichoke hearts are fresh and plump, kale salad did not have overly chewy kale, and overall the produce seemed very fresh and clean.

I would not hesitate to come back here again for the salad bar itself.
author: Tracy C.

description:
Great atmosphere and the meats were good. The chicken were very dry. I stayed with red meat.
The price is great for all you can eat... The quality of meat was pretty good.
The salad bar was just ok. It didn't have much variety. I liked espetrus better for food and they has seafood.
I would go back if someone was paying.
author: Alison W.

description: BEST dining experience ever. Food was great, the servers were amazing and explained the meat they were serving. The Picanha Prime Sirloin is to die for. 5 stars for Tiago, Mahelly, and Stuart for being hilarious and so friendly! Definitely coming back soon!
author: Elise M.

description:
Mid bite into a slice of succulent, perfectly roasted leg of lamb, I found myself telling my fiance that my version of heaven would not be much different than being at Fogo de Chao that night. I admit it's a gluttonous thought, an obscene one even, but who among us does not find a night of delicious meats, fresh sides, and caipirinhas with your #1 girl a heavenly experience?  

Add on the hospitality of the gracious staff, and that experience gets exponentially better. We couldn't have gotten luckier to have a southern gentleman as our main server. 5/5 stars to him for complimenting this feast. 

My favorite is always the lamb. Fogo offers leg of lamb and lamb chops, and you can imagine they're dripping with juice and flavor. This meat is slightly smoky, slightly gamey, and encrusted in herbs and spices before it's slow roasted to decadent levels. Absolutely mouthwatering. They have an optional chimichurri that pairs nicely with it too, as well as with all the other meats.  

I originally heard about Fogo from celebrities and the like raving about the other locations across California, Nevada, and New York. But now you're hearing it from me, just a regular guy who's in love with his woman and his churrascaria: go to this place if you have an appetite for a fancy, indulgent meal. I can say that with confidence even in such a food capital like SF. 

Wash down those meats with some caipirinhas why don't you, or how about some tender heart of palm or fresh mozzarella to refresh your pallet at the Market Table? All of it is right here to satisfy your bottomless, perverted cravings.
author: AlexLovesLeila V.

description:
We were excited to try out Fogo de Chao as they had recently opened in SF, but i fear that I was rather disappointed considering the good reviews that seemed to be present. Our group of 3 couples (6) went to visit.

There are two main areas they seem to struggle with, the quality and type of meats as well as their staff. For this price bracket I expect you to do significantly better at both!

The staff issue began with the initial phone call to the venue. When calling, the person on the other end of the line simply stayed silent and then said hello. No introduction, highly unmotivated and not really helpful. Calling her out on this the person on the call indicated that they were sorry they weren't paying attention...!

On arrival we were seated but they seemed to be confused as when or how to guide us to the table. Once we arrived at our table the staff (who were genuinely nice) seemed to have no idea how to introduce themselves or the menu. It was the training that was the issue rather than the staff themselves.

We were given a super long introduction to the menu which was really fast, fall of pointless details and left everyone incredibly confused at what the server was trying to say. Considering we'd all been to a Brazilian BBQ before we already knew the drill and thankfully did not depend on the waitress. 

As we were preparing to get up to go to the market stand another waitress comes to the table and attempts to provide the exact same introduction. It seems the training was poor as her method seemed to be very similar to the previous waitress. We informed her that we had been given the intro and will be fine. To which started an evening of two waitresses tending to our table, miss communicating and not knowing who has what order (mainly for drinks). One would take a drink order, the other will come back instantly and ask drinks again. 

Regarding the food, the market stand had the basic setup of items, but presentation wise it did not really seem to inspire and had nothing complex or adventurous as I have seen in various Brazilian BBQs around the world.

The meat selection seems to have been done rather poorly and I would question the head chef's skill. The meats did not meet the quality or taste that the price bracket Fogo is trying to perform in. We were also pushed really heavily by the guys that had the chicken and less desirable items. It almost seemed like they did not care for what you wanted by wanted to push on you the lesser valuable items far too heavily for the kind of establishment they seemed to be aiming for.

On a positive note, the cocktails were fantastic, very well done, they tasted great and we went through quite the selection to which we were pleased with every one.

To conclude, Fogo de Chao is attempting to play in a price bracket that calls for much better food and much better service. I expect a lot more from them, they have a good venue and a great bar, now they need to really focus on their staff training (hosts, waiting staff and meat servers) as well as the food!

This is like a boxing fighter clearly attempting to fight above their weight and just got knocked out in the first round, you need to either go back to your weight class or get act together!

Will not return.
author: Shadi A.

description:
This place opened up recently and I wanted to check it out to compare it to Espetus, which is the other game in town as far as Brazilian steak houses go. Their prices are basically the same, so I expected the quality to be similar.

I was a bit underwhelmed, though. To put it plainly: Espetus is better in just about every way. Their meat is higher quality. They have more variety both in terms of the market table and the meat dishes. The service at Espetus is better and faster.

If I were rating this place based only on food quality vs. value, I'd probably give it 3 stars, because it was still solid. However, there are a few other things that I thought were kinda dumb where this place loses more points:
