1. The drinks are way over-priced ($15 for a cocktail). - 1/2 star
2. In a restaurant with a sitting capacity of 320 plus outdoor seating for 80, the men's bathroom only has 2 stalls and 1 urinal... in a restaurant that generally encourages stuffing yourself until you can barely walk. Really? - 1/2 star

So, yea, in case it wasn't clear, if you want to go to a high-end Brazilian steak house, go to Espetus instead.
author: Eugene A.

description:
I had a general good experience at this restaurant.  I came with a reservation and we were seated very quickly, they were even kind enough to let us switch tables when we wanted to be at a cozier corner table.

The meats and the salad bar were delicious, and we had waiters come by constantly with different cuts of meat.  The caipirinha's were also strong and delicious!  Would have considered coming back - HOWEVER, they charged my credit card TWICE so please beware!
author: Wendy Z.

description:
Really disappointed. Been to fogo in Houston, Boston, Vegas and now SF.  As you can see, pretty big fan of the place. 

However, SF was like going to a different restaurant. I had last gone to fogo Vegas last November and man was it a good time. Their carmelized pineapple old fashion were amazing...so amazing that I had 7 that night (thank you uber!) 

Fast track to SF fogo. Granted we walked in at 9 and they close at 10, but we still had a party of 9. The filet and ribeye were amazing, I would just wait for those. 

But what made this experience so different?  Well first they told us they made the wrong drinks so the right ones would be coming shortly. 30 min later the drinks came and they weren't even the right ones!  But at this point we'd been waiting so long we didn't want to send them back (at $15/pop!!!). And during that time the waiters while nice and attentive also managed to drop whole pieces of filet on not one, but two of our party.  And another waiter also sliced some beef right off the skewer onto another member. 

We got an apology for both the drinks and the fallen meats, but that was it. For $100/pp and a SF worker surcharge id hope to get the right drink and not to have food dropped on us.
author: A C.

description: Great service and delicious food. I definitely will be going back. Go on an empty stomach though
author: Vanessa S.

description: Awesome quality food and setting.  Staff could be a little more attentive when it gets busy. Would definitely come back for special occasions.
author: Roger E.

description: Came here last night with a group, and we had such a fun time! We made reservations, they had a cute bar so we got drinks before we were seated. (The wait to be seated was less than 5 minutes, no big deal). We were seated, the restaurant has great ambiance! The waiter came right away and explained how everything works.. the food was amazing!! Fresh, juicy, great variety! We had a very good time and will definitely come back.. the only reason I'm giving it a 4 star is the service at the end was a little slow and confusing.. but other than that! Go for it!
author: Daniella G.

description:
Absolutely loved this place. Our second time trying Brazilian BBQ and it was MINDBLOWING. Service was fantastic. Meat was very high quality.. oh, the ribeye and pikana ...
You won't be disappointed if you're willing to spend some money on a special night. Keep in mind it's not cheap, but in my opinion definitely worth the experience!
author: Alexandra T.

description:
My wife and 3 children visited the restaurant and having gone through some recent bad experiences at other Brazilian steakhouses we were pleasantly surprised. The service was very good. Bruna our waitress was superb and the service in general was very good.

My wife and I were concerned that the meat was going to be too salty from what we read in some reviews. This point is valid and some of the meats were indeed salty. This is due to the way Brazilians season their meats with coarse sea salt. The trick is to get the second slice of the cut and not the top slice. In general the meat is very tasty. 

Speak up they will listen! If you want a more rare cut tell them. If well done is your thing tell the servers they will listen to you.

My wife is from Brazil and I lived there with her for 15 years. Not every Rodizio is going to be perfect but I can honestly say we truly enjoyed it and will go back. Maybe next time it won't be the same but for today it was very satisfying and we finally got all of the cuts of meat promised!
author: Luis H.

description:
My husband & I went here to celebrate my birthday. We had reservations, but they were not prepared & we were left waiting while a larger group that had supposedly tried to change their reservations were all seated. Once seated, our table was decent & in a cozier area of the restaurant, which we liked.  As for our waiter he seemed nice enough, but hovered nearby a LOT, which was a bit uncomfortable.  We also had no idea what he was saying half the time & could barely understand him.  A bit awkward.

The food - meh. For the price paid for a meal, you'd expect the food to be delicious, or at least memorable. The salad bar area was ok - various cheeses & seasonal type salads/vegetables.  The meats were not great and weren't very flavorful - very chewy.  We've had better at other places, such as Texas de Brazil, which is what we were hoping this would have compared to. I would even rank Rodizio Grill (another Brazillian Steakhouse) over this one since they had better food, although worse atmosphere.  I don't think we'll be coming back here.
author: Karey B.

description: Great service. Food was excellent and fresh. Selection was extensive. I would only say that the salad and non meat selection was not as extensive as I have had in Brazil, but maybe my expectations are skewed. I was super happy with the meat selections here though. The filet was my favorite. Rib second favorite.
author: Kris F.

description:
Prices: $60 for dinner per person unlimited meat/salad bar. (Honestly? Real good deal) 

They definitely have great quality meat, and service! (Our server Michael rocked~)
The ambiance was just so perfect, it is definitely a place to take your date/ just pig out in a classy way/ have a group dinner. 

The Chocolate Molten Cake is to DIE for (if you love chocolate like me).
author: Moto B.

description:
Ok, here's the deal... I've been to several Fogos, and I also understand that this is a brand new spot (with new servers, cooks, gauchos, etc)... And because I'm familiar with the high Fogo standards, I was absolutely "under-whelmed" with our first experience. 
We loved the decor and ambience, and appreciated the spacing between tables (different from most restaurants in SF). The hosts and servers were all very friendly and we understand the reasoning for an over-abundance of servers and employees being trained (we're not knocking that). We enjoyed the hospitality & friendliness of servers. 
The disappointment was the food. The salad bar was missing a variety of items we'd normally find at other Fogos. I was actually shocked with the lack of options. (The chicken salad is always amazing). The greater surprise was the Feijoada and rice. The rice was not good at all, and the feijoada was nothing more than beans with a few extra pork cuts (definitely not our typical Brazilian classic). But other than the beans and rice, there were no other hot plates, other than the meats and mashed potatoes served at the table. 
As far as meats, most Fogos have a little pamphlet explaining the different types of cuts, with 16-18 different cuts. This Fogo didn't provide the pamphlet and only about 9-10 cuts. We requested the rib eye and lamb chops, but received neither. After requesting the beef ribs, we did receive some and it was delicious!
The Parmesan pork was way too dry, and bacon-wrapped-mignon was way way way too salty and it didn't taste like mignon (more like the leftover meats, disguised as "mignon"... Lol). The picanha was perfect. Yum! The leg of lamb was disgusting! Yuck!! (And we were craving the lamb chops so bad.. Oh well). The bacon-wrapped chicken was good, but the other chicken didn't taste like the normal beer-marinated chicken we enjoy at Fogo. Overall, we were disappointed with the lack of options and the poor quality of the meats. The cheese breads and polenta were great. We ordered a caipirinha and server said the premium was a dollar more. They actually charged two dollars more ($17 total). Oh well... What's an extra dollar when your bill is already almost $200. 
In conclusion, we trust the Fogo brand and will definitely come back in the future. Because this store is only a week old, it's understandable that the food quality (and variety) is still not up to par. It definitely was not worth the nearly $200 bill (party of two). As far as value goes, in SF, Espetus is a much better option for the next few weeks/months. But I have faith that Fogo will soon up their game, and I will also increase my Yelp stars!
author: JonJon W.

description: My sister and I tried this restaurant fornthe first time in San Diego. So this was our 2nd time eating at this restaurant but we saw a MAJOR difference. The meats at the SF location was so soft and tender. Nothing was dry or bland. The Bay Area has the best meat selection. I just wished they had a better bread selection but other than that everything was superb! They definitely know how to cook their meats perfectly. Will definitely be going back there again.
author: Charlene C.

description:
Great service. Food OK to good.

Went there on weeknights twice with a big group. They are very accommodating, big groups can book not too long in advance, and their service is timely and effective.

Their meat is good, although not too sure where it comes from. I particularly enjoyed the ribeye, top sirloin and lamb chops. Tried they chicken hearts, but not too much of a fan.

They had a good Côtes du Rhône (French wine) with a decent price tag compared to other wines; good deal!

Their buffet is alright; I particularly enjoy the marinated mushrooms (shiitake), pickled pearl onions and onions salad. Their tartness and acidity complement the fattiness of the meat very well.
author: Bruno P.

description:
I carry the same sentiments as many who reviewed, pricey, deceptive up selling of alcohol and sparkling/bottled water and AYCE meats being overly salty, tough or chewy for the majority, not to mention that the higher cuts of meat never being brought over and you never being told you have to ask! 

Ate here with my husband for my belated b-day yesterday during lunch. We're gone to the location in Santana Row a few times, which we enjoyed but being that the drive is long, we decided to see how this location stacked up, in spite of the many lack luster reviews. Upon arriving, we were quickly greeted and seated. Offered the choice of waters (always specify Tap) and decided we were just going to take a break from meat and went with the Market Salad bar for $18 pp. Although, there were some good options at the bar such as the fresh fruits; grapefruit and orange salad, fresh papaya and pineapple slices, I was so disappointed by the chicken salad as it was nothing like the delicious one at the Santana Row location, with shredded moist chicken and apples. The cheese bread was also lukewarm and stale tasting 2/3 times we asked for a fresh batch. It took the third time to finally get it hot and we were already full by then.  I also needed to comment that I noticed this location was serving grilled pineapple after having been told by the other location that they didn't serve that there at all. What a bummer!

-Anyway, food was just 3 stars
-service was a good 4.5 stars
-the quality of food for the price about 3.5 stars

I gave 3 stars overall (more like 3.5 if it was an option) due the convenient location and attentive service we were given. I did get to choose a completely complimentary dessert for my b-day! I chose the Papaya Creme de Casis, which was absolutely delicious, light and refreshing, not to mention full of digestive enzymes on a decorated plate! ;) 

Minus a star for not making the chicken salad right and another minus for stale cheese bread. 

No valet or validated parking, which would have been nice. Overall, I would stick to the location in Santa Clara and LA!
author: Petra S.

description:
I came here for a surprise birthday party last weekend. Since we came in a party, there was a prix fix menu for $99 a person (before tax and tip). This included 3 hours at the table, unlimited meat, salad bar, two drinks a person and dessert. 

Pros:
1. Salad bar was great. Their candied bacon is honestly some of the best I've ever had.
2. Their dessert was really delicious. The cheesecake was scrumptious. 
3. Ambiance: very swanky place. Very clean, the staff was super attentive/friendly. Its also a very large establishment. Great for large groups.

Cons: 
1. All the cuts of meat, even the higher grade ones, were all on the drier/chewier side. I love a great steak, and I did not have anything at the restaurant that I could not make better myself honestly. I asked for every cut rare, and a lot of them were medium at best. There was a chicken Parmesan cut that was horrendously dry. The only meat I can say that was good were the sausages, and my lamb. (I say mine because I got a great cut of lamb, meanwhile my fiance got a super dry and tough piece). 

2. the drinks: we were allowed 2 drinks each. I assumed this meant any cocktail off the menu, but when I asked the waiter, he looked puzzled and kept trying to offer their caipirinhas. So we had two. After two drinks, both my fiance and I felt incredibly hungover, and we are not light drinkers. I feel like the booze used in the drinks was shitty quality. 


TLDR: basically, for the price, I would much rather go to a great steakhouse, and have a wonderful cut of steak instead. I didn't think this was the price. Yes it is a ton of food, but the quality wasn't anything impeccable.
author: Anastasiya V.

description:
Added one star for the service. 
Came here with the bf as he's really excited to try it. 

The food is overly salty, period. Every cut of the meat, I feel like someone poured salt all over, it's just not good. It made me full quickly, maybe that's the point. 

The meats themselves are not good quality, filet mignon tasted chewy and rubbery. The best cut is probably the rib eye, but even then it was too too salty. 

For a high end place, I found the salad bar very lacking, even if the restaurant is known for AYCE meats.

Lastly the price / value ratio is just not there, $180 for two people for dinner, each only had 1 drink (milk + coffee) and a dessert (molten chocolate cake, which was actually the surprising highlight of the meal). For that money you could easily have 2x fancy steak meals!!! 

Won't be returning.
author: Wei Z.

description: Our waitress didn't seem to care much about us. Had to ask multiple times for things and drinks were not refilled often enough, meaning once all night. Gave us free dessert because of how poorly we were served. 2-3 cuts of meat were amazing, the rest, mediocre. Way over priced for service and quality.
author: Benjamin A.

description: This place is pretty decent. The service and servers are very prompt and polite. If you're a meat lover you should and this to your restaurant rotation.
author: Gordon J.

description:
Came in here on a Wednesday night around 630 pm.  Had reservations, so was seated immediately after check-in.  

Service was exceptional, but the food was very meh. 

Their market bar only had two hot items - rice and beans.  

Their meats were good, definitely not great.  Like previous Yelpers have said, you'll need to request the beef ribs.  To me, a majority of their meats were a bit over cooked.  

No grilled pineapple.

Don't know if it's because their newly opened and still working out the details, but as a chain, I would assume the learning curve would be substantially shorter.  

Probably wouldn't come back.  I'd say if you're in the mood for a Brazilian steakhouse, I'd recommend going to Espetus which is a 5-10 min drive away on Market St.  Street parking would be easier as well.
author: Daniel M.

description: Finally!!! I prefer Fogo over Espetus, which has been in SF for years. In my opinion, I think Fogo's meats are better. Yes it is pricier, but there is a reason for that. Anything lamb is good. Stay away from chicken. I love how they can provide medium rare cuts too. Don't forget about the brazillian bread! I can bring a zip lock bag to just fill those up to take home :P
author: Vanessa K.

description:
I've only been to one other Brazilian steakhouse my entire life, and all I can remember from that first time was how I wanted to go again because let's face it--I love meat.

I booked a reservation here for my boyfriend's birthday, just the two of us. We walked in and I let them know I had a reservation (which I made online, and I let them know we were celebrating his birthday), and right when they saw that they immediately greeted my boyfriend "happy birthday." HOW SWEET!

It doesn't stop there. The service was absolutely impeccable! The two people who waited our table made sure we had everything we needed for a great dinner. They were extremely attentive without hovering. And since it was my boyfriend's birthday, they gave us the dessert he ordered--on the house! 

The food? Absolutely amazing. Despite all the different kinds of meats, they're all so flavorful and delicious that you can still tell them apart. Because let's face it--sometimes when you have too much meat, they all start tasting the same. Not in their case! All the food was amazing, and the market table had plenty of options as well. They also served fresh popovers directly to your table.
-----
TL; DR: From the amazing service to the delicious food, LOVED IT! I'll definitely come back again... probably after a few more pay cycles. Heh.
author: Bettina L.

description:
Came here today for a birthday party and had a great time . The service was really good . The restaurant was nice and new and very spacious.


I had the beef ribs was good
I had the rib eye was good
There salami was good 
Lamb chops were good
Top sirloin was ok
I wish they had chicken hearts and gizzards
Squash soup was good
Cheesy bread was excellent 

The key lime pie was ok . 

Great addition to the area
author: DOM d.

description: I came to a company party, and the service was excellent. The food was great, drinks were awesome. They have a salad bar where it's all you can eat. (Open salad bar.) this was my first time here and I enjoyed the environment, their meats were excellent, you have the choice to accept or not take the kinds of meats they serve. I had found out two of my friends worked here so I was surprised. I've all this place is pretty great. I would recommend people and friends or family to come here.
author: Rhoddavie M.

description: The food is great and the place is snazzy.  If you like meat then you are close to heaven here.   It's much better than Espetus and I used to love that place.   They have more selection, like lamb chops!!! Yum.  It's on the pricey side we $150 for two with tip included in that (my son had two bottles of coke, I drank H2O).
author: Sam P.

description:
A group of us came here for my sister's bday the other night. We made reservations and got seated right away. The restaurant seemed pretty empty but maybe because it was a rainy Sunday night?

One of the first things we noticed was the market bar. It's much smaller here and the variety was just okay.. (I'm comparing them to Espetus which has way way way more variety and everything at Espetus' market bar is frikkkkin deadly!!) We noticed that It was mostly all cold dishes here and none of them really stood out.. Except the bacon lol and the butternut squash soup!!! I also really enjoyed the mashed potatoes they brought to us lol. A few of us felt that the meats were on the salty side.. 

Also, I remember us sitting there for approx 10-15 minutes waiting for the meat to come around. Any meat! Nada. They flocked to our table once we got there and then just stopped coming around? All of our cards were still giving the green! There was also supposedly a big party going on but hellooo that doesn't mean you forget about everyone else. & Thinking back, it was annoying and kind of frustrating! We even asked for specific dishes (that we saw from a distance but never made it to our table) and they said they would send it out but never did..  

I feel like we didn't exactly get our moneys worth.. Fogo de Chao was just alright in my opinion. But to be fair, I've been spoiled.. so nothing beats the steakhouses in Brasil. As far as Brazilian Steakhouses out here go.. Espetus is best. I really wanted to love this place but I can't say that I did. I hope my sister did though because it costed a clean fortune!
author: Michelle L.

description: The food here is 5 stars but service was lacking when I ate here with wife on Friday, 9/8. We arrived on time for our 7:30pm reservation and were seated after a short wait.  The hostess seated us in a corner of the restaurant facing the corner wall; I asked our waiter to switch us to another table and he acknowledged it is a weird spot and said he will check to see if there is another table in the main dining room.  I noticed there were a few available tables for two; but somehow we waited another 20+ minutes before the waiter came back to tell us that there were no available tables.  By that time it was well past 8pm so we decided to just stay put instead of going somewhere else. The overall dining experience was quite miserable as I was facing a corner wall and constantly interrupted by the servers talking over my shoulder to ask if I wanted the meat they were bringing.
author: Jason Y.

description:
Won't be back even if somebody else pays. 

Liked---the meat you can get from rare to medium.  Many of these spots overcook the cuts of red meat.
Beautiful interior. It's classy and contemporary.  When you step inside you feel like it is a destination.
Perfectly done green beans and asparagus at the buffet.

Didn't like---had to ask for rib eye and beef ribs.
Server was unctuous and condescending.
People who mention the up selling are spot on. It made me cringe. 
Drinks are much too expensive.
3 salad plates in a row that were not clean. A film of grease on all 3 and a hair stuck in the grease on the last one. The person handing them out was great about it, she kept a poker face and just kept reaching into the stack until she got a clean one.

So why not two stars?  Hey, I'm not trying to get the place shut down, I just think they should take care of their customers a little better.  We dropped a month's rent (in Brisbane) here so I got a right. After-all, I could have had five bad experiences at lesser establishments for the same money.
author: Miss F.

description: Been to other churascarias and this was a real disappointment.  Service was very uneven.  Had to ask for things more than once.  Potatoes came to the table stone cold.  At 5 pm they were out of bread, except for cheese bread which I do like.  Wasn't  crazy about the sides offered.   Meat was good but as the restaurant  filled the gouchos didn't  come around like they should.  Considering the price and service we won't be back.
author: Ann A.

description:
Good salad at but that's not the reason you should go. It's still new but the food lacked a bit of flavor: lamb, filet and bacon wrapped shrimp. The bacon with brown sugar at the salad bar actually tastes better. Mix drinks can be skipped and focus on wine and traditional drink mix. The food quality is a bit behind Espetus. 
Location will lend itself for a good spot for drinks after work but I'll wait for reviews of improved food quality.
author: Cesar B.

description: Solid Brazilian churrascaria with a great selection of meats and foods. Beautiful decor and ambience. Service is efficient and friendly. My favorite meat of the night was the beef rib, very tender and flavorful. Highly recommended.
author: Ray T.

description:
It's my first time here and this place is amazing. Our server Cameron was very helpful and amazing with us. He took really good care of us, and made sure that we had everything we wanted. The quality of the meat were amazing! I recommend ordering the lamb chops and legs, they were really juicy and cooked well. The salad bar was really good, they have a good selection of cheese. 

Hmmm, I like this place and I would come over again anytime
author: Bashaar H.

description:
I was very disappointed with the taste of meat at this restaurant. While I am not a big meat/steak eater - my two grown sons love steaks and they were both as disappointed. Normally we go to Espetus so we are familiar with the Brazillian steakhouse experience.

So what was disappointing about Fogo De Chao?

1. All meat tasted the same- garlic was lightly seasoned

2. The one thing I enjoyed was the garlic mashed potatoes but they are served in small dishes. After asking for another order and receiving one additional small dish for a table of 5 - I decided my dining experience was over.

3. No grilled shrimp or chicken like Espetus

4. Super small warm sides buffet selection 

The two stars was for the atmosphere and the attentive service from our server.

I will not be back to this franchise.
author: Chryl R.

description: 5 star worthy. Food was amazing. Drinks were amazing. Great atmosphere. Will def be back.
author: Manny. D.

description:
I've been waiting for the day when Fogo finally opens in SF!! When I first moved here 6 years ago, I tried out Espetus, thinking it would be about the same as Fogo.  Yuck. A cheap imitation.  Fogo is the real deal.  Great cuts of meat, impeccable service, salad bar that is so fresh I could dine on that alone (but I won't!). My only gripe is that the cheese bread is not the delicious, tender goodness that I remember it being.  The bread balls we had the other night were the taste and texture of cardboard.  Small complaint, though, since people come here for the meat - which was AMAZING. The Picanha is the best and what I'm limiting myself to from here on out.

The price is not bad either for SF, considering it's "all you can eat." $39.95 for lunch and $59.95 for dinner.
author: B. Y.

description: Outstanding service did not get a chance to sample all cuts of meat disappointed in that lamb chops sausage. Chicken hearts were very good. Salad bar always outstanding
author: Mr V M.

description:
I'm excited for this new location! The staff (as you can see from other reviews) is amazing. Kept me in delicious meats during the whole experience and was always polite and accommodating. 

As another yelper mentioned, often in city you find incredibly packed restaurants where one table is almost on top of the other, but here that is not the case. If you want a romantic meal for two where someone isn't basically a part of your conversation - this is the place. Of course in my experience, I went with a work group and they have several options for private dining areas to eat and (begrudgingly) work.

I don't know why anyone would complain about the parking....it is San Francisco - take a Lyft. It is the safe option anyway because you're going to want to drink all their alcoholic treats!

Make sure to wear your stretchy pants and enjoy!
author: Ashley W.

description: This is the best restaurant I ever been to in my life...service , food, drinks, and atmosphere the  caipirinha are to die for. I will return as much as I possibly can. Great job guys
author: Manuel S.

description: One of the worst meals of my life, I have no idea how these guys even stay in business.... All the cuts of meats were dry and no flavor at all, some cuts also had a weird smell... I had some high hopes for this place but unfortunately I will not be back again.
author: P E.

description: Got horrible food poisoning here back in June, probably from the garlic steak which tasted off at the time. I haven't been able to eat beef since.
author: John L.

description:
This was our first visit, and we knew what to expect. Like the concept of having your meat sliced tableside, with a variety to choose from. We tried most everything, except the chicken. The rack of lamb was definitely a stand out.

But every slice of meat was way too salty. I like my sodium, a lot, but this was excessive for my taste. Not sure if this was attributed to our medium-rare cut request or not. We both had trouble sleeping that night, and I even felt like I was radiating from the inside the next day.

We'll try again down the road. Hopefully by then enough "cut the salt" comments will have been received.
author: Ron F.

description:
I've been wanting to go here since they opened and I finally got that chance. I am pleased to say that this place met my expectations. They're known for their meats but their salad bar was enough to fill my entire stomach as a meal itself. 

Great wine selection to pair with their endless selection of tasty meat. The service is great and they did a nice job with the ambiance of the location (it used to be a Chevy's, so yes it's safe to say the upgrade is welcomed). I will definitely be back once my food digests.
author: Bradley C.

description: My first visit to Fogo de Chao in Austin, TX was so impressive, I couldn't wait to take my husband here in San Francisco for his first time. Unfortunately, 90% of our meats were served medium-well to well done, despite us asking for medium rare. The flavors weren't anything special and the service was inconsistent. We had 4-5 people coming around with meat all at the same time, and at others we were left wondering if they'd run out as nobody was in sight. The red/green color tabs seemed to have no effect. We were offered meat when red, then passed by when we had green up. I was extremely disappointed in the quality for the price.
author: Amanda A.

description:
Was disappointed to find out that this location cooks the meat on an electrical grill rather than an open charcoal fire.  One can definitely tell the difference.  

Also - meat was good but not great.  Whole Foods probably sells higher quality beef.

Service was attentive and good.
author: Boris P.

description:
Great filet and rib eye! Seasoning and cook were right on, including that occasionally crunchy sear on the outside.

Most of the staff are fast, responsive and professional. Whoever helped our table of 5 to a fantastic lunch today - our treat after a long year of helping difficult customers at work - thank you.

And the sliced citrus with mint salad in winter was fresh and juicy. We're coming back for that.
author: Dennis W.

description:
If you like meat this place is for you. I've been to a number of Brazilian places and this is hands down the best.  Service is beyond anything I've experienced and considering it's a two day old place I'd say it that's impressive. 

Strongly recommend if you want a nice place. Price to quality is good but it's not an inexpensive meal.
author: Dan Q.

description:
Well, there simply aren't that many choices for a Brazilian Steakhouse in San Francisco.  It's this or Espetus, and this is far better.

The quality of the meat still isn't as good as a quality steakhouse, but the variety and quantity of the meat (along with the drinks) make up for it on the days a single steak just won't cut it.
author: Buddha B.

description:
Fogo de Chão delivers excellent steak right to your table, impeccable service and a solid salad bar selection that includes adroitly prepared vegetables and a charcuterie in case you can't get enough meat. 

Particular stand outs were anything made of a cow that came on a skewer and the arugula salad -- steak and arugula are such a wonderful pairing. 

One sour note: the Irish coffee I had with my dessert was appalling. The coffee itself was watery and lacked flavor, and it had a scoop of what tasted like Kool Whip plopped on top with the finesse of a lobbed basketball. 

So if you do order dessert, skip the coffee. Better yet, skip them both and leave more room for steak.
author: Aaron Y.

description: Never have I ever experienced an all you can eat style restaurant like this... and I highly recommend that everyone has this amazing experience in their lives. You begin with the market bar buffet that includes cold cut meats, salads, cheese, and more. There also is soup and rice near the bar. Afterwards, when you are ready for meat, you flip your circle placard so it's green and that allows servers to know you would like meat. Once the card is green, servers carrying meat approach and offer you these meats. It's fun because they carve the meat right in front of you if you decide to have some. The experience was really fun and once I flipped my card, I swear I was soon surrounded by servers carrying many delicious meats. Some of my favorites would include the sirloin cap, fillet mignon, and their special steak (I forgot what it's called). When we went, it was my parents' anniversary and they brought out a complimentary dessert- chocolate molten cake with vanilla ice cream- because of this occasion. If you ever come on an occasion, make sure to let the servers know!! The dessert was super good and helped end the night on such a great note. I definitely hope to come back again and I would not miss the beef short ribs.
author: Lauren L.

description:
Brought my boyfriend to celebrate his new job! Easy to find and excellent service. Everyone was super attentive and the food speaks for it self. The salad and cheese  options were amazing. The bread is gluten free ( not that I have allergy) but it was a pleasant surrpise. 

Great ambiance, romantic setting...definitely a date night option...and you don't have to get super dressed. 

If you don't like buffets because you feel like you don't get your money's worth, you won't feel that way by the end of this meal.
author: Marcus L.

description: Came here for my son's graduation dinner. We made reservations and they seated is fairly quick. My family all opted to do the "all you can eat". The meat servers were certainly plentiful and came frequently. My family's favorite was the rib eye. My son found the lamb to be in the tough side and the pork on the dry side.  The cheese bread, fried plantains were delicious. I, on the other hand ordered the sea bass dinner. Sadly, after watching my entire family finish their dinner, I still hadn't seen anything come my way. I finally flagged one of the servers and he confessed that he screwed up and it would take another 15 minutes for my fish to come. A couple of minutes later, he comes with a sea bass plate which was barely warm which I decided not to return because the rest of my family was done. Once we got our check, I was overcharged for the market bar which I did not partake in. Dissatisfied with this whole experience, I approached Stuart, the manager who wanted to correct the mistake. He was very pleasant as apologetic for the error and discounted our check. It wasn't the experience I had hoped but we all mistakes and I am willing to give them another try.
author: Prizilla C.

description:
Nice, more 'upscale' interior than I expected. 
So, you get your table, then go over to the 'salad bar' which has more than just salad. An assortment of special veggies are there as well.
Then back to your table, and let the feasting begin.... 
The meat here is really exceptional. After our first serving there was very little wait on any of the meats. Lamb chops, filet mignon, sirloin, leg of lamb, chicken legs, sausage, pork and beef ribs, and several other meats
author: Bella Z.

description: We were visiting for weekend and made reservations for diner. Staff were very friendly, food was fabulous and drinks awesome.  A nice wine selection and dessert.
author: BridgitteandJustin A.

description: Stopped by what used to be Chevys on the way home from work. We ordered 2 drinks. Because we didnt say anything about happy hour (which it was) we were charged full price ($32) then told they could not void our transaction and charge us HH price. I walk by there everyday and never stop in and tell all my colleagues and clientsto not bother eating or drinking there.
author: Rebecca E.

description: Every cut of meat was cooked to perfection and delicious. We tried their brunch and had a great experience. Can't wait to come back!
author: lorena D.

description: We had a reservation 2h after peak time and still we had to wait 15 min. The staff were apologetic and courteous. The meat and buffet was equal or sub-par to the other Fogo de Chao that I have been in. The atmosphere is nice but be prepared to be part of the crowd. For the money ($60 per person, $30 per child, plus extras; our 7yo had to pay) it was a decent experience, we just had better ones in the past.
author: Mr. T.

description: Went with family over Thanksgiving. Very nice atmosphere. Nice and friendly service. They have a unique and delicious salad bar that includes different types of feshwada (sp). The choices of meat vary and are all extremely succulent and delicious!
author: Kimberly S.

description:
As a pretense- I was here for restaurant week, and although I wasn't able to taste the ribeye or filet, the rest of the meat was delicious. This was my first experience at a Brazilian Steakhouse, but I am guaranteed to be back soon - we received a voucher for a complimentary lunch or dinner! 

Don't fill up on the salad bar- the waiters are very attentive and will surely leave you with as much meat as you'd like. I believe some of the better meat comes at the end of the meal. And don't be afraid to ask for the cuts you like.
author: Annie A.

description: This was a great place.  I went here for a friend's birthday and the service, selection and ambiance were all wonderful.  Great place, especially celebrating a special occasion!
author: a f.

description: This place is the best, always consistent and always delicious. My wife and I went there just the other night and I forgot to write a review. She is absolutely amazing on yelp and I hope one day to reach her status of 200+ followers. She has been my inspiration to start yelping more because you know what, people need to know where they are spending their money and if you don't know already, yelp can help.
author: P K.

description:
Always wanted to try a Brazilian Steakhouse. Kristen our server was great, she explained the best way to experience it for the first time. You get a little coaster to flip over to signal if you want more meats, or if you'll pass. She suggested keeping it red while we have some meat already, and then flipping it green occasionally when we see something good we want to try. We got at least 1 or 2 of everything. There was so much to choose from. Amazing selection. Prime rib, filet mignon wrapped in bacon, crispy chicken drumsticks, pork sausage, chicken hearts (I never had these before & I figured, "why the hell not, I'll try it now" and they were pretty interesting. Chewy, but it tastes like chicken), lamb chops, pork ribs, and a bunch more that I cannot even remember. It was an amazing experience to have these guys just walk out every 5-10 mins passing by and bringing us a variety of meats.
The price is pretty reasonable. About $60 a person. We went for dinner. Included in that is a salad bar with cold cuts, potato salad, croutons, veggies, cheeses, and other stuff. They also bring out polenta, mashed potatoes, and fried bananas to your table. My fiancé and I loved the mashed potatoes & polenta. The bananas were a bit too sweet to be eaten as a side dish with the meats in my opinion, they were better a palate refresher at the end of the meal.
All of the servers were friendly. Kristen offered great service &  all the guys who ran out with meats were helpful & would even ask us if we wanted them to bring out a new prime rib that was cooked more to our liking.
We know the capirinha is the Brazilian cocktail, so we had to try it. I had the strawberry capirinha &  my fiancé tried the classic, premium capirinha. They were delicious, a little refreshing. Although, we were already pretty buzzed, we drank a bit before we got here.
We were so stuffed, but we still wanted to try a dessert. We had the turtle cheesecake. It was good. Crust was standard, a little crumbly. Topped with caramel, chocolate & nuts. There could've been more nuts & chocolate. It was mostly a caramel cheesecake.
We came to the city to check out the SFMOMA, which is just a couple blocks down. We took BART and got off at Montgomery. It wasn't too far of a walk, definitely beats trying to find parking.
My recommendation, make reservations ahead of time, and take it easy. Like Kristen suggested to me, "It's a marathon, not a sprint". Just enjoy the experience. I'd definitely come back.
author: Racquel Q.

description: I love a Brazilian steakhouse, so Fogo de Chao did not disappoint me. The atmosphere of the restaurant is upscale and felt luxurious with the glass fireplace enclosed bar right when you walk in. The variations of meat were little in number (about 7-10 for the weekday I went) but each cut of meat was delicious. This place might beat my other favorite (Espetus) lol.
author: Ricardo R.

description:
Fogo de Chão recently opened downtown near SF MoMA and the Convention Center to a meat-filled fanfare.  I will admit that I had never had much interest in the Brazilian Steakhouse "Churrasco" experience because it always felt a bit gimicky to me, but I was, ahem, game, to try Fogo de Chão on the eve of their grand opening.  What I didn't realize is that I was entering into an orgiastic meat frenzy that, at times, was overwhelming, but once I figured out that there was a method to the sumptuous madness, I was able to let the experience flow over me.  You will see that it's easy to get overwhelmed here because there is a constant buzz of overtly hospitable servers carrying skewers of sizzling, juicy, dripping grilled meats throughout the restaurant and immediately upon sitting you are tempted by offerings of a bevy of side dishes. I was confused. There was no explanation of the night's specials (because there aren't any), and there was no attitude-laden hipster server trying to sell you over priced wine. Instead, these professional meat handlers ready to push you into the deep end of a pool of grilled delights.   You see, what wasn't clear to me is that the "Full Churrasco Experience" includes sides AND the meat entrees AND the Market Table (which is basically the best salad bar you'll ever see). Wow. Where's the diving board?

OK, so here's what you do: order a glass of wine (I suggest a bold Malbec), have a few sips, take a 20151222_181049breath and the hand of your lovely dining partner and then head on over to the Market Table. Circle around it a few times before you put anything on your plate as you will be "ooohhhing and aaaahhhhing" the multitude of offerings as you decide what you want.

Then come back to your table to enjoy your plateful of yumminess, but 20151222_184356pay attention to the little table cards you were given because if they are green side up it means it is a GO! for meat and they will keep stopping by your table asking you if want some of this steak or that steak or this pork or that pork wrapped in bacon or this chicken also wrapped in bacon or this lamb chop or, wait, I think there is one more type of steak!

It's just so hard to say NO to the charming meat-carrying Latin men! Then the eating endorphines kick in, the lips get greasy, the tongue craves a Malbec wash-down, its a furious fervor of meaty craziness to the point where you simply neglect to reach over and turn that damn green coaster over to RED for STOP! STOP THE MEAT! If only for a moment, so I can check my pulse and have four words with my dining companion, whom I have neglected until now because I have been distracted by the beautiful Sirens of meat, calling me, the weary and hungry sailor, to shore, where I crash onto the rocks in a meat-induced coma...

To that, I would suggest that this type of dining restaurant is actually NOT ideal for a romantic night out - there is just way too much stimuli that makes this experience unique that I don't think it makes for an intimate conversation on Date Night. I DO think it is a wonderful and special experience that is well suited for a dinner party of 4-8 who want to be loud and social and pleasantly distracted. I also think it makes for a great business dinner with an important client you wish to impress, but I don't think its perfectly suited for a family dinner or impressing the new love of your life, who may end up feeling jealous that you love your steak more than her.

OK, so, now fast for two days, make a reservation, and head over to Fogo de Chao, and let the experience overwhelm you in wonderful ways....
author: Joel B.

description: Fogo de Chao. I never thought I'd see the day I give this 5 star restaurant 1 star. I live in Chicago and I eat at this restaurant quite frequently and the service is absolutely amazing, the food taste spectacular, and they make sure your plate is always full if your card is flipped green. However, this isn't the great service I experienced in San Francisco. I reserved a table for 9:30 PM, arrived 5 minutes early, didn't get seated until about 9:50PM. Once we got seated we got the regular "have you been here before..." chat. There after, I immediately flipped my card green because that's what I always do. I didn't get steak for about 5 minutes. I finally got my first piece and I couldn't wait. It was medium rare, but for some reason this medium rare wasn't as cooked as Chicago's. It was very bloody, and although the steak was hot, it wasn't so tasty. After that piece I didn't see another for around 8 minutes. I got medium and it wasn't bloody at all, but too cooked. Taste was better though. After that, I only saw one more guy, and that was it for steak. Later I was asked if I wanted anything and I said "yes, STEAK PLEASE, Lamb chops. Where is everything?" It wasn't till about 20 minutes into the restaurant they brought out the Cheese bread, and fried bananas and so on. And that was only because I reminded them too. Service was sadly and very unfortunately terrible. I must have caught them on their bad night. This restaurant ruined my dinner Saturday night in San Fransisco.
author: Billal M.

description:
SF Fogo de Chao is definitely my favorite churrasqueiro in the bay area.  Anyone that knows me, know that I love my meat and Fogo de Chao (FdC) does not disappoint.  

If I had written this review last month, I would've given it 5 stars.  But the last two times service has started to gone down a bit.  

Last Saturday (AUG 6), our server came by and was initially extremely friendly.  But when he asked us what experience we were there for we told him we were there for the "Taste of Brazil" which is $39/pp (but you don't get all the cuts of meat: no Beef Ribs, Rib Eye, Filet Mignon, Bacon-Wrapped Filet Mignon, or Lamb Chops - only one we cared about was the Rib Eye, but for ~$15/pp it was ok).  He asked us what we wanted to drink and we asked for a little time to look at the wine menu.  After a couple minutes we were ready to order our wine.  10 minutes later, no server.  Another server came by and asked if we had been helped, since we still had all the menus on the table (w/them closed - what we think is the standard tell tell that you're ready to order), we told her that someone did come by.  She said great and left.  She came by about 7 minutes later and our menus hadn't moved... needless to say the other guy never came back.  She asked if she could get us our drinks, so we ordered with her.  A couple minutes later she comes back to tell us our wine was sold out.  We picked another bottle.  After she had come back, uncorked and poured our wine and we had time to have 2-3 sips... our original waiter finally came back to check on us.  We were soooo thankful for the other server.  She was not only friendly, but also on her game ( and we weren't even her table).

Typically the various meat selections come out on a steady basis.  The last two times it was much slower.  And last Saturday (our non rib eye night), the rib eye only came by one time (in the 1.5 hrs we were there), which I guess is good for us, since we couldn't have any.  We typically are in and out within 45 mins... but with the wait to order our wine and the lack of meat coming out, our visit was prolonged by a full 45 mins!!

Also, FdC was the only churrasqueiro in the bay area that continually asked us how we liked our meat.  Which we completely appreciated since I like my meat more on the rare side.  We only had one guy asked us how we liked our meat on Saturday night.. almost everything else came out medium.  I even tried to ask for rare from one of the guys, not sure if he didn't hear me, but that piece turned out medium too.  

Despite last Saturday's #fail, I still give FdC 4 stars.  Hopefully that experience was not indicative of how FdC intends on operating moving forward.  Hopefully it was just a bad day for everyone.  I have faith it'll be better in the future.  I look forward to writing an updated review.

Happy eating!
author: Tina F.

description: My company was just there the food was outstanding I will be taking my kids with me the next time I go if I can get a great deal
author: Donald G.

description: Amazing, authentic and excellent service. Everyone knows Fogo is where you go when you're hungry for a big dinner but now you can also enjoy their light Gaucho lunch option - just the Market Bar - for $18 and walk away without a food coma! Love this place!
author: Charlotte J.

description:
Went for new years eve and it was really disappointing, we did not like the service at all, the meat was served too quick and the waitresses were too much in a rush for us to leave.
Very different than the previous times.
Not worth the price
author: Kerly L.

description: Food was great, service was fine, BUT-  those drink prices cost them a star...
author: Ray J.

description:
We came here to celebrate our anniversary. My wife and I have visited Brazil many times and eaten at the Fogo de Chao in Sao Paulo several times, so we know what good churrascaria is. We arrived early for our reservation at 7pm and were greeted nicely by Eliani. She definitely was friendly, upbeat, and made us feel welcomed. She also didn't mind me practicing my Portuguese with her. We decided to check out the bar before dinner. There is only one drink to order before Brazilian barbecue and that's caipirinha. Marcus and John John make the best caipirinhas ever. Sure, they're expensive, but so what? They were delicious - spot on! Again, the staff made us feel welcome and valued. 

The dinner was exactly what I expected it to be. The filet mignon was the highlight of the meal and I requested it several times. I would have liked to have a greater selection, but didn't feel cheated at all. I always decline the chicken hearts and lamb. By the time the beef ribs came by, I was already full. I did miss the mozzarella balls on the fire and the pineapple though. As a rule, I don't visit the Market Table for anything other than rice and beans. 

All that said, we had a wonderful time. We valet parked with no issues, Eric and Bruna were terrific servers, Juliano thanked us for coming in, and we will definitely be back. By the way, we live 2-3 hours away depending on traffic.
author: Alfredo R.

description: Delicious food, manager and staff were great! Especially Blake attended to us very well!
author: Charles T.

description: just came here for brunch today to celebrate my husband's birthday since I have a promo card good for a free Sunday brunch - this is hubby's first time for Brazilian style steakhouse and he really enjoyed it (his fav are the top sirloin and prime and mine is the leg of lamb)- our server is very attentive (hubby said even more so then House of Prime Rib) and recommend a nice red to go with our meal - and we shared a complimentary dessert - we really wanted a creme brûlée but they were out so we got the flan - this this the second time I've been here that they are out of creme brûlée and our reservation was 11:30am!! If the creme brûlée is so popular and always run out early you'd think they would make more to accommodate the customers
author: Mia C.

description: This is a generic chain clawing for status. We showed up at 6pm without a reservation. The place was not close to full but we were turned away because we did not have a reservation.
author: Thomas S.

description: Salad was average, fly on tomato, not a good sign.  For the price very over priced for what you get.  A place if you are hungry will be full is about the most I can say.  Staff is attentive but I would not go back.
author: Richard B.

description: I been at the location down in downtown Los Angeles when I was there for my brother's graduation.  My mom and I decided to try the location up here in San Francisco since it is near our house also new location.  They seem to be short staff of waiters and the waiter seemed overworked. We Had to ask another waiter to exchange a cocktail that we had ordered because the drink was disappointing. The gauchos were extremely attentive to our table, one seemed to like blondes because he came over even when we had flipped our disk to red and offered more meat.  We were seated near the market table, so we didn't have to go far for the salads and other menu items. All the food was amazing, I enjoyed myself. We came last night during the special price this weekend celebrating the Olympics in Rio! I would highly recommend dinning here to celebrate special occassions because it is highly interactive with the gauchos and fun. The place offers a modern stylish decor and we observed all attire from athletic to cocktail.
author: Alix J.

description: Go to this place hungry! I have tried couple other places but this one has the best food and they keep on bringing delicious cuts of meats out. Also have fresh vegetables and cheese on the 'market table' but honestly, I'll skip the veggies next time to save room for the meat :)
author: Umer M.

description: The best salad bar in SF. For some reason, I always have a problem with my bill, never in my favor of course. The flan is also great but expensive. Between the overcharging and expensive deserts, the stock looks like a buy to me.
author: C N.

description: Holy cow. Literally. I had been looking forward to coming to Fogo de Chao with a big group of co-workers and intentionally had a plain salad for lunch so I could thoroughly enjoy the experience. Having been to Fogo de Chao in LA once before, I knew what I was up against.  Challenge accepted. With a group of 12, we were all eager to get to the meat after sitting down.  A few of us made the conciliatory effort to get some vegetables in before going all out on meat, and I was one of those "weirdos" who chose to throw in some sauteed zucchini, green salad, and marinated mushrooms on my plate before turning my coaster from red to green.  In starting with the meat pile, they first brought the Picanha aka Top Sirloin.  Throughout the entire meal, this was definitely my favorite, and I took almost every opportunity to get a few shavings when it came around.  I also tried the Fraldinha which was hit or miss; some pieces that were closer to being medium/medium rare were delicious, while other parts of it were way too overcooked.  I also really enjoyed the Linguica pork sausages and thought they were a great way to shake up the beef pile.  All in all, I wasn't really sure what to expect from Fogo de Chao, but it was actually a lot of fun and an incredibly filling experience.  I'd love to come back with a big group again!
author: Lisa I.

description:
excellent service, 60 bucks for all you can eat, and salad bar!

the garlic sirloin was one of my faves, and the bacon wrapped filet.


Everything was good, but the end cuts are a little salty. so be careful for that. The servers were so professional.  You get what you pay for.
author: Toby I.

description:
Good food, great service. Floor manager was very welcoming. Guy slicing the roast beef was cool, greeters were also. Did not expect to get full that quick. Take it easy on the market bar, and save some room for the meats. Also had the Carmelized pineapple old fashioned, good size! 
It's not a place to go for a casual dinner, but for special occasions. Good ambience , good flow of service. Fully satisfied.
author: Chris C.

description: Delicious food and the ambiance was great. Would definitely recommend this place to people. It is on the pricey side but it's well worth it.
author: Vernon B.

description:
Went here for a birthday party. We had a big table for 15 people and were all able to sit together so that was nice. They have a full bar and the decor is nice. Surprised that they made Chevy's into this place. 

As for the food, the meats were plentiful. I didn't load up on much else so I could eat all the meat. The staff was great although they stopped coming around our table once some people started slowing down with their eating so we had to request. The meats were a little on the salty side, but as one of the other reviews said, get a piece from the middle. 

Overall good service and good food. It's a little pricey but it is all you can eat and I'm sure I ate my weight in meat last night so I got my money's worth.
author: Eddie K.

description: Great place for entertaining...food delivered right to you and a good salad bar!
author: Travis K.

description: Everything was amazing especially the lamb dishes.  Stay away from carbs and fill up on the good stuff to get your $$$ worth.  I can't say enough good things about how fresh everything tasted.  I'll definitely be back; however, I will not order alcohol.  A Tito's martini was almost $20.  Screw that.  Go during happy hour and order a drink at the bar and take it to the table with you.
author: Austin C.

description: I've been to several Fogo de Chao's - my inlaws love this place! The one in SJ is way better. The service is better and the selection of meat is wider and better. The polenta fries at this place was not so great. boooo... I probably won't come back - feels super touristy.
author: Monica S.

description: Two of my friends my girlfriend and I went there last night. The quality of the cuts was excellent and the salad bar was tasty and fresh. I enjoyed filet mignon, lamb and a garlic-based sirloin the most. The customer service was top-notch. There were people wearing hats and just dressed too informally and that did bring down the quality of the atmosphere to me. With a couple of drinks, coffee, and tip we spent 400 USD. It was  a great experience.
author: Daniel S.

description: Way too expensive ($60) for a buffet. The online menu said there would be chicken and shrimp, but there was only beef. There should be two prices: one for the buffet and another for the buffet and meat brought to the table.
author: Coleen D.

description: I very rarely leave reviews on Yelp unless something far exceeds expectations or falls short of even the most reasonable expectations.  In this case, Fogo de Chao was a huge let down.  My wife, son and myself were visiting San Francisco and staying at the St Regis which was within walking distance to the restaurant.  I have never eaten at Fogo de Chao but have always wanted to, I love Brazilian food and also love good beef.  We started with the salad bar, chose a few items, none of which were anything spectacular or anywhere near being worth the value of the meal but I figured the meats would make up for that.  The meats started making their rounds and it was bad. Chewy, dry and flavorless.  The cuts were no better than even the lowest grade cuts you can find such as round steak or top sirloin. I know good beef and this is not good beef.  Anyone that thinks these guys have good quality beef is not very experienced in choosing great steak.  To top it off, they overcharge for the meal, not just a little either.  A single meal of this quality should max out at $30 a plate and even that would be high.  If you know your steak, stay away and just go buy a good Top loin, top blade or tenderloin somewhere else and for less money too.
author: Mister H.

description: Totally not racist! I've been to this place multiple times with different crowds over the years. The treatment is about the same, I'm pleased to say. They won't stare at you in disgust the second you walk in if you're African-American, or with darker skinned people in general. They don't stare at you for being "too loud". Everyone is very friendly and genuine. Very diverse staff. Most of them are at least bilingual! They really pay attention to every customer regardless of race. This area can feel very pretentious especially for a person of colour. Not to worry here!! As long as you're wearing shoes and a shirt, this place makes you feel very welcome. They walk you through the menu because it's a different style than what Americans are used to, (Food is delicious), so your table will be comfortable. The rudest people you'll meet here are rude patrons if any - but as long as you're a paying customer, you'll get respect here.
author: Racist Or Nah? ?.

description: My first time going here and for dinner, and my experience was immaculate. Meat was cooked perfectly. They have a good selection of meats and cuts for you( bout 10 total) as well as a salad bar that contains things like salad, fruit, cheese, veggies, salmon, prosciutto etc. If they don't currently carry the wellness of steak you prefer they will bring it to you. There was a few hiccups from the gauchos that gave us more than we asked for but only once or twice. Everything was professional and perfect for me.  I'd recommend to save your appetite for the steaks and get minimal on the salad bar to get the most bang for your buck if you choose to. But anyways, great atmosphere, great good. Very delicious. Valet parking $20 found on a one way street where the entrance is left of the street.
author: Tim K.

description: Great Service!! Everything was great. Came in starving left so full. Desert was the best. Great place too
author: Evelyn A.

description:
This was one of the worst restaurant experiences I've had. With all the hype, the bf and I decided to try it...
1) super commercial feeling, cards that you flip over when you want service or dont that also tell you to enter to win for a trip...
2) atmosphere was like "Sizzlers" but even worse because you expected it to be classy
    the buffet table had some decent things on it, but they weren't special, and nothing paired well it was just awkward because we thought there would be some sort of menu options
3) the meat....16 kinds, but very low quality. Maybe one was flavorful (a garlic meat) and I didn't have to chew it 30 times to swallow it. The bacon wrapped filet mignon was the toughest thing I've put in my mouth in a while (that's what she said). It just wasn't good, so I didn't eat much.
4) The service was strange. Always interruptions and the meat would get cold fast. Drinks (wine and cocktail) were served after we had already been to the buffet and gotten asked if we wanted 4 different meats...a little late. Also mashed potato, polenta fries and banana were served almost at the end of the meal randomly. They were COLD.
5) Not worth the price AT ALL. Much rather go to a nice steak restaurant.

I'm sure we would've walked out of the restaurant mid-dining experience if we could.
author: Stella H.

description: I took my whole family to dinner (13 people) and it was terrible experience. everyone was complaining because the meat servers ignored half the party, so we didn't get to try everything (which is the whole point of a Brazilian steakhouse). And when we did get some meat, it was dry, flavorless, and BURNED!!! Like they used some old meat...We go to a lot of Brazilian places so we know what quality means. The reason for the one star is for the waiter, for being kind and just a great waiter. A waste of nearly 1000 dollars, don't trust the promotional pictures.
author: Bella S.

description: Love Brazilian steakhouses. Came here with my boyfriend to check it out when they had opened up. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The food was great, and really glad that they have valet parking
author: Shanzay H.

description: My Family and I eat here on San Francisco this weekend and all the food was delicious. Service on point, I love the sweet plantain bring memories from my country. If you like meat this is the place to go.
author: Emma B.

description: Had a great experience here. The service is beyond what I expected. They constantly bring you the meat you like, I had a lot of ribeye and filet mignon. The mashed potato and the cheese balls are very delicious. Highly recommend grabbing a nice dinner here.
author: Omar Q.

description: My husband and I celebrated our 1 year anniversary here the other evening and it was great! We had reservations for 6:30 but were super early and they were able to sit us right away. The food and service was great! We will definitely come back!
author: Erica H.

description: I'm not one to give a bad rating just by going once to a restaurant. However, after my second time eating here, I really have no idea what the hype is about. There is not quality to the meat that is served, the variety of it is scarce, and the salad bar could offer more options. Please do yourself a favor and go to an actual Brazilian restaurant and you'll agree. The service was satisfying which is why they get a couple of stars.
author: Damien V.

description: What a fun experience! Different sliced meats from a skewer (Filet mignon, chicken, garlic pepper steak, ribs-were the best that I ever had!). The salad bar was very good also. The wait staff was excellent (Kenny kept asking us if we wanted to try different meats, and I think is name was Will, polite and attentive! Yes, lunch was pricey but so worth it!!  Definitely will come back again!
author: Karen F.

description: Even worse than I recall the last time I ate at another link of this crap chain. It reminds me of an old joke. Two people were captured and asked whether they wanted Death or Fogo de Chao. The first guy chose Fogo and his friend had to watch him get poisoned by unlimited low quality meat products and shit sides. The second guy said oh, I'll choose death. Then the captor said, "ok, but first Fogo."
author: Jeremy G.

description: Been to a few all over the US and this one keeps great high standards. My server Bruna is so polite and on top of everything. Made my meal a pleasant and relaxing one. Mahelly came by and checked on me as well as Ryan. They run a wonderful restaurant. Definitely coming back again on this business trip. Well done!!
author: Ryan T.

description:
Came to check this place out recently since its new to San Francisco.
We waited around for about 25 min , not to bad for a friday night.
We got a good seat with an outside view of night walkers roaming the city, it's kinda dark inside so it was a nice romantic vibe.
The meat is good ,Salad bar and sides are kind of boring but , I feel like 50+ per person is a bit much, but its a good experience if you have never been.
author: Stefani P.

description: Pricey and loud restaurant; skimpy cocktails with mostly ice gone in two sips cost $15.  Lousy, inattentive service.  Too bad as restaurant looks good, decor is chic and it's a great place for carnivores.
author: Robin M.

description: The service was good but does not live up to the hype.
author: Justin W.

description: The food is totally worth the price. They keep it coming until you're about to burst! The fried bananas are amazing and of course all the meats are juicy and live up to the expectation. I went for a company dinner but it's the perfect place for a romantic date or a family dinner.
author: Daniela L.

description: Thought I would bring my grandmother to her first ever brazilian restaurant experience for her 76 birthday in a city where she has never experienced a meal before. When I made the reservation it ask if there are any special requests? I noted that it was her birthday and a placecard with "happy birthday" could be at the table on arrival, no placecard. We had to ask for water refills twice, ask for the plates to be removed and my grandmother ask three different waitresses for a paper napkin before she got one. My husband ordered a draft beer and never recieved it. I could have taken her to Applebee's or chili's and recieved better service. The meats were great and came very often, bacon wrapped chicken was very dry. My 11 year old mentioned Rodizio's in Ft. Collins Colorado was hands down a way better experience. Horrible service can ruin a good meal. Never will I ever.....
author: A V.

description: Same price as Espetus, but Espetus is so much better (and has way more meat variety/selection.)  Fogo was fine for what it was, and I hope it was just new opening kinks, but we didn't walk out wowed- more full and sleepy.
author: Clarissa P.

description: Excellent service.  Top notch meat.  Love the House Special beef (Piccaio).  Even though it was a late weeknight visit, it still an A+ all-around.
author: S. Sean B.

description: The staff is very friendly and accommodating.  Why two stars?  Well, this is the second time we have been to Fogo de Chao within the last two months. The first time we visited, they had a promotion for a complimentary dinner.  Combine that with an email promotion for $25 off - it definitely warranted the second visit.  Both times we have eaten there, the "premium" meat:  rib eye, filet, etc.  were essentially non-existent.  My son requested medium to medium well rib eye and after the chicken thighs, sausage, bottom sirloin, bacon wrapped chicken, garlic sirloin (all rare to medium rare and flavorless) came the extra rare rib eye.  The courteous man with the rib eye came by one time - and was then seen with the lesser cuts of meat. After the family was completely full, the manager came by. To her credit she did check on us - it was totally after the fact.  Even though we got a whopping $85 off our bill - I was not happy with the total bill given the flavorless, lower cuts of meat. Suffice it to say, we won't be back.  I can spend far less money for better food.
author: Donna S.

description:
Amazing
A must do even if you do not think you are a meat lover!!!

I am almost a vegetarian
but my goodness


Delicious!
Fun
Adventurous
The salad bar is good enough if you don't like meat.

Great Ambience
author: Susan C.

description:
It was our first night in San Francisco and we were excited to visit our favorite Fogo De Chao restaurant. 
Living in Los Angeles we frequent that location often. We have even visited the south beach location 2 months ago. 
The restaurant was pretty and decor was nice.
There were many open tables - yet we were given the table by the kitchen ( worst table in the house ) noisy and the wait staff stands there and you feel like you are being watched your whole dining experience ...advice ( do not accept that table).
So we go to the unlimited salad bar first after placing our drink order- large plates could not be found ... Had to ask 2 people to find them . The rice on the hot bar was close to empty not a good sign . 
We go back to our table and 2 napkins were missing not to mention a whole place setting .
We turn the card to green as we were ready for the meats. Most of the meat was rare..we asked several people for meat that was medium - very hard to find . My sons Shirley temple was not delivered to the table with the other drinks had to ask and realized the waiter had forgotten to bring it. Since we frequent other locations we realized at that point the incredible rolls plantains and mashed potatoes were missing ... We asked the waiter and he immediately apologized. We received the missing items right away...( note if this had been our first experience we would not have known this was missing ). The sad part was that the rolls were cold and hard ... ( they are supposed to be warm and soft) . We returned them 3x and realized they would not get them right- disappointing .
The waiter seemed bothered that we weren't satisfied which made our experience uncomfortable .
Now on to the meats... Maybe and I am being nice we were offered 4 things: chicken with bacon, filet mignon, spare ribs and Sausage - the portions they sliced were molecular in comparison to other locations ... Chicken and bacon were circulated so much yet the other meats could not be found ... I had 2 waiters ask me if there was a particular cut I was waiting for since my card was still green ... Well yes- where were the lamb chops, the ribeye all the other meats ??
Every location I have been to - I have had to physically turn my card over as there is too much meat ... I was actually starving at this location as where was the food-it was ridiculous 
The manager Ryan was the best thing this restaurant had going for it as he listened to all my complaints apologized and got me some medium cooked lamb chops but at that point I honestly was annoyed and our experience was already ruined. My husband had filled up on all the chicken and sausage as he was starving  and there were really very little meats to choose from- shocking 
The dessert - ice cream was not high quality and my husband thought their cheesecake was awful.
Bathroom- beautiful but dirty and no toilet paper in my stall so clearly it was not being kept up on.
I started laughing at this point as I never thought the bathroom would be part of this review.
The manager Ryan did comp my meal and my husbands meal and provided us a gift card to use when we get back to LA- we did not know this was there 5th day open although it shouldn't have mattered. I recommend staying away from this location till they get up to speed as this was truly a very disappointing experience .
I am giving it 2 stars as one for the beautiful decor and the other for Ryan the manager doing the right thing as good customer service is proven only when there is an issue .
author: Alyssa B.

description: Henry and Leo were our favorites! The most friendliest servers hands down! Henry gave my mom and son great tips and recommendations. Leo made sure to get us an order of their special steak sauces. We even found out from Henry that it was Leo's birthday. Thank you both again so much for making our trip divine!!!
author: Shea R.

description:
Fogo de chão is all you can expect from a Brazilian Steakhouse, including -- and this may chock some readers -- the absence of much seasoning. A good Brazilian steak is prepared with coarse salt and, maybe, pepper. Anyway, you can add anything you want afterwards but the idea is to taste the meat, that has to be of excellent quality. The "salad bar" has more than salads and you will find the big "palmitos"(heart of palm), and other Brazilian delicacies.
Unfortunately, the "farofa" (another tradicional Brazilian dish) is bad: it doesn't taste homemade. They should serve a fresh "farofa de ovo" that is the most popular, but only Brazilians would miss this. As for the service, if you are Brazilian, expect to talk to friendly hosts and servers, as we all do (:-).
TIP1: MAKE A RESERVATION! You can do it on-line. You will not have to wait and you will start eating immediately from the salad bar, that includes a small feijoada and some warm plates.
TIP2: Tell the waiter what is your favorite meat and they will bring it to you more often. That's how we do it, the Brazilian way.
author: Thais O.

description: I am going 5 star with this update!    Now that I have been to happy hour many times and had full dining service, I have to say this is one of my favorite places in town.   The food and service are consistently top notch.   The bartenders are fantastic and experts at crafting  perfect Brazilian cocktails.
author: Kate R.

description:
To celebrate a belated birthday,  we dined at Fogo de chao.  Arrived at 11:30 am.  Promptly greeted by the hostess and waited about 3 minutes for table.  The  3 of us ordered the full churrasco experience which came along with the market table buffet.   One co-worker did not eat the meat part.   At the market table, fresh quality cold dishes such as asparagus,  artichoke hearts, mushrooms,  tomatoes, and beets were artfully displayed.  Another co-worker enjoyed the butternut squash soup. At our table, we enjoyed delicious lamb chops, leg of lamb,  bacon wrapped filet mignon,  rib eye steak,  chicken drum stick,  and sausage on skewers . We had to turn over the coaster card  to red so the food would stop coming.   Loved  the warm little bread that reminds me of popovers.   Garlic mash potato, polenta fries, and caramelized bananas came with the meal.  Shared the key lime pie which was light and perfect to end our meal.  Servers and wait staff were excellent!     

Full churrasco experience $36.95 
Market Table only $18
author: E. C.

description: The food and service were both outstanding.  The meat servers were very attentive and the manager was very friendly visiting our table twice to see if everything arrived at the proper temperature and to see how we were doing.  The potatoes were delivered while we were at the market place so they were a bit cold when we started on the meat. The manager offered to bring us hot potatoes. The market place had a large variety of items with the chicken salad and Caesar salad being excellent. But you do not want to fill up on the sides because the meats are wonderful. The lamb chops were excellent (the leg of lamb a bit salty) and the steaks were wonderful. Overall it was a fun and delicious meal.
author: Patti V.

description: Pretty bad service for a place that charges up to a hundred bucks a meal. Half the night they failed to give me even a glass of water despite multiple requests. Midway through the meal they just stopped serving meat too, even though we all had a green thingy on the table. They just don't care - your server and all the meat people just disappear. I managed to get one glass of wine out of them in 3 hours. The second glass of wine I ordered never arrived. I was there for someone's birthday and didn't want to make a scene, but I'm not coming back to that place on my own accord again. Compare that with Espetus - every time I go there, they actually care and provide an excellent service.
author: Ivan B.

description:
As a brazilian, I can say this place is really good! It's been a few time that I'm not in Brazil so it was a very good way to taste brazilian meat (picanha and fraldinha) and drink a very good caipirinha. 
I have to say that Fogo de Chão in Brazil is way better, more types of meat and bigger salad bar, but this was fair enough for 43 dolars (no tips no tax) all-you-can-eat.
author: Thiago G.

description: Came here last night with a huge party for a friend's birthday. The service was great and I thought it was pretty awesome how they separated the alcohol and pre-fixed menu bill since it makes it easier to calculate for a group of 45. Now, onto the meat. I really enjoyed the meat varieties and how tender it was, but it seems like they literally rubbed it in salt. I guess they thought it's better to be salty than bland? Anyways, we had mash potatoes and polenta fries as side dishes, and oh man.... the polenta fries were amazing!
author: Cheryl P.

description: This review is for the server named Santos. I'm picky about my meat; I only eat rare to medium rare cuts. Anything more cooked than that is a waste of stomach space.
