I was getting ignored by all the servers after they realized how picky I was, but Santos continued to bring by cuts at the exact rare-ness I like. Thank you for your service and dedication!
author: Jasmine L.

description:
I went for lunch today. Salad/buffet bar was fantastic, huge variety of vegetables, salads and meats. The cuts of meat served to the table were very good and with options in terms of how rare or well done the meat was cooked.


I would have given 5 stars but was never offered grilled pineapple or beef ribs and as I was leaving the restaurant I saw both items being served to other tables.

I tipped 22% and drank only ice water, I was $52 out the door.  Not the place to go if you want an inexpensive lunch but given the quality and quantity of quality food certainly a fair price.

Great group of people working today, service was excellent making the overall experience very enjoyable. I would visit this location again and recommend.

I have spent conciderable time in Brazil and while not quite as good as a nice churrascaria in São Paulo, for State side this place is good.
author: Mark P.

description: This place is unforgettable. The food is nothing short of spectacular. The service is beyond great. I can't wait to go back. Bring your appetite because you will definitely get your money's worth here. The only reasons I didn't give it 5 stars is the parking is not good and the waiter did not bring the tea we requested after dinner. Other than that this restaurant is recommendable on all counts!
author: Res J.

description: Phenomenal service, amazing variety of high quality meats, and a salad bar to die for. This location was refreshing after spending the majority of my FDC experiences at the Beverly Hills location (nightmare parking, snootie celebs, & paparazzi) Our waiters Alfredo, Sara, & Stewart were the bomb dot com. My new favorite location!
author: Dominique S.

description:
Ah! who forgot this place used to be the old Chevys haha. Great experience! Customer Service was great! Just come with an empty stomach and a big appetite and you'll walk out so satisfied that you can't even walk!

Don't spoil yourself with the appetizers and salad bar. I do suggest getting some of your veggies in since you'll be consuming majority meat. 

Salmon and cheese wins my heart at the salad bar and the house meats were definitely my favorite. Make sure to let your cutter how you like your meat. You can't go to a steak house without trying rare and medium rare, thats where all the flavor is!

Drinks were great! My recommendations are Premium Caipirinha(very refreshing) and the Old Fashion Pineapple

Dessert: Tres Leches Cake!!!!!! I've tried a bit of each cake, key lime, chocolate, cheesecake. I ended up eating 3/4 of the giangantic trea leches cake, but stop myself realizing i'll probably regret it afterwards.
author: Michael L.

description: This is far better than Espetus and finally I don't need to drive to San Jose anymore to get my caipirinha fix.   Downside: no baby changing tables in the men's or women's bathrooms.  Meanwhile - I counted 11 kids of diaper size in the dining room while I was there.  -1 star for that.
author: Aaron r.

description: I brought my husband here for his birthday. Everything was amazing! The best Brazilian churrascaria I've experienced to date. Top notch service, impressive bar for the sides, and everything was sooooo tasty. My favorites meats were the top sirloin, lamb medallions, and filet mignon. Hubby also really enjoyed the prime rib and lamb lollipops. And the drinks! And the dessert! I kept thinking all evening how they managed to always bring out every meat cooked to perfection. Good thing our evening date continued with a little stroll around another destination after dinner--I was stuffed at the end of it all. The food was definitely plentiful and oh, so delicious. I had been wanting to go here since they opened this location in 2015, and am so happy we finally put it on the calendar. The decor also makes an impact from the moment you walk in and all throughout dinner. All of the servers and gauchos were superb, and the manager also came around to check in with us. Thanks, Stewart/Stuart (sp?), for my husband's birthday dessert on the house, and letting the kitchen know to surprise him with an extra dressed up dessert plate. What a lovely gesture that delighted us. You and all of the staff made our evening so special. We will definitely be back.
author: Julie L.

description: My family and I had dinner here while visiting San Francisco.  The restaurant is absolutely beautiful. The customer service and food were beyond good.  There was an excellent selection of meats, all of which were cooked to perfection, the bacon wrapped filet and the top sirloin were our favorites.  The market table had a spread of delicious sides.  It was a bit pricey, but totally worth it.  We will definitely come back the next time we are in the city.
author: Samantha M.

description: If you love steaka, lamb chops, sasuage, and booze then this is a must for you. It is a bit pricy but is all you can eat and worth the experience. If order straight from the menu be prepare to wait a bit because it is crowded.
author: Jonathan C.

description: Came to this place twice already it is such an amazing experience. Happy hour is the best time to show. Recommended by my friend Magaly and the place is great. The drinks are so good one is never enough. Great  for meat eaters. Such a friendly staff would most defiantly comeback again. Thanks to Magaly for recommending this cool restaurant.
author: Aldo G.

description: My husband surprised me for our anniversary and took me here for my first time. The service was over the top and the food was amazing. The manager came over frequently to check in and offered us a complimentary dessert for our anniversary. We will definitely be coming back!
author: Ashley P.

description: This location of Fogo de chão sucks. I've been in several Brazilian steak houses and this on doesn't worth you time. I had a reservation and still had to wait at first for the front desk person, then I had to wait some more for the table to be ready. The waiters are not friendly at all. The meat always came raw or burned. They charged $20 for the valet parking even though the valet guy didn't even move my car nor stood there watching it. If you must go to Fogo de chão, go to te San José location, that one is awesome.
author: Leonardo F.

description:
My husband and I dined at this restaurant with our 2 kids and our friend who was visiting from Brazil.  We decided to bring along the kids even thought they are not meat eaters since the website states on the pricing page that children ages 6 through 12 are half price.  Our kids eat like birds, but for the chance of the experience we were willing to pay $15 per child for them to eat basically nothing.  The waiter told us that the kids were half price.  

The 3 adults went for the full experience.  The market table vegetables, fruits and cheeses were fresh and healthy.  The picanha was delicious.  I found the other meats to be chewy and salty -- I would skip all the other meats except the picanha.  

When the bill arrived we were surprised to see the full-price market table dinners for the kids.  I assumed it was a mistake and told our waiter that we had been charged full price for the kids.  He said "yes, they are full price if you get the market table."  I responded that my daughter ate an apple and slice of pineapple and my son had one plate of vegetables.  The website clearly states on the pricing page that children ages 6-12 are half-price (no caveat listed for market table).  Also, the waiter told us the kids would be half price.  He did not state that they would only be half-price if they ordered the full experience.  I voiced my concerns to the waiter and he just said "I'm sorry but that is our policy."  I was ready to write a negative yelp review, but decided it would be better to talk to the restaurant first -- I don't want to blame the entire restaurant on what could have been the mistake of a new waiter.  I know this is a new location so I figured the waiters may not know all the rules.  

I e-mailed the restaurant and received zero response.  If you decide to go to this restaurant, just leave the kids at home.
author: Amanda H.

description: I've been to Espetus a couple of times in SF and Vegas so figured this will be the same. Boy was I wrong! The format is definitely the same but the quality of food is way above Espetus. The market bar items are all fresh and don't look like they've been sitting around forever. The cuts of meat are high quality and delicious. For lunch, they have the option of market bar + one meat of your choice about half the price which I think is the way to go, especially if you've been to a churrascaria before and don't need the full experience.
author: Reza E.

description: I dined during a Sunday dinner over the holiday. Felt like the meat and buffet selection at the time was okay. Everything tasted good and I liked the private booth area I sat in.
author: Kristen T.

description: Incredibly friendly and attentive staff. Delicious meats, sides (grilled bananas were incredible), and salads. The desserts were the best part though. Highly recommend the chocolate lava cake, creme brûlée, and strawberry cream. Come hungry!
author: Mary S.

description: Great food great service. Dinner is just a bit expensive for what you get $60.00 and drinks are also over priced. Lunch would be a killer steal though $30.00
author: Jeff C.

description: I had dinner here last night with 13 other guests.  The staff, bartender and waiters were very nice and came by often!  This is the 2nd Brazilian steakhouse I've dined at this year and already this is my favorite.  The food was incredible and even though the meal was a bit pricey at $69/person it was worth every cent!  The meat was delicious and came often...(I stopped counting after the 8th one).  The salad bar was delicious and the complimentary cheese bread on the table was to die for.   Several in our party wanted their meat well done (not everyone's perfect) :) and they were served just as quickly as those who wanted rare/medium rare.  The place is very upscale and would be appropriate for a date night or a special occasion treat!  My personal favorite was the fillet mignon and the beef ribs....  (mouth watering)!  I can't wait to go back!
author: Angela P.

description: My boyfriend said that 3 stars was too generous. This was my first experience at a Brazilian restaurant and I thought the food was really good and the atmosphere was upscale. Unfortunately I would not recommend this restaurant because of the incredibly poor service we had received. The cane to our table at first but we never saw her again. I had to ask all separate employees for our water and check, then they brought the side dishes (garlic mashed potatoes and bananas) out towards the end of our meal. I'm glad I now got to experience the Brazilian cuisine and atmosphere of the restaurant but I would recommend the other one locally in San Francisco
author: Shianne P.

description: The service was amazing, but the food not so much. The meats were OK, nothing fancy about it, which was disappointing. Some of the meats were really dry or super bloody. I honestly won't be coming back. It's not worth paying 60 bucks for.
author: Maylene M.

description: I've been to a couple of Fogo de Chao's around the country and it's usually one of my favorite places to eat.  This location though was surprisingly bad.  As a steakhouse, this franchise is known for have amazing cuts of meat.  Most of the meats at this location were poorly cooked.  One of the cuts my guest had (she requested a medium-well slice) was completely uncooked on one side and just flooded her plate with blood and juices.  The cuts I received tended to be chewy and dry.  The meats at this location are bad, not just in comparison to other Fogo De Chao's, but just in comparison to even a basic steak house.  The sides are great though, and most of the staff was great (except the hostess that didn't show up for 5 minutes to seat anyone).  All in all, the company needs to fix this location, and I recommend people get a steak elsewhere.
author: Scott P.

description:
I've been to this chain and several like it in Houston and kinda knew what to expect. Was surprised that they really had a limited selection of meats for a $60 buy in (a couple of types of beef, lamb, chicken, and sausages). NO shrimp, bacon wrapped filets, pork, etc. like they served at the Houston Brazilian steakhouses. All in all pretty underwhelming.

Garlic steak was pretty good but most of the rest of the meats tasted the same. Wines and desserts were well overpriced as well so we skipped on them. Service was good and folks brought meat around when you flipped the indicator.

My guess is they get a good business clientele w/ expense accounts and being near Moscone center so charging too much, providing a limited choice of meats, and overpriced drinks works well enough that you don't mind having too many repeat customers. 

When I think of some of the amazing meals I've experienced at a similar price-point to this one, it really becomes clear that this place is nothing even remotely special.
author: Ross J.

description: Never ceases to amaze me. Came here for lunch with my co-workers. Great cuts as always, selection on point. It's Fogo after all
author: Luis C.

description: Great service! Go there for the experiences by the food. It's a great place to take a date. It's AYCE. :)
author: Hong T.

description: Wow. Just wow. I couldn't for like 3 days after our dinner here. The reason: I ate every damn thing that came to the table like 3 times. So good.
author: Jesse V.

description:
Buffet, meats, sides, service, desserts, are all tops!  Wish the cocktails and wines were more affordable, however.  

The servers and Manager were all very helpful and very friendly and hospitable.  We were given a great comfortable table for our two handicapped companions.

Wonderful experience.  I was there at lunchtime and I was very pleasantly surprised with the whole experience which, by the way, was not new to me.  I definitely want to go back soon.
author: Emily G.

description: Terrible experience.  There is no service whatsoever.  Food was comparable to Sizzler, yet the bill for 2 was $200 (we had wine, beer, and dessert).  Will not be returning.
author: Sean O.

description: Great restaurant, delicious food.  The key is to ask for the servers to bring you the meat that you want to try and the good  cuts. The only thing I missed was the dessert.  Will definitely go back.
author: Andrea M.

description: Great service! We went at an off hour (barely 4:00), so we're not expecting the salad bar to be fully stocked, all the meats to be available, or attentive staff. We had excellent service, the food was fantastic, and as hard as it is to skip the salad bar and the bread on the table, the pão de queijo is totally worth it!
author: sarah m.

description: This restaurant is amazing! If it was a skyscraper, the ratings would be over the roof! They have very good food! If I were to go here I would be very happy! For proof: I cut into a steak and saw it was cooked well (looked at the color of the sear) and it was very tender when I sliced into it! Our server Rebecca was also wonderful! It is a very brilliant restaurant and I recommend it highly, (shoutout to Mahelly for support on the review idea! :P) Try it and tell me what you think! I would love to hear your opinion. - JJ
author: Cece C.

description: Bread- good, bananas came near end of meal, meats pretty good, salad bar lacking, soup lacking, decent meal but does not hold a candle to Texas De Brazil.
author: Dan J.

description: I tried Fogo de Chao several times in the past. And I really like the food and salad bar. This location was as good as others. I strongly recommend
author: Sara K.

description: This place was extraordinary and experience you have to see Gaucho dress waiters coming around cutting you tender succulent pieces of meat you can have everything sirloin filet mignon lamb even chicken gizzards this is a once in a lifetime place you have to visit I highly recommend it great for couple groups fabulous salad bar you have to eat your roughage because it is a lot of protein very decadent
author: James F.

description: I was craving  meat and rhis was the right place. The rest was fantastic too.  A very nice birthday meal
author: Susan G.

description: The best customer service I've ever had. They've accommodated our party of 9 plus 2 kids. Food was amazing! My nephew fell asleep at the table because of food coma, and the staff put two chairs together and a table cloth to lay him down while my sister could enjoy the rest of the night! I would definitely come again!
author: Amy S.

description:
Great food, halfway decent service, and a waitstaff that tries to steal your money. Yup, I was doing my expense report after taking clients here and noticed that the staff tacked on an additional $50 tip for themselves on top of the already hefty tip I left them. Good thing I kept my receipt. Now I get the pleasure of having to deal with the dispute with my bank.

I've taken two large groups of clients here in the past month, but after this I will never be back. Next time think about the lifetime value of a customer before trying to rip them off and steal from them.
author: Josh G.

description: So. Good. Best place to splurge on lunch. Happy we made a reservation. Every thing they had was delicious!
author: Mariah S.

description:
LOCATION - Small, a little cramped.  With the market table buffet you with think they would have wider lanes between tables for people moving to and from the market table.  That being said, if they try to sit you at one of those small tables near the market table either ask for a different table or be aware you will be in a high traffic area with people probably squeezing by you.  Nothing cool about someone's butt brushing the back of your head or something.  Thankfully I was in a booth but felt bad for those couples you could tell were on a date dealing with all that.  Also, the entrance is small and narrow and everyone waiting for a table looked uncomfortable.  I recommend making reservations whenever possible.  Other than being small, I do like the decor.  Views out the windows are of traffic and bums, but unfortunately that's most of San Francisco now.

MARKET TABLE BUFFET - Some of my favorites were the olives, mushrooms, blood oranges with mint, apple salad, caesar salad, salami, and smoked salmon.  Very flavorful.  You can tell quality ingredients were used.  Really recommend the apple salad - fresh, light and crispy.  I did not see any dishes empty or any dishes that looked like they had been sitting for a while.  

THE MEATS - Again, you can tell the quality of ingredients used.  Tender, juicy and flavorful.  It's hard to be disappointed at a Brazilian steakhouse because there are so many options, but every cut here was perfect.  My wife and I like medium - well temperature.  We asked one of the servers, just once, if he wouldn't mind coming back when he had a piece that was a little more well.  All it took was mentioning that just once and he must have communicated that to the other servers who already knew when they came our way to offer us the more "done" ends of meat.  Great service.  
Our favorites were the bacon wrapped filet, prime sirloin and chicken drummets.  I also like the garlic sirloin and if I had to say I had a least-favorite it would be the parmesan steak.  Just didn't like that particular mix of flavors.  The steaks were cooked to perfection - seared, crispy char on the outside, tender and juicy on the inside.  

The only reason I can't give a 5-star rating is because I've been to their Atlanta, GA location so I know that as good as this place is, it can be better.  The Atlanta location was perfect beginning to end and this location came up just a little short when compared.  But don't get me wrong, this place is great and a must-try.
author: Chino Z.

description: Feels quite different from the locations we've been to on east coast - the shrimp appetizer, fish options, fresh cut fruit at cold buffet area...but overall it's nice experience to be there and enjoy the great MEATS! :) staff are new but nice! Like it!
author: Yan C.

description: My boyfriend  and I went here for my birthday, this was our first time here, did not know what to expect. This place is really cool. The food is excellent and the servers that come to your table with the  different types of meet was real cool. Would  recommend  this place for a special occasion, I personally  cannot see my self going to eat here  as a regular  day.
author: Jevanie J.

description: since its opening in December 2015, I've come here a lot of times (probably on 10 or so occasions). I've enjoyed every visit but my last one during lunch on Friday (6/9) was fairly terrible. the restaurant was just severely understaffed. it took us 15 minutes to get seated (despite a reservation and a fairly uncrowded floor). we got no water refills and had to repeatedly ask for Pao de Queijo and polenta. as the feijoada bar was missing farofa, I asked our waitress to bring some to the table but she never did - despite 2 requests. there were also a lot of new gauchos. many of them were not cutting the meats properly (really butchering them, pun intended) so obviously not well trained. the restaurant also appears to have fallen back to the sad tactic of holding back the best cuts such as picanha while unleashing waves and waves of chicken drum sticks, sausages and recooked "garlic steak." just really sorely disappointed. I hope they fix things soon otherwise I'll have to stop coming to what was once one of my go-to restaurants. this was a 1-star experience but giving them 2.5 since they've been good in the past.
author: William Y.

description: Espetus is better. As other reviews have said, if you're going for the best bang for your Brazilian steakhouse buck, you'll get better quality, more flavorful meat. You also won't over pay for drinks. You'll also get a market bar with far more choices. I suppose I should just go write a review for Espetus instead...
author: Chris K.

description: The food was amazing. Great selection of meats and the market table was very fresh with an excellent variety. Service however leaves a lot to be desired. We made a reservation for 2 and when we arrived our table wasn't ready yet. That's ok- we went to the bar where neither  bartender even acknowledged our presence for the 10 minutes we were sitting there. Our pre-dinner cocktail never happened. Actually was never even ordered! As for our table- we ended up tucked away in a table towards the back that was fairly out of view and dwarfed by a large party next to us. The large table seemed to wait for nothing- a waiter was at their side whenever they seemed to need for anything. For us- not so much. We ordered our cocktails as soon as we sat down. We did not receive our drinks for 35 minutes. That is not an exaggeration. We figured they forgot them and since we barely saw a waiter we figured they forgot and just drank our water. When they finally arrived (as we were nearing the ending of our dinner) we said we weren't so sure we even wanted them. The waiter was able to comp them which was nice but I'd rather pay for the drinks and have them arrive when  I order them. My boyfriend asked no less than 3 waiters who came by to send over the bacon wrapped chicken. At least 15 minutes before we saw him. Only thing they were quick about was the check. I'll say this- "team" wait service doesn't work. If everyone is in charge no one is. The food was good enough to say that I'd consider returning however I just can't justify the per head cost if the service is going to be this bad.
author: Andrea S.

description: It is so delicious ,I had a great time in the party, chicken and steak are the best. And the waiters are nice to us too.
author: Grace Song-En C.

description: This place was amazing.  We were greeted with the most nicest staff and the warmest fire place.  We had reservations at 9pm because we worked prior to getting there and the place was still pack but there was no wait.  Stewart was our server and he took great care of us.   He was very knowledgable and helpful because my three year old son has food allergies and we weren't expecting for him to be able to eat the food there and we always pack a dinner for him.  But we found out that most of the meats were seasoned with salt and so my was able to eat there and it turned out to be the best dining for us in a while.  Our server went out of his way to get steamed brocolli prepared allergen friendly for my son.  Once we got my son settled with his food I was able to enjoy my food and everything was so delicious and grilled perfectly and seasoned well and the market salad bar was very fresh.  I couldn't stop eating.  We also had the turtle cheese cake which was so decadent and the perfect ending to our meal.  My son with food allergy was surprised by some cut up strawberries and blueberries, which are his favorite fruit and dessert because he is so limited to what he can eat and I almost cried because Stewart was so thoughtful to ask someone to make that for my son and the person who made it was also amazing, my son gobbled the fruits in less than one minute.  We truly are so thankful for this experience that my son was able to eat food here without having to speak to a manager or a chef before he can eat, all the wait staff were so friendly and helpful.
author: Austi And London's Mommy N.

description: Maybe because it was Christmas Day and it was full and they were short staffed, but the meat service was limited.  They hardly came around when requested.  The usually excellent staff could not give the personalized service they are famous for.  The quality of food and drinks was excellent and we were seated promptly.  You must make reservations.
author: Emilia G.

description: I have been to Fogo de Chão in other cities but this place is the worst. No Brazilian atmosphere and the meat was mediocre. This is likely to be my last visit.
author: Hiroshi M.

description: The ambiance was great. The meat was fantastic. Mashed potatoes not so much. The side bar wasn't that great either. Our waitress was rude and acted like we were taking her time but all the ppl cutting the meat were polite. For the price it was a great experience
author: Jonathan A.

description: Made reservations a month after opening for my boyfriend and I to try out. Thought it was ok and even considered coming back until i saw they charged my card TWICE for a single visit withing a 3 week period. WTF! Now i have to go through the hassle of getting the second charge reversed cause someone fucked up!
author: MJ G.

description: Loved the place and the food! Everything was delicious from salads to desert! The ambiance is great, music and decoration! The service is perfect! You never wait too long but it's not overwhelming either! I will definitely come back!
author: Yael C.

description: My wife and I came to this place Sunday lunch. My wife read some reviews and she was a bit hesitant. But our experience was great. We had top notch service. The staff were very friendly and made sure we are taken care of. The speed of bringing new cut of meat was so fast we could hardly keep up. We had to turn our card red so we can breath. They brought us all kind of meat and we specifically asked. Our waiter Henry was very attentive and funny. The salad bars was fresh and meats were good and tender. Every five minutes we had some one in our table pouring wine and water. Over all great experience.
author: Alireza A.

description: Really nice staff. They are really friendly and work like a team. Being that it was just recently opened, we could tell the staff was trained well. The food was very beautiful. Each bite was to perfection. I really enjoyed the bacon wrapped filet. Oh my goodness it was the best. The thought of the Market being the side buffet is so cute. My tip is to save room for dessert. From the creme brûlée to the chocolate volcano, was on point. We loved each bite. A very fabulous way to end the meal.
author: Jaydon I.

description: Food is always great. I've been here several times since they've opened. But I was there last weekend and the service by Leo was particularly amazing. He asked what cuts we wanted and actually remembered, and would come back to give updates on eta for those specific cuts. Usually they just walk around and if you see what you want, you get what you see. But Leo made it a point to precisely deliver what we wanted, right out of the kitchen. I'll come back more just for Leo.
author: Ted L.

description: If I could give zero I would. The bartender/waiter was beyond disrespectful. Don't waste your time. You can find better service a Jack in the Box. The management is like dealing with preschoolers.  I've never been so uncomfortable or disrespected in my life. I ware you. Don't bother.  The service sucks.
author: Apryl R.

description: The most amazing human being Miley went above and beyond in the customer services department. We held dinner reservations for 2 and my associate is disabled w MS. Dinner and the service she applied tonight were over the moon. She helped her to her seat with ease and compassion. which she cried but wait that's not all throughout the meal every staff person allowed her to photograph service and took the time to explain the menu and items at the stations. Even the gaucho servers took their time with her. This is first time we have been to dinner. She was extremely nervous about being a bother. Miley at the end of a very well orchestrated dinner service called us a taxi and PICKED her up from her chair i truly mean  UP AND CARRIED HER TO THE TAXI then placed her inside. Like it was nothing oMG i have never been so impressed with the display of compassion for another human being it was beyond the five stars the restored my love on NON FRANCHISED restaurants. I will secure each and every business lunch to this establishment from this day forward because of her. You made my night and hers. She cried all the way home. I have been restore w thankfulness on thanksgiving.
author: Lillian G.

description:
Omg... Amazing experience ... We fell in love with the Chicago location and was stoke for the New SF location! Usually we do not expect much from the staff of a brand new restaurant, but we were impressed with the SF staff. The service was impeccable from the hostess who checked us in to bartenders and our waiter- Carlos. The bartenders are well trained and knows their liquor. Amazing especially when they were just trained about a week ago. Watching the servers who also doubles roasters moving & working in sync is a show in itself. Amazing that they know exactly when to take out the meat with each server/roaster  moving in/out of the 'kitchen' like ants hard at work. The salad bar is fantastic for non-meat eater. There is a brown sugar maple bacon that is to die for!!!! We loved the meat because it is not covered up with all kinds of herb/spice. They season it lightly without taking away the true taste of the meat ..and loved that we did not leave needing to quench our thirst. Save room for the dessert - loved the cheesecake and creme brûlée ! Make sure you get the picanha, New York & filet mignon! And be sure to have a caipirinha !

And to clarify - I was fortunate enough to attend the soft opening !
author: Jay S.

description: Attended a large birthday gathering here last weekend.  The food was delicious and the service was great for such a big party.  The filet mignon was perfect as well as the cocktails.  Total with tip was $90/person.  Don't fill up on the buffet because they'll keep coming with the meat until you explode!  Would go back again on a completely empty stomach.
author: Penny Q.

description: From beginning to end, the service was impecable! The food is tasty, the drinks are scrumptious and the atmosphere was vibrant! Will defo return for special occasions ... thank you to our wonderful waiter, Fernando and our beef eater Stewart!!
author: Susana Q.

description: Not sure why my family brought me here my first night in SF, but I don't eat beef, pork, or chicken. The salad bar was nice and the service was good. Seemed pricey for a salad bar, to be honest. I don't really eat a lot. This is definitely a place you go if you have an elastic stomach.
author: None O.

description: Great, service delicious food. Walked in on New Years eve and they acomadated us quickly. Great time!
author: Tyrone B.

description: I probably would have given this another star to be generous but by the end of our meal the irritation factor had me feeling like they only deserved one star. The decor is nice and the layout is such that the noise level is held to a pleasant level for conversation even though the space feels quite open which usually makes for a louder environment. The salad bar was laid out nicely and it was clean and well stocked. The salad dressings were all bad. They tasted like cheap bottled dressing and even the Caesar dressing was sweet. The salad bar would get 3 stars the dressing 1 star. This place is expensive and their menu leads you to believe that there's a reason they charge what they do, however the reality was sadly lacking. The wait staff service was almost non existent I kept my wine glass because I decided I might splurge on a glass of red once the meal got underway. It was probably 45 minutes before I was able to get the attention of a server (not ours) and request a glass. The meats that were brought around were for the most part cheaper cuts certainly not the filet mignon the menu boasted. Never saw pork roast and leg of lamb didn't come around until we'd been there an hour or more. What did come around 4 or 5 times was the house specialty which was a folded steak that varied between quite tough to pretty ok but didn't have a lot of flavor. The best cut was a bottom round. They had turkey at a side board but it was brined and bordered on lunch meat. At the very end of our meal they came around with a bacon wrapped filet mignon nugget. It was a dry hard lump of gristle that bore no resemblance to filet mignon. No one ever came around to see if I wanted a second glass of wine or anything else for that matter. No dirty plates were cleared as the meal progressed. We sat forever after our meal was done before our original server came around to ask halfheartedly if we wanted dessert. We asked if the dessert was complimentary  (someone on yelp posted their tab that showed complimentary dessert). She said that it was so we figured what the heck. We didn't have much hope that the dessert would be good but since it was included in the price of the meal we decided to give it a try. The desserts were as canned tasting as the salad dressings. 30 minutes later after we flagged someone down to beg for our tab, our waitress brought our bill and we were charged full price for the desserts. After another long wait she finally came back and we questioned the charge since we only ordered because she said it was complimentary. She asked if it was a special occasion and as it turned out we there for a birthday (and it was Thanksgiving). She took the bill away and some time later it was brought back by someone else with one charge removed. We were there for a total of 2 1/2 hours maybe a bit more. A grueling length of time to spend over mediocre food and truly lousy service. I would gladly have skipped the $25 spent on bad dessert and the extra 40 minutes we spent there that we could have spent enjoying ourselves over a really nice cup of coffee somewhere else. By the time I left I was in a really bad mood--not the way you want to feel after dropping $200 on a meal for 2
author: Patricia B.

description: Horrible service! We went today on thanksgiving and we showed up at our reservation time which was 3:00. Me my husband and our two kids. We seated at 3:15. Which is fine. But it was still pretty dead. We have been here for 2 hrs and have hardly had any meat come to our table. Maybe a total of 4 different types of meat. We are extremely disappointed in this service. We didn't come to eat the "sides" we came to eat the different  meats.  We only had 3 different types of food come to our table and one of them came twice. I was expecting a lot more options "especially for what we paid" the meat they bring by are bite size so we are still hungry and we are now leaving! Way to pricey for not getting what we paid for. Very sad. We will not be coming back. Very very disappointing
author: melissa k.

description:
Fogo de Chao, what an awesome dinner! I had been wanting to try them out for a while now, but just hadn't made it in yet. One of my friends knows the manager there (shout out to Mayley, thank you for making our dining experience fun and memorable!) so we asked for her upon arrival since we wanted to introduce ourselves. She brought us to our table and not only started us off with complimentary round of their delicious signature Caipirinhas but also a tasty sauteed prawn appetizer! Extremely generous gesture and made us feel welcomed immediately. 
The salad bar is over the top, quite an impressive selection of fresh veggies, cheeses and charcuterie...but I was trying my best to save room for all of the meat. 
We enjoyed our app and salads and then it was time for the main course. As soon as we flipped over our card to green the Gauchos started approaching at our table with fresh cuts of every type of meat imaginable. From top sirloin to rib rye, tender filet mignon and bacon wrapped chicken, they certainly did not disappoint. I was pacing myself since I, of course, had to taste them all. Mayley also brought out a side of their house-made chimichurri sauce, nothing short of amazing - highly recommend to go with the steak. The bartender even recommended red wines to pair with our entrees, I tried their own label (Fogo de Chao) malbec - super smooth and paired perfectly with the meats. 
After a flavorful and enjoyable dining experience, we moved to the bar for dessert and a night cap. Overall, Fogo de Chao succeeds in all the important categories -- from service, to atmosphere and of course the high quality food. I highly recommend adding this to the top of you SF restaurant list, you definitely won't be disappointed.
author: Alison W.

description: What a great place they just opened last week so we thought we would try this place the food is amazing. Service first class and they keep bringing the food   The ribeye was out standing. Sara was awesome. She is such a great and keep us laughing all night long. Plus we were not rushed   Met the nete  he show us the ropes and took care of us this is a must try
author: Mike E.

description: Best service by staff, ever. Meats cooked to perfection. Jose's was dead on about the Rack of Lamb. Never ending Meats. Drinks are wonderfully created by Bartenders. Kendra was a wonderful waitress, she made the evening Perfect.
author: Robert H.

description: Incredible service and the staff is all very friendly and excited to be working there. I really enjoyed the bacon wrapped filet mignon and the fresh sliced tomatoes with mozzarella. Also the Malbec from Argentina was fantastic.
author: Sean C.

description: Any restaurant that advertises using adware in a video game is a special level of pathetic.
author: Yvonne D.

description: First time at this restaurant. Four (4) teenage boys who had nothing to eat for three days! Just kidding. The food was excellent...The service was great and the ambience was cool. Even cool enough for the boys. kinda pricey. Over $400 for a table of six. No alcohol.
author: Daryl B.

description: This restaurant is amazing , great food , great service and very friendly environment I would recommend to come here for anyone !! They also care very much about customers opinions and experiences!!
author: Yesenia R.

description: My third time at this place and I never leave disappointed...service is great, they bring whatever cut you want and to the done-ness (is that a word?) of your liking. The passion fruit caipirinha is fantastic and you will feel it (wait until you stand up). So much meat...so much happiness :) and don't forget the papaya creme for dessert...you have never tasted anything like it. Bravo!
author: Jennifer C.

description: It's hard to go wrong with meats at a Brazilian steakhouse, so this 2-star review is more a comparison to Espetus (SF and San Mateo) and for the service. First, they gave us the worst table in the house, literally next to the kitchen entrance. We had reservations and did not walk it. Figured with reservation they would put us at a better location but I guess not. Second, I think their salad bar selection was not as good/large as the Espetus. Third, and most important, their servers did not let us try out all their meats. They kept bringing us the same selections of meats over and over again, while other meats like parmesan pork they never brought by. We finally noticed all these other meats going around and had to ask them to bring it over, but by then we were pretty full already so it wasn't very enjoyable. The whole point is trying out all the meats but their system of bringing the meats over left us only with half the selection.
author: Tinou B.

description: Fogo de Chao was great. We loved the Market Bar (salad bar). It contained the not so usual salad bar items. Great chicken and apple salads, pickled vegetables,  parmesan in the largest wheel I've ever seen and so much more. We enjoyed the great guys who came around with the large selection of meats. Everything was delicious. We'll return.
author: Barbara H.

description: Excellent salad lunch buffet.  Extensive selection.  Very good value.  Beatify surroundings and pleasant service.
author: Yella W.

description: Came for Valentine's Day and I don't think I could have picked a better place to dine. The place is really pretty and from the hostess booth ...to the table the staff were very nice and attentive. When we were seated at our table our waiter explain the sides at the salad bar....the red & green heart shaped chips and went to get us water. Before he could even return to get our drink order a manager came over and greeted us and took my drink order. #service!!!!! Our waiter was Brian. He was there every time I looked up asking was everything OK and did I need anything. I like not having to LOOK for our waiter so that was an A++ for me. We ate until there was no room in our stomach! Another gentleman I would like to mention was Stewart he was kind and very friendly. He stopped by our table a time or 2 to check on us and we laughed with him because he asked my boyfriend was he throwing in the towel already and my boyfriend asked him for a wheelchair. The food was AWESOME... the hot sides that Brian randomly brought out were a delight. We had a wonderful time last night and thank you!! We will be back.
author: Samaki B.

description: Had the pleasure of going to this establishment Saturday night for my daughters birthday.  There was a group of 8 of us and my first time at a Brazilian Steakhouse.  Can I tell you that this place was the 'VERY BEST' in food, atmosphere, and customer service.  A young lady by the name of "Mahelly Ferreira" had the most pleasant personality, and was so attentive to our needs that she and the staff have to be commended!!!!!! OMG we had one of the best times ever!  The salad bar is amazing, and the continuous 'meat' was astonishing!!!! The servers were so nice, pleasant, and the atmosphere is awesome!!!!!!! We were late, due to traffic on the bridge, but they still let us in, and were wonderful.  The food was exemplary, especially the 'bacon wrapped filet mignon" was to die for!!!!!  I just loved the place, food, and especially the kind servers.  You can go to any restaurant to eat, but if the customer service 'stinks' it doesn't matter what the food taste like, because you never go back!!!! The whole establishment was AWESOME!!!!!!!  Kudos to the staff at Fogo de Chao, you are the BEST!!!!
author: Karen F.

description:
First off, I have not dined here yet; but the initial phone call to them makes me wonder if I will.  We received a complementary "lunch or dinner" according to the sleeve of the gift card; which I always appreciate.  I am not a big "coupon" user, but this restaurant sounded attractive to my husband and I, since he works nearby in SF.  I noticed the card itself, stated "lunch".  So I phoned and asked, anticipating that b/c of what the initial writing stated, they'd honor it for dinner as well.  Not so: according to a fairly apathetic employee who I spoke with, mid-afternoon, so I assume it wasn't too busy.  
NOT a great first impression, for a fairly new restaurant in SF!  She said the manager may approve but she doesn't know...no follow up on her part, with an offer to get the manager.  Makes me wonder if we'll venture into this restaurant, if they cannot honor the cards/specials they are handing out.
author: Joan C.

description: This place has the same concept as espetus but I think it did way better than my previous experience at espetus. Fogo had great service from right when I walked in. The host greeted me and my boyfriend with a smile and let us know that we can wait at the bar til our table is ready. The bartender was brilliant and attentive to our questions about the details of Fogo. I believe his name was JohnJohn. He persuaded me into ordering a great "buttery" Chardonnay he said. The host sat us within 10 min of waiting. Our serverS were all attentive as well. Reason why I say plural, is because multiple servers served our table. It was an excellent experience, I recommend this place over espetus anytime of the year
author: Nancy C.

description: Great food and service. Bit pricey but definitely worth the price. All you can eat everything, so save room in your stomach to enjoy the most variety of different things.
author: J Y.

description: Dining at Fogo de Chão, San Francisco, is more than just eating a meal - it is embarking on a culinary journey. When we first entered the restaurant we were warmly greeted by the staff and directed to our table. I was instantly impressed with the nautical décor that matches the location perfectly. Shortly after being seated, we were warmly greeted by the General Manager and Restaurant Manager. This set the tone for the remainder of our dinner service. We were treated to some of the best cuts of meat, with the Gauchos paying special attention to how each person at the table preferred their cuts prepared. We enjoyed discovering all of the special dishes and world class salad bar. All throughout our culinary experience, the Managers repeatedly checked on us and provide exceptional customer service. We truly felt that we experienced the best of Brazilian hospitality and now we consider Fogo de Chão as our extended family.
author: Catalin B.

description: I usually eat at Espetus in San Mateo, but since it was a birthday, we decided to change things up. It was a Tuesday during noon,  it took 15 minutes to seat a party of 5. I should have saw the warning signs when we got seated. You are literally back to back with other people. There is no personal space. Even if there are other tables, they will seat you in one area for their own convenience. Our server greeted us and asked if what we would like to drink-- we never got them so after 15 minutes we had to ask another server for our drinks. The soda we had was in a tiny glass bottle. The second soda was the standard can. Why am I paying for the little one when I can get the big one? Overall, the service was terrible. I had my green sign on for 20 minutes at one point and no on came to me. Eventually someone noticed and asked what cut I would like, and even so it took another 10 minutes for me to get son meat on the table. So much more expensive than Espetus. Save your money and stress and eat somewhere where they actually care about the customers. One star for a decent wait time and another star for mediocre food. Other than that, I am so terribly disappointed to have eaten at such a place. The only reason this place has a decent amount of stars is the location.
author: Kaelin N.

description: Nice atmosphere. However, the meat at Espetus is more tender and flavorful. Also our waitress was trying to rush us into moving to dessert, but she left us alone once she got the message.
author: Monica R B.

description: Food is delicious and flocked with flavor! The meat is tender and juicy. Dessert taste fresh and their market plate is so yummy! Definitely going back!
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Great service! I barely put my drink down and it was refilled or dishes cleared within seconds. Great selection of sides. I'd give 5 stars but the one in Las Vegas blew me away! We went early during HH and they didn't honor the 1/2 off drinks even while dining in the restaurant. Something they should consider. However, a very nice experience.
author: kelly y.

description: Have frequented this restaurant in Scottsdale, AZ for many special occasions.  Its pricey but also delicious!  Can't resist the gluten free warm cheese bread and hot polenta sticks.  Keep them coming.  Our favorites are: prime rib, garlic steak, fillet tenderloin, and lamb chops.  The salad bar is wonderful!  Need to be careful not to fill up on it.  Very tempting, love their lox & kale salad with basil dressing.  Many times during holidays, they will provide you with a $50 gift card to be used for lunch or dinner at another time.  We just keep going back.
author: Elaine D.

description: Was there yesterday along with 6 other friends.  The most horrible experience in a long time.  2 servers kept asking us for drink orders... asked three times for lemons, nothing...side dishes were cold... buffet was pretty ok, liked the soup option.... meats options were many, but very similar in taste, but Very FATTY...yuck.... but the worst of all was the check out... Took about one hour to sort out the billing and still had it wrong... One day later I am not sure how much I got charged for my one Marketside Full Experience with a glass of water meal.... Put the transaction through, put another transaction through, then got a credit for the wrong amount, and in the end girl said she was not sure what she did, and could not fix it.... So, I will have to check my credit card receipt, see what I got charged and then try to dispute it or fix it on the back end.... Most weird experience,...
author: Mirela D.

description:
I work for the 2nd largest employer in the Bay area with campuses all over the city.  I went here yesterday with 15 of my colleagues and was promptly seated as we arrived.  Bar one guest, We all ordered the lunch (meats brought to the table) with the other guest ordering fish.  It took 30-40 mins for the fish to arrive, during which time my colleague was offered a bite off my plate to try the meat and to stave her hunger a little.  Immediately, the maitre d' stepped forward and explained that if we continue to share food we would be charged another lunch plate (@ $36.95 plus tax)!  Unbelievable(she took the order so knew we were waiting for her meal) and embarrassing to be admonished in this way in front of colleagues!  I should mention the fish meal was more expensive than the lunch @ $42.95 plus tax, MUCH smaller (like a McDonald fillet!) and not sure if related but the guest was ill later that evening.  The entire bill excluding alcoholic beverages came to $989.54 for 15 people, so you can see we were not trying to get a free meal! As I'm giving a review.... the selection of meats on the menu were not all available or had to be asked for specifically and all were a little oily and fatty. The salad bar was excellent as were the wait staff in general. Deserts took another 30 mins to arrive after ordering and came with a free thick (pubic?) hair. Particular desert was replaced (less the hair) but not comped or coffee on house nothing. 

Was it busy? Only what you would expect at a downtown restaurant at lunch time next to the conference center, and the main reason for choosing this higher end restaurant was it was of a size/ rating I thought they could handle that easily. As I said before I work for the 2nd largest employer in the Bay area of which I mentioned to the person I spoke with today when I called to voice my concerns.  While apologetic, again my expectations were not met (at least the cost of the fish and desert to be discounted back to the card) but no offer made except reasons why they were not up to par.  If it's too hot in the kitchen .......!

The ambiance was nice and food nice but will we recommend to our faculty ... probably, but with notes from our experience and no if the attendees are business guests or people of note.

UPDATE: Just checked the receipt, we actually did get charged an extra lunch at $36.95!  Called the restaurant and again tried to talk with the manager and again told not available...hmmmm. They are going to refund but not a word of apology.  If you are the manager and reading this please contact me.
author: Simon S.

description: Just had dinner here with my two daughters. All I have to say is wow! From the staff to the food. Everything was just immaculate. I cannot wait to come back here! Such a new little gem and wins best Brazilian steak house in sf in my mind!
author: Jay V.

description: Went here last night for a pre-birthday dinner and had a blast. The wait staff were wonderful and attentive. The cheese bread was to die for and the meat selections were exquisite. Could not have had a better time.
author: Jason B.

description: We were driving by looking for a restaurant to eat at and noticed this new spot had opened up I've only eaten at this restaurant once in Arizona but we thought we give it a shot I will say it's a little pricey at $60 per person but my God do you get a lot of food it's very tasty it's amazing service . I wish I got the managers name but he was such a nice guy I asked him how much the shrimp cocktail was he told me 1995 but then sent me one for free what a great welcome gift for someone eating here for the first time .  Sarah was my server and she was fabulous though she forgot my Diet Coke a couple times she deafly made up for it at the end.   The atmosphere and the Decour in here is brand-new and it's beautiful the fireplace adds a nice touch we came in at 9:30 they closed at 10 we left at 11:30 we were the last table and honestly they never tried to rush us out once I felt like we could've stayed there another hour and they wouldn't of said a word.  I will be back as a spot will be one of my new favorites in San Francisco
author: Brad L.

description: No offense for Chevy's which was at this location before but I'm very happy to see Fogo de Chão here now. I found the quality of the meat better that others Brazilian restaurants from the Bay Area. And for vegetarians (even if this is not really the right place for them) the salad bar is very good, and the cheesy breads are awesome.
author: JP C.

description: My wife & I both work in the neighborhood and were delighted to see Fogo going up around the corner. Our first experience was on a Saturday night and I was blown away at how busy they were. The place was humming and everyone seemed to be thoroughly enjoying themselves. Surprisingly we got seated pretty quickly and quickly had a waiter come to ask us had we been there before. The choices are Market Table (salad bar), the full meat with salad bar or fish. Everywhere you see the servers walking from the kitchen around the restaurant with their skewers of fresh sizzling meat. They start you off with the traditional Brazilian light & fluffy cheese breads without you even asking. My wife got the meat with salad bar & I had to try the fish (sea bass). The Market Table was as beautiful as it was tasty with many high quality options. While it was easy to fill up on salad you know that something special is coming so don't get carried away. They were out of our selected merlot half bottle but we were happy with the cabernet substitute. They bring you unlimited cheese bread & sides of mashed potatoes, fried potenta sticks & carmelized bananas (apparently a meal staple in Brazil).Don't come here when you are in a hurry. Take your time to savour the ambiance, the different food courses and and beautiful evening. OK, so it was raining outside, but inside, we felt like we were celebrating something special. I was surprised at the large selection of desserts. Most nice restaurants have 3 or 4. They had 8 or 10. But by that time my wife & I knew that we had to share. The table next to us was not messing around and they all got different things but we enjoyed sharing our dessert selection. If you haven't noticed, we had a great time and literally can't wait to go back. I would give it 10 stars if I could. Treat yourself to impress an important business client, for a special occasion or just because you deserve it.
author: bruce f.

description: This place is great as good as it gets, love the decor!!!!! Great place to bring you friends resonable  price for what you get.
author: Danny T.

description: I was excited to try this place out! As a native Brazilian, I value a good churrasco. Fogo de Chao does not disappoint. The market place selection is fresh and delicious. There is a feijoada bar as well. The meat selection is great. Overall they were delicious, especially the picanha and filet mignon with bacon. And the appetizers are so good as well! I love the pao de queijo and banana. Try their lemonade. it's amazing!!! We had the tres leches for dessert and it was by far the best tres leches cake I've ever had. Yes, the price is expensive, but it is totally worth it. Fogo de chao is not only about the food options, but the whole experience. It's a fiun place to go with a large group or celebrate a special date. On top of delicious food, the service is superb and the ambiance is very comfortable and of great taste. I loved the attention to detail (such as their silverware). Upon leaving, grab a  free piece of chocolate if you can fit in your belly. A+++++++
author: V P.

description: I love Fogo de Chao and I have been to many locations.  Their new digs in SF will not disappoint!  The cuisine and service are spectacular and in-line or better than past visits at other locations.  The decor and dining room finishes are a step-up as well.  It looks like there is still some work to be done physically on the exterior.  This was previously a Chevy's location and they had a great patio along Third Street and it looks like Fogo has plans for that space as well.  This is a huge upgrade for this intersection and a welcome addition to the neighborhood.  Neighboring hotels include Park Central San Francisco, W San Francisco and the St. Regis and Yelp is HQ'ed around the corner as well!  SFMOMA is about to unveil a half-billion dollar expansion across the street and Moscone Convention Center is undergoing a mammoth transformation as well.  Lots and lots of drivers to help make this new location a hit.  Best of luck Fogo; I love you guys and I hope you knock it out of the park!
author: Mike B.
